tls:text.tls:line: As for the Way,

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:text.tls:line: it covers the heavens and supports the earth,

sense.def: cover in order to protect what is covered, or sometimes to hide discreetly

tls:text.tls:line: it covers the heavens and supports the earth,
Extends beyond the Four Regions
Extends beyond the Four Regions

sense.def: all the Four Regions, the whole world; all sorts of places

tls:text.tls:line: It cuts beyond the eight points of the compass.

sense.def: the eight point of the compass

tls:text.tls:line: It cuts beyond the eight points of the compass.
It is high beyond reach;
It is high beyond reach;

sense.def: have a limit set to, be limited by something/anything

tls:text.tls:line: It is deep beyond fathoming;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: It envelops Heaven and Earth,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: It envelops Heaven and Earth,

sense.def: Heaven and Earth as metaphysical entities

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: And it endows what is (still) shapeless.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: What was empty slowly becomes full;

sense.def: slowly, softly, gently; with slow emphasis; at one's own pace, gradually

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: First turbid and then surging forward,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: What was murky slowly becomes clear.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, stand it up vertically, and it stuffs up the heavens and the earth;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, stand it up vertically, and it stuffs up the heavens and the earth;

sense.def: to fill up (a certain space); to be filled in (somewhere)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: Lay it horizontally on its side, and it fills the four seas.

sense.def: cause to become horisontal; lay out horisontally;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: Lay it horizontally on its side, and it fills the four seas.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: yet is without morning or evening. (and it has no ebb and tide)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: Unroll it, and it blankets the six directions;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: Unroll it, and it blankets the six directions;

sense.def: the six elements constrututing the universe; the whole world in all its dimensions from east to west, south to north, below to above

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: Roll it up, and it is less than a handful.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: Roll it up, and it is less than a handful.

sense.def: fill up; make up (a number, as many as ten etc) 盈於

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: Roll it up, and it is less than a handful.

sense.def: hand, fist (insofar as these may be used as "containers")

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: Compact, it can stretch out; (or: cause things to expand)

sense.def: be restrained and non-expansive; be inhibited

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: Dark, it can be bright; (or: make things bright)

sense.def: be dark and shady, be secluded

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: Dark, it can be bright; (or: make things bright)

sense.def: become bright; be lit up by

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: It stretches over the four cables holding up the heavens, and harbors within itself the yin and the yang; (含 does not mean "restrain")

sense.def: the four extremes of the compass-circle: northeast, southeast, southwest and northwest, according to HNZ 3.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: It stretches over the four cables holding up the heavens, and harbors within itself the yin and the yang; (含 does not mean "restrain")

sense.def: hold in one's mouth> encompass; have within one, contain

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: It broadens the cosmos and brightens the sun, the moon, and the stars.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: It broadens the cosmos and brightens the sun, the moon, and the stars.

sense.def: the universe of space and time (according to HNZ "the (cosmic) eaves and rafters" 高誘 注："宇，屋簷也；宙，棟梁也。")

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 1; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61;

tls:text.tls:line: It broadens the cosmos and brightens the sun, the moon, and the stars.

sense.def: demonstrate; publicise, show up for what something is (loan for 彰); make visible

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61f;

tls:text.tls:line: †It is the thinnest of gruels,†

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61f;

tls:text.tls:line: †It is the thinnest of gruels,†

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61f;

tls:text.tls:line: The finest and most subtle texture.

sense.def: be thin and fine 甚纖

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61f;

tls:text.tls:line: By virtue of it, mountains are high;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61f;

tls:text.tls:line: By virtue of it, abysses are deep;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61f;

tls:text.tls:line: By virtue of it, animals run; (NOT: can run)

sense.def: generally: four-legged animal of a certain size which are liable to run away when hunted; 百獸"all manner of wild animals"; NB: one may also rear wild animals in parks 養獸

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61f;

tls:text.tls:line: By virtue of it, animals run; (NOT: can run)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61f;

tls:text.tls:line: By virtue of it, birds fly; (NOT: can fly)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.01.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/3; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 61f;

tls:text.tls:line: By virtue of it, the unicorn rambles about,

sense.def: wander about; be on a pleasure trip; take a pleasure trip; roam freely

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: Got hold of the handle of dao

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: And stood at the center.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: And stood at the center.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: In spirit they roamed together with the demiurge of transformation (the transformations of things)

sense.def: substantial and typically irreversible transformation into something new; natural transformation

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: In spirit they roamed together with the demiurge of transformation (the transformations of things)

sense.def: wander about; be on a pleasure trip; take a pleasure trip; roam freely

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: To bring peace to the world.

sense.def: to pacify, bring peace to, look well after the concerns of; euphemistic for "subjugate"

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: To bring peace to the world.

sense.def: all the Four Regions, the whole world; all sorts of places

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence (working the handles of dao), they can: Move like the heavens and stay still like the earth.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence (working the handles of dao), they can: Move like the heavens and stay still like the earth.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence (working the handles of dao), they can: Move like the heavens and stay still like the earth.

sense.def: stay in place; be delayed in; get stuck in, be unable to leave, remain in against one's will

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: Turning like a wheel without flagging,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: Flowing like water without cease,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: They begin and end at the same time as the myriad things.

sense.def: go through cyclic transformations or changes

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: Just as when the wind rises, the clouds steam forth,

sense.def: by the wind ??; in the wind; like the wind

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: Just as when the wind rises, the clouds steam forth,

sense.def: in massive numbers like clouds; floating about like clouds

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: Just as when the thunder crashes, the rain falls,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: Just as when the thunder crashes, the rain falls,

sense.def: make noise, give off a sound

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: Just as when the thunder crashes, the rain falls,

sense.def: descend from heaven (the dew of the dharma etc)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: Just as when the thunder crashes, the rain falls,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: Ghosts appear, gods disappear, (Like spirits, like the lightning) (LeBlanc comes closer: avec la rapidité des esprits et des manes)

sense.def: like a ghost, like a spirit

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: Ghosts appear, gods disappear, (Like spirits, like the lightning) (LeBlanc comes closer: avec la rapidité des esprits et des manes)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: Like the potter's wheel spinning, like the hub whirling,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: Like the potter's wheel spinning, like the hub whirling,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: Like the potter's wheel spinning, like the hub whirling,

sense.def: like the hub of a wheel

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: Like the potter's wheel spinning, like the hub whirling,

sense.def: revolve, turn round and round; billow

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: Going full circle they start going round again.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: They return to being an uncarved block.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 63;

tls:text.tls:line: They return to being an uncarved block.

sense.def: (what is pure >) pristine state, original state

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 65;

tls:text.tls:line: Doing what they did with no ulterior motive,

sense.def: by the method of non-assertive action

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 65;

tls:text.tls:line: Doing what they did with no ulterior motive,

sense.def: cognate object; indefinite dummy object pronouns without reference: things, people; someone 以約失之者"Those who, through keeping to the main thing, get things wrong"

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 65;

tls:text.tls:line: they accorded with dao;

sense.def: come to conform to, conform to; be in accordance with; be in conformity with

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 65;

tls:text.tls:line: saying what they said with no ulterior motive,

sense.def: by the method of non-assertive action

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 65;

tls:text.tls:line: saying what they said with no ulterior motive,

sense.def: cognate object; indefinite dummy object pronouns without reference: things, people; someone 以約失之者"Those who, through keeping to the main thing, get things wrong"

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 65;

tls:text.tls:line: they were in communion with de;

sense.def: understand properly, have a sharp understanding of

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 65;

tls:text.tls:line: happy and easy with no sense of self-importance,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 65;

tls:text.tls:line: happy and easy with no sense of self-importance,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 65;

tls:text.tls:line: happy and easy with no sense of self-importance,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 65;

tls:text.tls:line: what they gained was in harmony;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 65;

tls:text.tls:line: they yet accorded with each of these things in their various natures;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 65;

tls:text.tls:line: their spirits resided in the tiniest tip of an autumn down,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 3; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 65;

tls:text.tls:line: Their de embraced the heavens and the earth and brought harmony to the yin and the yang,

sense.def: be in harmony with; comply nicely with; stay in harmony with;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 3; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 65;

tls:text.tls:line: Their de embraced the heavens and the earth and brought harmony to the yin and the yang,

sense.def: establish harmonious relations with; make harmonious, bring proper harmony to; pacify

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 3; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 65;

tls:text.tls:line: Ordered the four seasons and regulated the five phases.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 3; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 65;

tls:text.tls:line: Ordered the four seasons and regulated the five phases.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 3; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 65;

tls:text.tls:line: They produced the myriad things in all their variety.

sense.def: in a flock, together; by groups

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 3; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 65;

tls:text.tls:line: They provided moistening nourishment to the grasses and trees

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 3; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 65;

tls:text.tls:line: Children were not orphaned,

sense.def: mere (uncapped) adolescent, little brat; boy; (but note that the word can also refer to a girl)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.02.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 3; ed. ICS 1992, 1/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 65;

tls:text.tls:line: Children were not orphaned,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.03.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 6; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 3; ed. ICS 1992, 1/19; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 67;

tls:text.tls:line: The primordial dao:

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.03.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 6; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 3; ed. ICS 1992, 1/19; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 67;

tls:text.tls:line: Engenders the myriad things without appropriating them,

sense.def: have; own by right; have in one's possession or control

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.03.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 6; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 3; ed. ICS 1992, 1/19; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 67;

tls:text.tls:line: Moulds things into various shapes by the process of transformation without claiming stewardship over them.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.03.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 6; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 4; ed. ICS 1992, 1/19; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 67;

tls:text.tls:line: Creatures moving about on legs and breathing through their mouths,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.03.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 6; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 4; ed. ICS 1992, 1/19; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 67;

tls:text.tls:line: Creatures moving about on legs and breathing through their mouths,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.03.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 6; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 4; ed. ICS 1992, 1/19; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 67;

tls:text.tls:line: insects wriggling and flying about

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.03.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 6; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 4; ed. ICS 1992, 1/19; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 67;

tls:text.tls:line: Collapsing it does not make it shorter;

sense.def: cause to collapse> ruin and destroy; dismantle; ruin (a person)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.03.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 6; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 4; ed. ICS 1992, 1/19; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 67;

tls:text.tls:line: Adding to it does not make it more numerous,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.03.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 6; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 4; ed. ICS 1992, 1/19; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 67;

tls:text.tls:line: Whittling it away does not meke it thinner,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.03.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 6; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 4; ed. ICS 1992, 1/19; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 67;

tls:text.tls:line: Boring into it does not make it deeper,

sense.def: dig (a hole in the ground, a cave etc)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.03.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 6; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 4; ed. ICS 1992, 1/19; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 67;

tls:text.tls:line: Filling it in does not make it shallower.

sense.def: HF 8.10.28: fill up (deep pools) with earth, level out (as holes in the ground)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.03.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 7; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 5; ed. ICS 1992, 1/19; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 69;

tls:text.tls:line: It turns upwards and downwards with the yin and the yang.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.03.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 7; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 5; ed. ICS 1992, 1/19; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 69;

tls:text.tls:line: It turns upwards and downwards with the yin and the yang.

sense.def: stoop down; bow down; bow the head 俯而泣, but also ZUO Zhao 7 一命而僂，再命而傴，三命而俯

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.03.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 7; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 5; ed. ICS 1992, 1/19; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 69;

tls:text.tls:line: It turns upwards and downwards with the yin and the yang.

sense.def: throw one's head back, look upwards, look up

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 8; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 5f; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 69;

tls:text.tls:line: In their charioting, Ping Yi and Da Bing of antiquity:

sense.def: At the time N 昔者，古者

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 8; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 5f; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 69;

tls:text.tls:line: Mounted the thunder chariot

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 8; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 5f; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 69;

tls:text.tls:line: And used the cloud dragons as their six horses.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 8; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 5f; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 69;

tls:text.tls:line: And used the cloud dragons as their six horses.

sense.def: faded shadow around the rainbow; faint rainbow; rainbow

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 8; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 5f; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 69;

tls:text.tls:line: They rambled about in the fine mists,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 8; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 5f; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 69;

tls:text.tls:line: They would pass over frost and snow without leaving tracks,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 8; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 69f;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, the person of great stature:

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 8; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 69f;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, the person of great stature:

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 8; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 69f;

tls:text.tls:line: Being placidly free of all worries

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 8; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 69f;

tls:text.tls:line: And serenly without thoughts for the morrow,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 8; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 69f;

tls:text.tls:line: He mounts the clouds and climbs beyond the skies,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 8; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 69f;

tls:text.tls:line: To be with the demiurge of change.

sense.def: the agent that creates and transforms, fashions things: the creator

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 8; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 69f;

tls:text.tls:line: To be with the demiurge of change.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 9; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71;

tls:text.tls:line: Doing as he pleases and following a freer rhythm

sense.def: ZUO Zhao 10, vt: give free rein to (one's desires etc.)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 9; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71;

tls:text.tls:line: He gallops the great abode.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 9; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71;

tls:text.tls:line: He gets the god of rain to sprinkle his path

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 9; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71;

tls:text.tls:line: And the god of wind to sweep away the dust.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 9; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71;

tls:text.tls:line: And the god of wind to sweep away the dust.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 9; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71;

tls:text.tls:line: With lighting as his whip

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 9; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71;

tls:text.tls:line: With lighting as his whip

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 9; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71;

tls:text.tls:line: And thunder as his wheels,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 9; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71;

tls:text.tls:line: Above he rambles in the free and roaming vastness,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 9; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71;

tls:text.tls:line: Below he goes out of the gates of boundlessness.

sense.def: cosmic border; CC: 唼o small that there is nothing inside, so large that there are no outer bounds�; CC, jiutan: the mountains are so large, there is no end/boundary to them

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 9; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71;

tls:text.tls:line: Having scanned all round and left nothing out,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 9; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71;

tls:text.tls:line: He manages the four corners of the earth

sense.def: to wander about; to roam in; traverse (CC); usually in the compound 經營

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 9; ed. ICS 1992, 1/26; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71;

tls:text.tls:line: Yet always returns to the pivot.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 9; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus, with the heavens as his canopy,

sense.def: baldachin of a carriage; chariot canopy; umbrella

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 9; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71;

tls:text.tls:line: With the yin and the yang as charioteers,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71f;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, he travels fast without pitching

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71f;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, he travels fast without pitching

sense.def: move quickly; move with urgency; be fast enough

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71f;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, he travels fast without pitching

sense.def: waver, be unstable, be agitated; swerve off course

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71f;

tls:text.tls:line: And travels far without fatigue.

sense.def: go a long way; cover a large distance

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71f;

tls:text.tls:line: And travels far without fatigue.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71f;

tls:text.tls:line: Without taxing his four limbs

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71f;

tls:text.tls:line: And without draining the keenness of his hearing and sight,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71f;

tls:text.tls:line: And without draining the keenness of his hearing and sight,

sense.def: suffer loss, be reduced, get reduced

tls:text.tls:srcline: 而知八紘九野之形埒者，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71f;

tls:text.tls:line: He knows the lay and the boundaries of the various divisions and quadrants of the cosmos.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71f;

tls:text.tls:line: It is because he has his hands on the control handles of dao

sense.def: the vital point; most important point. essential point; essence; main initiative; main controlling functions

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71f;

tls:text.tls:line: It is because he has his hands on the control handles of dao

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71f;

tls:text.tls:line: and rambles in the land of the inexhaustible.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 71f;

tls:text.tls:line: and rambles in the land of the inexhaustible.

tls:text.tls:srcline:
是故天下之事，
不可為也，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, there is nothing you can do about the world.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: You can only follow what is natural in pushing the myriad things aheard.

sense.def: the natural tendencies of N; the natural properties of N

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: You can only follow what is natural in pushing the myriad things aheard.

sense.def: the natural course of things; what is naturally so

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: You can only follow what is natural in pushing the myriad things aheard.

sense.def: push forward in one direction (primarily things); also figurative: promote (something), put (something) forward,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.04.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: You can only grasp the essential destination and lead them there.

sense.def: hold onto as the crucial thing

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: equip themselves with cleverness,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: that the shapes they come into contact with cannot but show themselves as they are: square, round, bent, and straight.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, an echo does not resound as it like,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, an echo does not resound as it like,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, an echo does not resound as it like,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, an echo does not resound as it like,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: and a shadow is not something that is cast once and for all.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: and a shadow is not something that is cast once and for all.

sense.def: one and for all; once and for all time

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: The likeness of the sound and shape

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 9; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: is attained without fuss.

sense.def: silently, without saying a word; through silence 默然而

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 11; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10f; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: He moves when aroused.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 11; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10f; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: The human spirit responds when things come on the scene.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 11; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10f; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: The human spirit responds when things come on the scene.

sense.def: react to the contextually determinate object

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 11; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10f; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: When the intellct comes into contact with things,

sense.def: knowing something; knowing things; knowledge of things; discursive knowledge, conceptual knowledge

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 11; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10f; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: When the intellct comes into contact with things,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 11; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10f; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: Feelings of attraction and aversion are produced.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 11; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 10f; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: Feelings of attraction and aversion are produced.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 11; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 11; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: Where these feelings of attraction and aversion have taken shape,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 11; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 11; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: Where these feelings of attraction and aversion have taken shape,

sense.def: more generally: shape distinct form, distinctive appearance, 'image'

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 11; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 11; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 73;

tls:text.tls:line: And the intellect has been enticed from the outside,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 11; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 11; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 75;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus, one who understands dao

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 12; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 11; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 75;

tls:text.tls:line: Everything regardless of size or shape

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 12; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 11; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 75;

tls:text.tls:line: In utter disarray,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 12; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 11; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 75;

tls:text.tls:line: In utter disarray,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.05.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 12; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 11; ed. ICS 1992, 2/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 75;

tls:text.tls:line: He does not lose his count on them.

sense.def: quantity; Anzahl; (magical) number e.g. 用六數 "uses the number six; use sextuplets of things".

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.06.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 13; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 11; ed. ICS 1992, 2/21; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 75;

tls:text.tls:line: Though he has all manner of hooks, barbs, and lures,

sense.def: carpenter's hook; belt-hook; belt-buckle[also hook for fishing][CA]

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.06.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 13; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 11; ed. ICS 1992, 2/21; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 75;

tls:text.tls:line: Though he has all manner of hooks, barbs, and lures,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.06.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 13; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 12; ed. ICS 1992, 2/21; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 75f;

tls:text.tls:line: He still won't be able to vie with the nets

sense.def: birds in general; birds of any kind; a bird

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.06.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 13; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 13; ed. ICS 1992, 2/21; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 77;

tls:text.tls:line: If one streches the world as his bird-basket

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.06.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 13; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 13; ed. ICS 1992, 2/21; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 77;

tls:text.tls:line: and converts the rivers and seas into a fishnet,

sense.def: originally net-trap for catching fish, later geneal term for a net

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.06.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 13; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 13; ed. ICS 1992, 2/21; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 77;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus, an arrow is not as effective as a corded arrow,

sense.def: SHU: arrow; arrow with wooden shaft and feathers

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.06.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 13; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 13; ed. ICS 1992, 2/21; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 77;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus, an arrow is not as effective as a corded arrow,

sense.def: string attached to an arrow; occasionally also used for arrow with string attached

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.06.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 13; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 13; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 77;

tls:text.tls:line: Is no different from trying to use a crab to catch a mouse

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.06.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 13; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 13; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 77;

tls:text.tls:line: Is no different from trying to use a crab to catch a mouse

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.06.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 13; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 13; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 77;

tls:text.tls:line: Or a toad to catch a flea

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.06.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 13; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 13; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 77;

tls:text.tls:line: Or a toad to catch a flea

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.06.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 13; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 13; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 77;

tls:text.tls:line: Or a toad to catch a flea

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.07.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 14; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 14; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 77;

tls:text.tls:line: In ancient times, Gun of Xia constructed city walls eighty feet high,

sense.def: At the time N 昔者，古者

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.07.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 14; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 14; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 77;

tls:text.tls:line: and in the lands beyond the seas men became crafty.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.07.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 14; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 14; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 77;

tls:text.tls:line: demolished the walls, filled in the moats,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.07.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 14; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 14; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 77;

tls:text.tls:line: burned the armor and weapons,

sense.def: burn up, burn down; set fire to; scorch

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.07.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 14; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 14; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 77;

tls:text.tls:line: burned the armor and weapons,

sense.def: armour and weapons; military equipment (not nececessarily only armour and weapons specifically, compare 仁義 "morality")

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.07.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 15; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 14; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 77f;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus, when a man harbors a calculating heart In his breast,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.07.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 15; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 14; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 77f;

tls:text.tls:line: and his spirituality is not kept whole.

sense.def: be perfectly present; be comprehensively developed; be in perfect shape

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.07.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 15; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 14; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 77f;

tls:text.tls:line: If a man lacks knowledge of what is harbored in his owe person,

sense.def: often reflexive: one's (own) person; one's (own) person and character; the Self; personality (as something cultivated by the gentleman); the character

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.07.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 15; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 14; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 77f;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, stronger armor calls forth sharper weapons;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.07.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 15; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 14; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 77f;

tls:text.tls:line: It is like using boiling water to calm water on the boil, the agitation will grow even worse.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.07.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 15; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 14; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 77f;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.07.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 15; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 14f; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 79;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, this can be likened to whipping a mad dog

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.07.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 15; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 14f; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 79;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, this can be likened to whipping a mad dog

sense.def: to whip; to have (someone) whipped; whip a body part

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.07.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 15; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 14f; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 79;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, this can be likened to whipping a mad dog

sense.def: biting, prone to biting; German: bissig

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.07.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 15; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 14f; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 79;

tls:text.tls:line: Or taking a crop to a kicking horse,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.07.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 15; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 14f; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 79;

tls:text.tls:line: Or taking a crop to a kicking horse,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.07.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 15; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 14f; ed. ICS 1992, 3/1; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 79;

tls:text.tls:line: How much more the tails of animals such as horses and dogs!

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.08.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 15; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 15; ed. ICS 1992, 3/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 79;

tls:text.tls:line: are not practices that will perpetuate hegemony or kingship,

sense.def: characterstic of a hegemon; characterised by the features of a hegemon

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.08.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 15; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 15; ed. ICS 1992, 3/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 79;

tls:text.tls:line: to make out the point of a needle beyond a hundred paces,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.08.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 15; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 15; ed. ICS 1992, 3/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 79f;

tls:text.tls:line: The management of even a half-acre tract of land will be too much for us,

sense.def: Chinese acre, one sixteenth of a hectar of land???

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.08.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 15; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 15; ed. ICS 1992, 3/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 79f;

tls:text.tls:line: And base ourselves on the natural course of the cosmos,

sense.def: the natural course of things; what is naturally so

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.08.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 15; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 16; ed. ICS 1992, 3/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i1;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, Yu in draining the accumulated waters

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i1;

tls:text.tls:line: Floating plants take root in water,

sense.def: be based in, have one's roots in MENG 仁義禮智根於心。that is to say, benevolence, rightness, the rites and wisdom, is rooted in his heart.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i1;

tls:text.tls:line: Land plants take root in the soil,

sense.def: be based in, have one's roots in MENG 仁義禮智根於心。that is to say, benevolence, rightness, the rites and wisdom, is rooted in his heart.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i1;

tls:text.tls:line: This is the nature of the world.

sense.def: the nature of Heaven and Earth>Law of Nature

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i1;

tls:text.tls:line: It is their natural inclination to do so.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i1;

tls:text.tls:line: It is their natural inclination to do so.

sense.def: the natural course of things; what is naturally so

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i1;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, when the spring winds come they bring the timely rains,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i1;

tls:text.tls:line: Plants and trees bloom

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i1;

tls:text.tls:line: Plants and trees bloom

sense.def: to blossom, to be in bloom

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i1;

tls:text.tls:line: And birds and animals are oviparous and viviparous.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i1;

tls:text.tls:line: And birds and animals are oviparous and viviparous.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i1f;

tls:text.tls:line: Vegetation is injured ang snaps,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i1f;

tls:text.tls:line: Vegetation is injured ang snaps,

tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i1f;

tls:text.tls:line: Eagles adn falcons sweep down on their prey,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i1f;

tls:text.tls:line: Eagles adn falcons sweep down on their prey,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i1f;

tls:text.tls:line: Swarming insects hibernate,
