tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i1f;

tls:text.tls:line: Swarming insects hibernate,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i1f;

tls:text.tls:line: And fishes and turtles make for the deep.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i1f;

tls:text.tls:line: And fishes and turtles make for the deep.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17f; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i3;

tls:text.tls:line: Trees dwellers nest in the foliage,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17f; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i3;

tls:text.tls:line: Water dwellers live in underwater caves.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17f; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i3;

tls:text.tls:line: Water dwellers live in underwater caves.

sense.def: a cave; caves of all kinds

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 17f; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i3;

tls:text.tls:line: Human beings have houses.

sense.def: population; the population at large; human beings, humankind

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 19; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i3;

tls:text.tls:line: Each produces what is badly needed

sense.def: need urgently; be preoccupied by the need of

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 19; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i3;

tls:text.tls:line: The myriad things have been so-of-themselves from the beginning.

sense.def: already in the past (occasionally without final yǐ 矣); beforehand

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 17; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 19; ed. ICS 1992, 3/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i3;

tls:text.tls:line: The myriad things have been so-of-themselves from the beginning.

sense.def: be so of and by itself; be naturally oneself; be natural; come naturally

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 19; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 19; ed. ICS 1992, 3/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i3f;

tls:text.tls:line: For this reason, the people Cut their hair and tattoo their bodies

sense.def: for this reason, and thus, and so

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 19; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 19; ed. ICS 1992, 3/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i3f;

tls:text.tls:line: For this reason, the people Cut their hair and tattoo their bodies

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 19; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 19; ed. ICS 1992, 3/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i3f;

tls:text.tls:line: For this reason, the people Cut their hair and tattoo their bodies

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 19; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 19; ed. ICS 1992, 3/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i3f;

tls:text.tls:line: For this reason, the people Cut their hair and tattoo their bodies

sense.def: body as a whole; especially the main trunk as opposed to the head; body as embodying the person

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 19; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 19; ed. ICS 1992, 3/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i3f;

tls:text.tls:line: To look like scaly reptiles.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 19; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 19; ed. ICS 1992, 3/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i3f;

tls:text.tls:line: They wear briefs in place of trousers

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 19; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 19; ed. ICS 1992, 3/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. i3f;

tls:text.tls:line: For wading and swimming;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 19; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 19; ed. ICS 1992, 3/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 85;

tls:text.tls:line: They set great store by men in their prime and look down on the aged,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 19; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 19; ed. ICS 1992, 3/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 85;

tls:text.tls:line: They set great store by men in their prime and look down on the aged,

sense.def: those who are in their prime, those who are strong; those who are able-bodied

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.09.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 19; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 19; ed. ICS 1992, 3/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 85;

tls:text.tls:line: Nor do they unbridle their horses,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.10.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 19; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 20; ed. ICS 1992, 3/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 85;

tls:text.tls:line: If in transplanting trees a person

sense.def: move away; displace; dislocate; transplant (trees); transfer to different places

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.10.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 19; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 20; ed. ICS 1992, 3/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 85;

tls:text.tls:line: they will all wither up and die.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.10.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 19; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 20; ed. ICS 1992, 3/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 85;

tls:text.tls:line: And the badger dies when it crosses the Wen River.

sense.def: cross river by boat or ferry; derived general sense: to cross (also by foot at a ford)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.10.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 20; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 20; ed. ICS 1992, 3/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 87;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, one who understands dao

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.10.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 20; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 20; ed. ICS 1992, 4/5; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 87;

tls:text.tls:line: Original simplicity and sheer whiteness,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.10.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 20; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 20; ed. ICS 1992, 4/5; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 87;

tls:text.tls:line: In order to get on in the world

sense.def: react flexibly to something under varying circumstances

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.10.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 20; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 20; ed. ICS 1992, 4/5; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 87;

tls:text.tls:line: And boring an ox's nose

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.10.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 21; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 21; ed. ICS 1992, 4/5; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 89;

tls:text.tls:line: He hits the mark without planning,

sense.def: make plans; make effective plans (sometimes also with negative connotations: to scheme, See PLOT)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.10.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 21; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 21; ed. ICS 1992, 4/5; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 89;

tls:text.tls:line: His purity reaches up to the mansion of the spirits

sense.def: the soul of a deceased person (especially insofar as it is endowed with a supernatural efficacy); spirit; deity

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.10.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 21; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 21; ed. ICS 1992, 4/5; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 89;

tls:text.tls:line: And he is a comrade of the demiurge of change.

sense.def: the agent that creates and transforms, fashions things: the creator

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.10.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 21; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 21; ed. ICS 1992, 4/5; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 89;

tls:text.tls:line: And he is a comrade of the demiurge of change.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 22; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 22; ed. ICS 1992, 4/12; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 89;

tls:text.tls:line: A good swimmer is sure to drown,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 22; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 22; ed. ICS 1992, 4/12; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 89;

tls:text.tls:line: A good swimmer is sure to drown,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 22; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 22; ed. ICS 1992, 4/12; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 89;

tls:text.tls:line: And a good rider is sure to fall from his mount.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 22; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 22; ed. ICS 1992, 4/12; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 89;

tls:text.tls:line: And a good rider is sure to fall from his mount.

sense.def: fall; fall off (a horse); fall out (of teeth)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 22; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 22; ed. ICS 1992, 4/12; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 89;

tls:text.tls:line: Ironically brings calamity on himself.

sense.def: (V) one's own (N) 自為禍 "bring about one's own misfortune"

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 22; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 22; ed. ICS 1992, 4/12; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 89;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, one who is fond of meddling is never known to escape injury,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 22; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 22; ed. ICS 1992, 4/12; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 89f;

tls:text.tls:line: King Yi of Yue, on the other hand, fled to the mountain caves,

sense.def: escape into, escape to (a place, or a person who protects one)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 22; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 22; ed. ICS 1992, 4/12; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 89f;

tls:text.tls:line: King Yi of Yue, on the other hand, fled to the mountain caves,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 23; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 23; ed. ICS 1992, 4/18; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 91;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, great indeed

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 23; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 23f; ed. ICS 1992, 4/18; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 93;

tls:text.tls:line: Draw the Country of the Naked

sense.def: move away; displace; dislocate; transplant (trees); transfer to different places

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 23; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 23f; ed. ICS 1992, 4/18; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 93;

tls:text.tls:line: Draw the Country of the Naked

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 23; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 23f; ed. ICS 1992, 4/18; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 93;

tls:text.tls:line: And to be able to transform customs and conventions

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 23; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 23f; ed. ICS 1992, 4/18; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 93;

tls:text.tls:line: And to be able to transform customs and conventions

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 23; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 23f; ed. ICS 1992, 4/18; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 93;

tls:text.tls:line: without issuing orders or commands,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 23; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 23f; ed. ICS 1992, 4/18; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 93;

tls:text.tls:line: without issuing orders or commands,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 23; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 23f; ed. ICS 1992, 4/18; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 93;

tls:text.tls:line: be enough to bring this about!

sense.def: how on earth? How on earth could you/he/I? 回何敢死？ 丘何敢乎？何足憂？

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 25; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 24; ed. ICS 1992, 4/18; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 93;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, the sage inwardly cultivates that which is the root

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 25; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 24; ed. ICS 1992, 4/18; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 93;

tls:text.tls:line: He preserves his spirit

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 25; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 24; ed. ICS 1992, 4/18; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 93;

tls:text.tls:line: Quiescently he does nothing, yet leaves nothing undone;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 25; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 24; ed. ICS 1992, 4/18; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 93;

tls:text.tls:line: serenely he does not impose order on anything, yet there is nothing that is not ord

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 25; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 24; ed. ICS 1992, 4/18; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 93;

tls:text.tls:line: By "doing nothing"

sense.def: non-action; refusal to take unnatural initiatives

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.11.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 25; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 24; ed. ICS 1992, 4/18; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 93;

tls:text.tls:line: is meant not putting in a substitute for what is so-of-itself;

sense.def: the natural course of things; what is naturally so

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.12.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 25; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 24; ed. ICS 1992, 4/18; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 93;

tls:text.tls:line: and to go on reponding to sounds without running out of echoes:

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.12.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 26; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 24; ed. ICS 1992, 4/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 95;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, the exalted necessarily takes the lowly as title,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.12.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 26; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 24; ed. ICS 1992, 4/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 95;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, the exalted necessarily takes the lowly as title,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.12.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 26; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 24; ed. ICS 1992, 4/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 95;

tls:text.tls:line: And the lofty necessarily takes the base as foundation.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.12.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 26; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 24; ed. ICS 1992, 4/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 95;

tls:text.tls:line: Transforming and setting in motion,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.12.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 26; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 24; ed. ICS 1992, 4/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 95;

tls:text.tls:line: Transforming and setting in motion,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.12.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 26; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 24; ed. ICS 1992, 4/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 97;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, those who want to be unbending

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.12.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 26; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 24; ed. ICS 1992, 4/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 97;

tls:text.tls:line: Strength overcomes that which is inferior to itself;

sense.def: object pronoun, resumptive, non-contrastive: oneself, himself, herself, themselves

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.12.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 26; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 24f; ed. ICS 1992, 4/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 97;

tls:text.tls:line: Weakness overcomes that which is superior to itself, (己 still personal)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.12.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 26; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 24f; ed. ICS 1992, 4/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 97;

tls:text.tls:line: Weakness overcomes that which is superior to itself, (己 still personal)

sense.def: 而自得之於己乎？(mostly contrastive:) himself, herself, themselves

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.12.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 26; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 24f; ed. ICS 1992, 4/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 97;

tls:text.tls:line: The teeth being harder than the tongue

sense.def: (normally human or equine etc) front teeth, tooth

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.12.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 28; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 25; ed. ICS 1992, 4/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 97;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, the pliant and the weak

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.12.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 28; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 25; ed. ICS 1992, 5/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 99;

tls:text.tls:line: Why?

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.12.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 28; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 25; ed. ICS 1992, 5/10; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 99;

tls:text.tls:line: When the person who leads the way stumbles and falls into a hole,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.13.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 28; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 26f; ed. ICS 1992, 5/19; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 101;

tls:text.tls:line: Before one can take a breath.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.13.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 28; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 26f; ed. ICS 1992, 5/19; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 101;

tls:text.tls:line: And one who acts too late gets left behind.

sense.def: get as far as the contextually determinate point; affect

tls:text.tls:srcline: 是故聖人守清道而抱雌節，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.13.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 28; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 27; ed. ICS 1992, 5/19; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 101;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, the sage abides by the limpid dao and embraces the principle of femininity.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.14.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 30; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 27; ed. ICS 1992, 5/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 103;

tls:text.tls:line: In length it ends only in the interminable

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.14.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 30; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 27; ed. ICS 1992, 5/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 103;

tls:text.tls:line: And in distance it merges into the boundless;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.14.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 30; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 27; ed. ICS 1992, 5/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 103;

tls:text.tls:line: Going up to the heavens it becomes rain and dew;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.14.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 30; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 27; ed. ICS 1992, 5/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 103;

tls:text.tls:line: And the events of the world cannot culminate without it.

sense.def: will certainly; willy nilly have to; inevitably will; certainly would have

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.14.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 30; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 27; ed. ICS 1992, 5/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 103;

tls:text.tls:line: Strike it and you will not wound it;

sense.def: strike, beat (e.g. a dog, a horse, one's breast, or indeed a bell)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.14.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 30; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 27; ed. ICS 1992, 5/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 103;

tls:text.tls:line: Strike it and you will not wound it;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.14.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 30; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 27; ed. ICS 1992, 5/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 103;

tls:text.tls:line: Stab it and you will not injure it;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.14.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 30; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 27; ed. ICS 1992, 5/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 103;

tls:text.tls:line: Put fire to it and you will not burn it.

sense.def: try to set fire to something in order to destroy it

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.14.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 30; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 27; ed. ICS 1992, 5/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 103;

tls:text.tls:line: Put fire to it and you will not burn it.

sense.def: ignite (something), cause something to start burning

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.14.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 30; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 27; ed. ICS 1992, 5/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 103;

tls:text.tls:line: Put fire to it and you will not burn it.

sense.def: ignite; get lit, start burning; burn (MO) for 燃

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.14.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 30; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 28; ed. ICS 1992, 5/24; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 105;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, without distinction between private and public

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.14.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 30f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 28; ed. ICS 1992, 6/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 105;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus, the teachings of Lao Dan state:

sense.def: saying, memorable saying; sometimes: proverbial saying, popular saying; bon-mot, dict-on

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.14.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 30f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 28; ed. ICS 1992, 6/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 105;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus, I know tha advantage of nonaction.' "

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.14.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 30f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 28; ed. ICS 1992, 6/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 105;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus, I know tha advantage of nonaction.' "

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.14.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 32; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 28; ed. ICS 1992, 6/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 105;

tls:text.tls:line: is the great progenitor of the audible.

sense.def: essential origin, venerable origin 萬物之宗

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.14.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 32; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 29; ed. ICS 1992, 6/9; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 105;

tls:text.tls:line: None occupies a position more exalted than water.

sense.def: be of higher objective/official social status than 莫尊於

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 32; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 29; ed. ICS 1992, 6/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 107;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, limpidity and tranquillity

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 32; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 29; ed. ICS 1992, 6/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 107;

tls:text.tls:line: and vacuity and serenity

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 33; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 29; ed. ICS 1992, 6/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 107;

tls:text.tls:line: Pocketing the cosmos,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 33; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 29; ed. ICS 1992, 6/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 107;

tls:text.tls:line: Pocketing the cosmos,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 33; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 29; ed. ICS 1992, 6/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 107;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, look at it, and you do not see its form;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 33; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 29; ed. ICS 1992, 6/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 107;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, look at it, and you do not see its form;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 33; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 29; ed. ICS 1992, 6/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 107;

tls:text.tls:line: Listen to it, and you do not hear its sound;

sense.def: generally: sound made by any creature

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 33; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 29; ed. ICS 1992, 6/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 107;

tls:text.tls:line: Stroke it and you do not catch hold of its body.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 33; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 29; ed. ICS 1992, 6/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 107;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, since being is born out of nonbeing

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 33; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 30; ed. ICS 1992, 6/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 109;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus, in music,

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 33; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 30; ed. ICS 1992, 6/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 109;

tls:text.tls:line: Where taste is concerned,

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 33; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 30; ed. ICS 1992, 6/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 109;

tls:text.tls:line: And for colors,

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 33; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 30; ed. ICS 1992, 6/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 109;

tls:text.tls:line: Similarly with dao,

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 34; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 30; ed. ICS 1992, 6/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 109;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, when the "one" is disentangled

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 34; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 30; ed. ICS 1992, 6/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 109;

tls:text.tls:line: It will reach the limits of heaven and earth.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 34; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 30; ed. ICS 1992, 6/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 109;

tls:text.tls:line: In its wholeness,

sense.def: be comprehensive, be all-encompassing; be complete and correct; hit the mark consistently

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 34; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 30; ed. ICS 1992, 6/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 109;

tls:text.tls:line: it is pure, Like the uncarved jade;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 34; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 30; ed. ICS 1992, 6/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 109;

tls:text.tls:line: In its dispersion,

sense.def: be dispersed; be scattered; be in a state of dispersion

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 34; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 30; ed. ICS 1992, 6/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 109;

tls:text.tls:line: it is chaotic, Like murky water.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 34; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 30; ed. ICS 1992, 6/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 109;

tls:text.tls:line: From being murky, it slowly becomes limpid;

sense.def: mixed with impurities and sediment; impure

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 34; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 30; ed. ICS 1992, 6/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 109;

tls:text.tls:line: From being murky, it slowly becomes limpid;

sense.def: slowly, softly, gently; with slow emphasis; at one's own pace, gradually

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 34; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 30; ed. ICS 1992, 6/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 109;

tls:text.tls:line: From being murky, it slowly becomes limpid;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 34; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 30; ed. ICS 1992, 6/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 109;

tls:text.tls:line: Being settled, it is like deep waters;

sense.def: be limpid, tranquil and serene; be unperturbed; be placid (like the sea)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 34; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 30; ed. ICS 1992, 6/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 109;

tls:text.tls:line: Being buoyant, it is like floating clouds.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 34; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 30; ed. ICS 1992, 6/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 109;

tls:text.tls:line: Being buoyant, it is like floating clouds.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 34; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 30; ed. ICS 1992, 6/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 111;

tls:text.tls:line: And its changes and transformations are godlike;

sense.def: change and be transformed, undergo all sorts of changes and transformations

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 36; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 30; ed. ICS 1992, 6/29; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 111;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, in his governance,the surpassing person:

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 36; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 30; ed. ICS 1992, 6/29; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 111;

tls:text.tls:line: He puts aside cleverness and follows dao;

sense.def: follow (a pattern, a model); act in accordance with

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 36; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 30; ed. ICS 1992, 6/29; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 111;

tls:text.tls:line: Abandons all desires,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.15.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 36; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 31; ed. ICS 1992, 6/29; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 111;

tls:text.tls:line: Following the water gauge and adhering to the plumb line,

sense.def: abstract line; the abstract line demarkating what is legal and what is illegal

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 37; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 31; ed. ICS 1992, 7/4; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 111;

tls:text.tls:line: Gladness and anger

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)

tls:text.tls:line: worry and sorrow

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 37; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 31; ed. ICS 1992, 7/4; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 111;

tls:text.tls:line: likes and dislikes

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 37; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 31; ed. ICS 1992, 7/4; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 111;

tls:text.tls:line: cravings and desires

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 37; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 31; ed. ICS 1992, 7/4; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 111f;

tls:text.tls:line: In man, a great anger shatters the yin

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 37; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 31; ed. ICS 1992, 7/4; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 111f;

tls:text.tls:line: While great gladness weighs down the yang.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 37; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 31; ed. ICS 1992, 7/4; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 111f;

tls:text.tls:line: While great gladness weighs down the yang.

sense.def: cause something to fall down; drop

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 37; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 31; ed. ICS 1992, 7/4; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 111f;

tls:text.tls:line: Where there is worry, sorrow, and much rage,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 37; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 32; ed. ICS 1992, 7/4; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 113;

tls:text.tls:line: he will commune with the spirits,

sense.def: realm of the spirits; the deities, the gods; sometimes explicitly: the gods of Heaven and Earth 天地之神明

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 37; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 32; ed. ICS 1992, 7/4; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 113;

tls:text.tls:line: and one who communes with the spirits

sense.def: realm of the spirits; the deities, the gods; sometimes explicitly: the gods of Heaven and Earth 天地之神明

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 37; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 32; ed. ICS 1992, 7/4; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 113;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, if one regulates the external from the core of his person,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 37; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 32; ed. ICS 1992, 7/4; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 113;

tls:text.tls:line: Freely intercommunicating in his mind, he is without contraditions;

sense.def: be misguided, be incoherent (also of actions); look confused

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 37; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 32; ed. ICS 1992, 7/4; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 113f;

tls:text.tls:line: He dwells in the small without finding it too cramped;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 37; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 32; ed. ICS 1992, 7/4; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 113f;

tls:text.tls:line: His soul is not agitated

sense.def: male soul which returns to heaven;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 37; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 32; ed. ICS 1992, 7/4; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 113f;

tls:text.tls:line: His soul is not agitated

sense.def: be restless; to be rushed, flurried; be in a hurry

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 37; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 32; ed. ICS 1992, 7/4; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 113f;

tls:text.tls:line: Nor is his spirit troubled.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 37; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 32; ed. ICS 1992, 7/4; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 113f;

tls:text.tls:line: Composed and serene,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 38; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 32; ed. ICS 1992, 7/4~13; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 115;

tls:text.tls:line: Borne down upon, he is able to move.

sense.def: be pressed upon; be supressed; come under pressure; feel oppressed

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 38; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 32; ed. ICS 1992, 7/13; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 115;

sense.def: often reflexive: one's (own) person; one's (own) person and character; the Self; personality (as something cultivated by the gentleman); the character

tls:text.tls:srcline: 古之人有居巖穴而神不遺者，

tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 39; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 32; ed. ICS 1992, 7/13; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 115f;

tls:text.tls:line: Among the ancients there were those who, dwelling in rocky grottos, did not feel at a loss in their spirits,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 39; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 32; ed. ICS 1992, 7/13; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 115f;

tls:text.tls:line: Among the ancients there were those who, dwelling in rocky grottos, did not feel at a loss in their spirits,

sense.def: mountainous; often intensitive and reduplicated: craggy, high; (recluses) hidden in the mountains

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 39; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 32; ed. ICS 1992, 7/13; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 115f;

tls:text.tls:line: If one knows how to look upon himself as large and the world as small,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 39; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 32; ed. ICS 1992, 7/13; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 115f;

tls:text.tls:line: If one knows how to look upon himself as large and the world as small,

sense.def: reflexive and contrastive (or sometimes at least emphatic)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 39; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 32; ed. ICS 1992, 7/13; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 115f;

tls:text.tls:line: If one knows how to look upon himself as large and the world as small,

tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 39f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 33; ed. ICS 1992, 7/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 117;

tls:text.tls:line: listening to the Jiushao or Liuying music,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 39f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 33; ed. ICS 1992, 7/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 117;

tls:text.tls:line: tasting the savory and aromatic,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 39f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 33; ed. ICS 1992, 7/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 117;

tls:text.tls:line: tasting the savory and aromatic,

sense.def: get to savour, taste, appreciate the eating of 味甘味

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 39f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 33; ed. ICS 1992, 7/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 117;

tls:text.tls:line: galloping along a smooth and even highway,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 39f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 33; ed. ICS 1992, 7/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 117;

tls:text.tls:line: galloping along a smooth and even highway,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 39f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 33; ed. ICS 1992, 7/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 117;

tls:text.tls:line: What I call "joy"

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 39f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 33; ed. ICS 1992, 7/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 117;

tls:text.tls:line: What I call "joy"

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 40; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 34; ed. ICS 1992, 7/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 117;

tls:text.tls:line: The sage does not make his person a slave to external things

sense.def: often reflexive: one's (own) person; one's (own) person and character; the Self; personality (as something cultivated by the gentleman); the character

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 40; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 34; ed. ICS 1992, 7/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 117;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, he is not elated with joy,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 40; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 34; ed. ICS 1992, 7/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 119;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, when a person has the means to find it in himself,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 40; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 34; ed. ICS 1992, 7/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 119;

tls:text.tls:line: Even under a tall tree

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 40; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 34; ed. ICS 1992, 7/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 119;

tls:text.tls:line: Even under a tall tree

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 40; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 34; ed. ICS 1992, 7/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 119;

tls:text.tls:line: or in an empty cave,

sense.def: empty; empty of relevant content (an empty pond, for example, may be just empty of fish etc)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 40; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 34; ed. ICS 1992, 7/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 119;

tls:text.tls:line: or in an empty cave,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 40; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 34; ed. ICS 1992, 7/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 119;

tls:text.tls:line: If a man can get to a state in which there is nothing which he enjoys,

sense.def: joyful satisfaction; state of delight or happiness; joyfulness; joy, delight; happiness;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 40; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 34; ed. ICS 1992, 7/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 119;

tls:text.tls:line: there will be nothing he does not enjoy;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.16.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 40; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 34; ed. ICS 1992, 7/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 119;

tls:text.tls:line: when there is nothing he does not enjoy, he has then reached the extremity of the highest joy.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 41; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 34; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 119;

tls:text.tls:line: Setting out the bells and drums,

sense.def: large suspended bell without a clapper; bell without a clapper

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 41; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 34; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 119;

tls:text.tls:line: decorating banners and ivory ornaments,

tls:text.tls:srcline: 耳聽朝歌北鄙靡靡之樂，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 41; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 34; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 119;

tls:text.tls:line: listening to the delicate and melancholy music of Zhaoke and Beibi,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 41f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 34f; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 119;

tls:text.tls:line: Or as if pinning after something lost.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 119f;

tls:text.tls:line: When the music starts, they feel happy,

sense.def: musical performance; the practice of music; musical effect

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 119f;

tls:text.tls:line: When the music starts, they feel happy,

sense.def: feel happy joy (for a reason) 甚喜

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 119f;

tls:text.tls:line: With happiness and sadness giving rise alternately to one another,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 119f;

tls:text.tls:line: With happiness and sadness giving rise alternately to one another,

sense.def: happy overt joy (typically with regard to something)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 119f;

tls:text.tls:line: The spirit is thrown into turmoil

sense.def: subtle spirit; subtle spirits [occasionally: essential sprits; vital forces][CA]; soul as seat of thought

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 119f;

tls:text.tls:line: The spirit is thrown into turmoil

sense.def: read yíng: loanword for : be confused

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 119f;

tls:text.tls:line: And cannot find a moment's peace.

sense.def: for a very short time, for as much as a moment; occasionally used nominally: a moment of life; after a very short time, in no time

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 119f;

tls:text.tls:line: And cannot find a moment's peace.

sense.def: be tranquil and at peace together; keep the peace; make peace

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 121;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, failing to find it within oneself,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 121;

tls:text.tls:line: one takes some external thing and uses it for ornament.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 121;

tls:text.tls:line: It does not penetrate even one's skin,

sense.def: skin tissue (versus the surface of the skin itself)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 123;

tls:text.tls:line: even an unworthy person will know to want to emulate it.

sense.def: be full of admiration for (an ideal, a value, a thing); sometimes also: strive towards as one's main ambition; yearn for

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 123;

tls:text.tls:line: but those who can actually adopt it are rare;

sense.def: elevated style?: be few and far between; be sparse, be scarce, be few; be a rare case 不鮮 "be not so few"; 天下鮮矣 "there are few under the sun".

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 123;

tls:text.tls:line: those who are attracted by it are many,

sense.def: be full of admiration for (an ideal, a value, a thing); sometimes also: strive towards as one's main ambition; yearn for

tls:text.tls:srcline: 夫內不開於中而強學問者，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 123;

tls:text.tls:line: For one who insists on learning while being internally unreceptive,

sense.def: insist on; make every effort to; attempt with all one's force to

tls:text.tls:srcline: 夫內不開於中而強學問者，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 123;

tls:text.tls:line: For one who insists on learning while being internally unreceptive,

tls:text.tls:srcline: 此何以異於聾者之歌也？

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 123;

tls:text.tls:line: How is this different from a deaf person trying to sing?

tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 123;

tls:text.tls:line: All he does is copy what others do

tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 123;

tls:text.tls:line: while all the time lacking the means so delight himself;

tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 123;

tls:text.tls:line: The heart

tls:text.tls:line: is the ruler of the five viscera;

tls:text.tls:line: circulating the blood and qi,

tls:text.tls:line: circulating the blood and qi,

tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 123;

tls:text.tls:line: galloping about in the realm of right and wrong,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 123;

sense.def: rightness or otherwise, appropriateness or otherwise; right and wrong

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.17.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 42; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35; ed. ICS 1992, 7/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 123;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, for a man to have the ambition to manage the world

tls:text.tls:srcline: 夫許由小天下而不以己易堯者，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.18.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 44; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35f; ed. ICS 1992, 8/14; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 123;

tls:text.tls:line: That Xu You belittled the empire and would not change places with Yao

sense.def: using (oneself)> with one's own things, by one's own standards

tls:text.tls:srcline: 夫許由小天下而不以己易堯者，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.18.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 44; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 35f; ed. ICS 1992, 8/14; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 123;

tls:text.tls:line: That Xu You belittled the empire and would not change places with Yao

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.18.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 44; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 36; ed. ICS 1992, 8/14; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 123f;

tls:text.tls:line: Lies not in others But in my person.

sense.def: I myself; me myself; my personality

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.18.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 44; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 36; ed. ICS 1992, 8/14; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 123f;

tls:text.tls:line: Once one's person is gained, The full complement of the myriad things will follow.

sense.def: often reflexive: one's (own) person; one's (own) person and character; the Self; personality (as something cultivated by the gentleman); the character

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.18.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 44; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 36; ed. ICS 1992, 8/14; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 125;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, there is nothing one is pleased with, there is nothing one gets angry about,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.19.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 44; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 36; ed. ICS 1992, 8/14~21; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 125;

tls:text.tls:line: The empire is something which I possess,

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)

tls:text.tls:line: The empire is something which I possess,

sense.def: I, the writer of this text

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)

tls:text.tls:line: The empire is something which I possess,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.19.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 44; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 36; ed. ICS 1992, 8/14~21; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 125;

tls:text.tls:line: and wielding the handle of life and death?

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.19.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 44; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 36; ed. ICS 1992, 8/21; Zha1ng Shua1ngdi4 p. 111; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 125; cf. LeBlanc 2003, p. 39; He2 Ni2ng 1998, p. 74

tls:text.tls:line: By "possessing the empire"

sense.def: I, the writer of this text

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.19.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 44; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 36; ed. ICS 1992, 8/21; Zha1ng Shua1ngdi4 p. 111; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 125; cf. LeBlanc 2003, p. 39; He2 Ni2ng 1998, p. 74

tls:text.tls:line: By "possessing the empire"

tls:text.tls:srcline: 又焉有不得容其閒者乎！

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.19.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 44; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 36; ed. ICS 1992, 8/21; Zha1ng Shua1ngdi4 p. 111; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 125; cf. LeBlanc 2003, p. 39; He2 Ni2ng 1998, p. 74

tls:text.tls:line: Again, how can there be room for anything to be wedged between the empire and me? (This translation is all over the placeCH)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.19.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 44; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 36; ed. ICS 1992, 8/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 125;

tls:text.tls:line: is to preserve oneself intact,

sense.def: N's own personality; N's own personal convictions; N's own personal character??, N's own personal characteristics; the very person constituted by N

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.19.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 44; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 36; ed. ICS 1992, 8/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 125;

tls:text.tls:line: and when one preserves himself intact, he is one with dao.

sense.def: N's own personality; N's own personal convictions; N's own personal character??, N's own personal characteristics; the very person constituted by N

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.19.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 45f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 36f; ed. ICS 1992, 8/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 125f;

tls:text.tls:line: Watching the traditional diaoyu feather dance and the wuxiang dance,

sense.def: with one's own eyes; with one's eyes; in one's eyes

tls:text.tls:srcline: 耳聽滔朗奇麗激抮之音，

tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.19.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 45f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 36f; ed. ICS 1992, 8/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 125f;

tls:text.tls:line: Listening to elegant, graceful, and euphonic musical performances,

tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.19.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 45f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 36f; ed. ICS 1992, 8/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 125f;

tls:text.tls:line: Shooting high-flying birds in the marshlands,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.19.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 45f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 36f; ed. ICS 1992, 8/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 125f;

tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.19.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 46; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 37; ed. ICS 1992, 8/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 127;

tls:text.tls:line: would not find it worthy for his spirit to be perplexed by such things,

sense.def: give worries to, make worried, trouble, give trouble to; tire out

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.19.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 46; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 37; ed. ICS 1992, 8/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 127;

tls:text.tls:line: would not find it worthy for his spirit to be perplexed by such things,

sense.def: subtle spirit; subtle spirits [occasionally: essential sprits; vital forces][CA]; soul as seat of thought

tls:text.tls:line: Wherein the damp creeps into the northern quarters

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.19.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 46; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 37; ed. ICS 1992, 8/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 127;

tls:text.tls:line: Wherein the damp creeps into the northern quarters

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.19.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 46; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 37; ed. ICS 1992, 8/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 127;

tls:text.tls:line: And then nearby roaming about in the vast expanses of marshland

sense.def: be at ease; saunter; be carefree; roam; enjoy oneself; have a good time

tls:text.tls:srcline: 此齊民之所為形植黎黑，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.19.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 46; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 38f; ed. ICS 1992, 8/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 129;

tls:text.tls:line: This is a situation under which the common run of men would become emaciated and gaunt,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.19.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 46; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 38f; ed. ICS 1992, 8/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 129;

tls:text.tls:line: and would not lose sight of his source of inner joy.

tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.19.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 46; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 38f; ed. ICS 1992, 8/25; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 129;

tls:text.tls:line: Because inwardly he has that which links him with the trigger of heaven,

sense.def: causal mechanism; crucial mechanism; underlying mechanism

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, the person who has gained dao:

tls:text.tls:line: He is new without being shiny

tls:text.tls:line: And does not fade with the passage of time;

sense.def: last long; be in a state for a long time; persevere; last long; be long-term

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.20.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 48; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 39; ed. ICS 1992, 9/6; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 129f;

tls:text.tls:line: He is not charred on entering fire

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.20.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 48; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 39; ed. ICS 1992, 9/6; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 129f;

tls:text.tls:line: And is not soaked on entering water.

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, he is honored without reliance on position,

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, he neither considers prosperity as joyous

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)

tls:text.tls:line: His physical form, his spirit and his energies,

tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.20.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 50; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 39f; ed. ICS 1992, 9/15; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 131;

tls:text.tls:line: The physical form is the lodging house of life,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)

tls:text.tls:line: qi is its stuff,

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, the sage makes eahc of these take its rightful place

tls:text.tls:line: These three are what

tls:text.tls:line: is able to raise his body and lift his limbs,

sense.def: one's body (also: body of the deceased; even overall physical shape of Heaven and earth) 人形體 "human body"

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.21.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 50; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 40; ed. ICS 1992, 9/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 133;

tls:text.tls:line: is able to raise his body and lift his limbs,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.21.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 50; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 40; ed. ICS 1992, 9/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 133;

tls:text.tls:line: in his discrimination he is able to distinguish white from black

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.21.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 50; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 40; ed. ICS 1992, 9/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 133;

tls:text.tls:line: and the beautiful from the ugly,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.21.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 50; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 40; ed. ICS 1992, 9/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 133;

tls:text.tls:line: and in his intelligence he can differentiate samenes from difference

sense.def: discern; differentiate between; to treat as separate, to hold apart, make the distinction between

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.21.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 50; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 40; ed. ICS 1992, 9/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 133;

tls:text.tls:line: and his spirit is bound up with something,

sense.def: be tied to (figuratively, as hearts to a ruler)

tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.21.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 50; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 40; ed. ICS 1992, 9/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 133;

tls:text.tls:line: or bang his head on a tree

tls:text.tls:line: or bang his head on a tree

tls:text.tls:line: without even being conscious of it.

sense.def: be aware of what is happening to oneself; be aware what is going on

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.21.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 50; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 40; ed. ICS 1992, 9/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 133;

tls:text.tls:line: And if you try to call him, he won't be able to hear.

sense.def: shout out aloud addressing someone, call out to

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.21.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 50; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 40f; ed. ICS 1992, 9/20; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 133f;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, one who values emptiness

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.22.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 50; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 41; ed. ICS 1992, 9/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 135;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, in every act he is inappropriate,

tls:text.tls:srcline: 終身運枯形于連嶁列埒之門，

tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.22.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 50; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 41; ed. ICS 1992, 9/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 135;

sense.def: waterless; dried-up; dried (fish) 枯魚 "dried fish"

tls:text.tls:srcline: 而蹪蹈于污壑穽陷之中，

tls:text.tls:line: Ultimately to stumble headlong into some filthy ditch.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 而蹪蹈于污壑穽陷之中，

tls:text.tls:line: Ultimately to stumble headlong into some filthy ditch.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 而蹪蹈于污壑穽陷之中，

tls:text.tls:line: Ultimately to stumble headlong into some filthy ditch.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 然而不免為人戮笑者，何也？

tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.22.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 50; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 41; ed. ICS 1992, 9/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 135;

sense.def: be humiliated (by the world) [Probably this should be regarded as an active vt, with a 所 understood. This needs reanalysis.CH]

tls:text.tls:srcline: 然而不免為人戮笑者，何也？

sense.def: be humiliated and laughed at> be mocked

tls:text.tls:srcline: 然而不免為人戮笑者，何也？

tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.22.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 50; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 41; ed. ICS 1992, 9/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 135;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus, where the spirit is master,

sense.def: spirit soul; the spirits (as distinct from the mind 心 and opposed to the body 形)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.22.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 50; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 41; ed. ICS 1992, 9/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 135;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus, where the spirit is master,

sense.def: the person in charge (of the contextually determinate N), sometimes used in transferred even more abstract sense: ruling agency, dominant force.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.22.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 50; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 41f; ed. ICS 1992, 9/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 135f;

tls:text.tls:line: His spirit is squandered day by day, and goes increasingly far afield.

tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.22.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 50; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 41f; ed. ICS 1992, 9/28; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 135f;

tls:text.tls:srcline: 是以天下時有盲妄自失之患。

tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.22.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 51; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 42; ed. ICS 1992, 10/7; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 137;

tls:text.tls:line: Now, where the spirit and the qi

tls:text.tls:line: Now, where the spirit and the qi

tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.22.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 51; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 42; ed. ICS 1992, 10/7; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 137;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 01.22.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 51; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 42; ed. ICS 1992, 10/7; tr. D.C.LAU AND ROGER T.AMES, p. 137;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, the sage nurtures his spirit,

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, the sage nurtures his spirit,

sense.def: spirit soul; the spirits (as distinct from the mind 心 and opposed to the body 形)

tls:text.tls:line: In using it, it is like touching off a trigger.

tls:text.tls:line: In ancient times, when Master Kuàng played the White Snow melody,

sense.def: At the time N 昔者，古者

tls:text.tls:line: remote and secluded abodes,

tls:text.tls:line: there is nothing to escape it,

sense.def: escape into, escape to (a place, or a person who protects one)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 272; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 192; ed. ICS 1992, 50/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 104f;

tls:text.tls:line: ferried across the Mèng ford,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 272; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 192; ed. ICS 1992, 50/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 105;

tls:text.tls:line: and the white standard in his right,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 272; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 192; ed. ICS 1992, 50/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 105;

tls:text.tls:line: Then the wind abated and the waves calmed down.

sense.def: At that point, Whereupon; at that time; at this time (remarkably often after direct speeech: having said this,...; then; at that point, at this juncture; at this stage (in a text); and then; subsequently)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 272; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 193; ed. ICS 1992, 50/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 105f;

tls:text.tls:line: The Duke of Lǔyáng was locked in battle with Hán,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 272; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 193; ed. ICS 1992, 50/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 105f;

tls:text.tls:line: The Duke of Lǔyáng was locked in battle with Hán,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 272; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 193; ed. ICS 1992, 50/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 106;

tls:text.tls:line: These [two men] had kept their nature intact, preserved their genuineness

sense.def: inner integrity; what is genuine in one; genuine inner nature; genuine essence; one's true being

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 272; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 193; ed. ICS 1992, 50/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 106;

tls:text.tls:line: and avoided injury to their person.

sense.def: N's own personality; N's own personal convictions; N's own personal character??, N's own personal characteristics; the very person constituted by N

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 272; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 193; ed. ICS 1992, 50/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 106;

tls:text.tls:line: When they met with crises and were pressed by difficulties,

sense.def: be pressed upon; be supressed; come under pressure; feel oppressed

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 272; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 193; ed. ICS 1992, 50/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 106;

tls:text.tls:line: as if they had not yet begun to emerge from their origin.

sense.def: essential origin, venerable origin 萬物之宗

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 272; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 193; ed. ICS 1992, 50/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 106f;

tls:text.tls:line: Such a man merely seeks fame,

sense.def: positive reputation, good name; positive fame; fame (for something, e.g. as being courageous)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 272; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 193; ed. ICS 1992, 50/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 106f;

tls:text.tls:line: and yet can bring himself to ignore death.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 272; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 193; ed. ICS 1992, 50/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 106f;

tls:text.tls:srcline:
懷萬物，
而友造化，含至和，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 272; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 193; ed. ICS 1992, 50/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 106f;

tls:text.tls:line: his palace treasures in his heart the Ten Thousand Things, befriends the creative transformations of Yīn-Yáng, cherishes perfect harmony,

sense.def: the fashioner and transformer of things (short for 造化者): the creator

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 274; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 194; ed. ICS 1992, 50/9; tr. Le Blanc, p. 107f;

tls:text.tls:line: Having done this, he presented his statement and communicated his ideas,

sense.def: after a while; after a long time

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 274; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 194; ed. ICS 1992, 50/9; tr. Le Blanc, p. 107f;

tls:text.tls:line: Having done this, he presented his statement and communicated his ideas,

sense.def: express (a promise etc), put forward (a statement etc)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 274; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 194; ed. ICS 1992, 50/9; tr. Le Blanc, p. 107f;

tls:text.tls:line: Having done this, he presented his statement and communicated his ideas,

sense.def: speech; formal submission, also in written form

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 274; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 194; ed. ICS 1992, 50/9; tr. Le Blanc, p. 107f;

tls:text.tls:line: nor could he stop his tears from flowing down abundantly.

sense.def: tears (perhaps with an admixture of snivel)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 274; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 194; ed. ICS 1992, 50/9; tr. Le Blanc, p. 107f;

tls:text.tls:line: When Pure Sincerity takes shape withing,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 274; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 194; ed. ICS 1992, 50/9; tr. Le Blanc, p. 107f;

tls:text.tls:line: When Pure Sincerity takes shape withing,

tls:text.tls:srcline: 使俗人不得其君形者而效其容，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 274f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 194; ed. ICS 1992, 50/9; tr. Le Blanc, p. 108;

tls:text.tls:line: If a common man fails to obtain the subtle essences which rule the body and yet puts on the outward appearanceof grief (?),

sense.def: HF 7.3.8: show up clearly (one's real thoughts); show through action, show in action; deploy in action; make a show of

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 274f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 194; ed. ICS 1992, 50/9; tr. Le Blanc, p. 108;

tls:text.tls:line: he surely becomes the laughing stock of his fellowmen!

sense.def: be laughed at, be sneered at

tls:text.tls:srcline: 而詹何之騖魚於大淵之中，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.01.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 274f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 194; ed. ICS 1992, 50/9; tr. Le Blanc, p. 108;

tls:text.tls:line: and Zhān Hé cause the fish to dart [towards his hook] from the depths of the great pool,

sense.def: Northern speech: very deep pool; deep pond

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.02.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 277; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 196f; ed. ICS 1992, 50/14; tr. Le Blanc, p. 120;

tls:text.tls:line: even an expert calculator cannot compute their number.

sense.def: quantity; Anzahl; (magical) number e.g. 用六數 "uses the number six; use sextuplets of things".

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.02.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 277; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 197; ed. ICS 1992, 50/14; tr. Le Blanc, p. 120f;

tls:text.tls:line: straddled the Chén and Weǐ constellations.

sense.def: ride/straddle (constellations etc) [som other examples need to be moved here]

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.02.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 277; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 197; ed. ICS 1992, 50/22; tr. Le Blanc, p. 121;

tls:text.tls:line: If all were roosters and there were no hens,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.02.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 277; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 197; ed. ICS 1992, 50/22; tr. Le Blanc, p. 121;

tls:text.tls:line: what transformation could possibly be brought about?

sense.def: substantial and typically irreversible transformation into something new; natural transformation

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.02.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 277; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 197; ed. ICS 1992, 50/22; tr. Le Blanc, p. 121;

tls:text.tls:line: what transformation could possibly be brought about?

sense.def: make up; fashion, create; invent QIMINYAOSHU 蔡倫立意造紙

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.02.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 277; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 197f; ed. ICS 1992, 50/22; tr. Le Blanc, p. 121f;

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore galloping steeds are turned back to fertilize the fields

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.02.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 277; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 197f; ed. ICS 1992, 50/22; tr. Le Blanc, p. 121f;

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore galloping steeds are turned back to fertilize the fields

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.02.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 277; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 197f; ed. ICS 1992, 50/22; tr. Le Blanc, p. 121f;

tls:text.tls:line: and ice to congeal in summer.'

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.03.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 279; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 197; ed. ICS 1992, 51/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 131;

tls:text.tls:line: Followers of Dào flourish

sense.def: be profited; derive profit from, reap the profit

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.03.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 279; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 197; ed. ICS 1992, 51/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 131;

tls:text.tls:line: whilst rebels [against it] come to grief.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 是猶王孫綽之欲倍偏枯之藥

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.03.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 279; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 199; ed. ICS 1992, 51/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 132;

tls:text.tls:line: may be compared to Wáng Sūnzhuó, who wanted to double the does

sense.def: someone who is lame 偏枯 "a hemioplegic"

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.03.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 279f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 199; ed. ICS 1992, 51/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 132f;

tls:text.tls:line: If someone, because of fire's capacity to burn wood,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.03.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 279f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 199; ed. ICS 1992, 51/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 132f;

tls:text.tls:line: uses it to melt metals,

tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.03.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 280; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 199; ed. ICS 1992, 51/8; tr. Le Blanc, p. 133;

tls:text.tls:line: the lodestone attract iron,

tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.03.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 280; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 199; ed. ICS 1992, 51/8; tr. Le Blanc, p. 133;

tls:text.tls:line: the lodestone attract iron,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.03.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 280; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 199; ed. ICS 1992, 51/8; tr. Le Blanc, p. 133;

tls:text.tls:line: the crab spoil the lacquer tree

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.03.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 280; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 199; ed. ICS 1992, 51/8; tr. Le Blanc, p. 133f;

tls:text.tls:line: and holds fast to the Responses of the Natural

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.03.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 280; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 199; ed. ICS 1992, 51/8; tr. Le Blanc, p. 133f;

tls:text.tls:line: and holds fast to the Responses of the Natural

sense.def: the natural course of things; what is naturally so

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.03.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 280; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 200; ed. ICS 1992, 51/8; tr. Le Blanc, p. 134;

tls:text.tls:line: Zuǒqiáng served his minister.

sense.def: beside the contextually determinate N, =其側

tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.04.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 280; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 200f; ed. ICS 1992, 51/8; tr. Le Blanc, p. 138;

tls:text.tls:line: the Gōng note [on the other instrument] responds;

tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.04.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 280; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 200f; ed. ICS 1992, 51/8; tr. Le Blanc, p. 138;

tls:text.tls:line: Now, [let us assume that] someone changes the tuning of one string in such a way that it does not match any of the five notes,
