tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.04.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 280; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 201; ed. ICS 1992, 51/8; tr. Le Blanc, p. 138;

tls:text.tls:line: is beclouded as if dead-drunk,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.04.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 280; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 201; ed. ICS 1992, 51/8; tr. Le Blanc, p. 138;

tls:text.tls:line: is beclouded as if dead-drunk,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.04.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 280; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 201; ed. ICS 1992, 51/8; tr. Le Blanc, p. 138;

tls:text.tls:line: he is as if he had not yet begun to emerge from his origin.

sense.def: essential origin, venerable origin 萬物之宗

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.05.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2i3; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 200; ed. ICS 1992, 51/23; tr. Le Blanc, p. 144;

tls:text.tls:line: Venomous animals caused no harm;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.05.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2i3; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 200; ed. ICS 1992, 51/23; tr. Le Blanc, p. 144;

tls:text.tls:line: Venomous animals caused no harm;

sense.def: come into being for the first time, make one's appearance, appear on the scene

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.05.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2i3; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 200; ed. ICS 1992, 51/23; tr. Le Blanc, p. 144;

tls:text.tls:line: flying birds, no terror.

sense.def: birds in general; birds of any kind; a bird

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.05.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2i3; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 200; ed. ICS 1992, 51/23; tr. Le Blanc, p. 145f;

tls:text.tls:line: Tigers and leopards huddled in caves, not daring to roar.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.05.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2i4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 202; ed. ICS 1992, 51/23; tr. Le Blanc, p. 146f;

tls:text.tls:line: But came the moment when they (the phoenixes) soared aloft ten thousand yards,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.05.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2i4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 202; ed. ICS 1992, 51/23; tr. Le Blanc, p. 146f;

tls:text.tls:line: swirled beyond the Four Seas,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.05.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2i4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 202; ed. ICS 1992, 51/23; tr. Le Blanc, p. 146f;

tls:text.tls:line: skirted the borders of the Land of Jì,

sense.def: rift or boundary where different areas meet

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.05.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 2i4; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 203; ed. ICS 1992, 51/23; tr. Le Blanc, p. 148;

tls:text.tls:line: there were none that were not awestruck,

sense.def: crouch, lie low, hide away, go into hiding, live in hiding; be hidden

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.06.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 286; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 202; ed. ICS 1992, 52/7; tr. Le Blanc, p. 151;

tls:text.tls:line: Their minds were elated, their qì blended harmoniously

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.06.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 286; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 202; ed. ICS 1992, 52/7; tr. Le Blanc, p. 151;

tls:text.tls:line: Their minds were elated, their qì blended harmoniously

sense.def: be happy in one's mind> be happy and contented neg: 心不怡

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.06.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 286; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 202; ed. ICS 1992, 52/7; tr. Le Blanc, p. 151;

tls:text.tls:line: Their minds were elated, their qì blended harmoniously

sense.def: be pleased; be happy (不怡 "be displeased; be in a bad mood; be dissatisfied")

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.06.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 286; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 202; ed. ICS 1992, 52/7; tr. Le Blanc, p. 151;

tls:text.tls:line: and their bodies were alert, light and swift.

sense.def: limb, limbs; body as constituted by its parts

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.06.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 286; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 204; ed. ICS 1992, 52/7; tr. Le Blanc, p. 151f;

tls:text.tls:line: discarded whip and lash.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.06.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 286; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 204; ed. ICS 1992, 52/7; tr. Le Blanc, p. 151f;

tls:text.tls:line: Before the chariot had [even] been moved, it started off by itself;

sense.def: of one's own accord, on one's own initiative, by one's own intention; intentionally

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.06.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 286; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 204; ed. ICS 1992, 52/7; tr. Le Blanc, p. 151f;

tls:text.tls:line: before the horses had been given the signal, they took off by themselves.

sense.def: of one's own accord, on one's own initiative, by one's own intention; intentionally

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.06.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 286; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 205; ed. ICS 1992, 52/7; tr. Le Blanc, p. 153f;

tls:text.tls:line: Whenever their inclination [for going anywhere] assumed shape in their breast,

tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.06.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 286; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 205; ed. ICS 1992, 52/7; tr. Le Blanc, p. 153f;

tls:text.tls:line: their subtle spirits (jīng-shén) were in harmony with the Six Horses.

tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 288; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 205f; ed. ICS 1992, 52/16; tr. Le Blanc, p. 155f;

tls:text.tls:line: separated men and women

sense.def: discern; differentiate between; to treat as separate, to hold apart, make the distinction between

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 288; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 206; ed. ICS 1992, 52/16; tr. Le Blanc, p. 156;

tls:text.tls:line: The people fulfilled their life-span and did not meet with untimaly death.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 288; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 206; ed. ICS 1992, 52/16; tr. Le Blanc, p. 156;

tls:text.tls:line: Harvests ripened at the propitious time, and were not damaged by any calamity.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 288; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 206; ed. ICS 1992, 52/16; tr. Le Blanc, p. 156;

tls:text.tls:line: Harvests ripened at the propitious time, and were not damaged by any calamity.

sense.def: at the appropriate time; when the need arises Note 非時

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 288; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 206; ed. ICS 1992, 52/16; tr. Le Blanc, p. 156;

tls:text.tls:line: Harvests ripened at the propitious time, and were not damaged by any calamity.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 288; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 206; ed. ICS 1992, 52/16; tr. Le Blanc, p. 156;

tls:text.tls:line: Harvests ripened at the propitious time, and were not damaged by any calamity.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 288; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 206; ed. ICS 1992, 52/16; tr. Le Blanc, p. 156;

tls:text.tls:line: Those above and those below were harmonious and not fault-finding.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 288; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 206; ed. ICS 1992, 52/16; tr. Le Blanc, p. 156;

tls:text.tls:line: Ministers were public-minded and not partial.

sense.def: indulge in favouritism; engage in favouritism

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 288; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 206; ed. ICS 1992, 52/16; tr. Le Blanc, p. 156f;

tls:text.tls:line: Thereupon, sun and moon shone with pure briliancy,

sense.def: thereafter, from then on, from that point onwards

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 288; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 206; ed. ICS 1992, 52/16; tr. Le Blanc, p. 156f;

tls:text.tls:line: and stars and constellations did not lose their courses.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 288; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 206; ed. ICS 1992, 52/16; tr. Le Blanc, p. 156f;

tls:text.tls:line: Tigers and leopards did not bite recklessly,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 288; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 206; ed. ICS 1992, 52/16; tr. Le Blanc, p. 156f;

tls:text.tls:line: Tigers and leopards did not bite recklessly,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 288; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 206; ed. ICS 1992, 52/16; tr. Le Blanc, p. 156f;

tls:text.tls:line: Tigers and leopards did not bite recklessly,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 288; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 206; ed. ICS 1992, 52/16; tr. Le Blanc, p. 156f;

tls:text.tls:line: Male and female Phoenixes swirled over the court-yard,

sense.def: fly to and fro, soar; hover

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 288; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 206; ed. ICS 1992, 52/16; tr. Le Blanc, p. 157;

tls:text.tls:line: there were none that did not offer their tribute and skills.

sense.def: tribute; tribute and services 8 times in SJ

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 288; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 206; ed. ICS 1992, 52/16; tr. Le Blanc, p. 157;

tls:text.tls:line: there were none that did not offer their tribute and skills.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 288; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 206; ed. ICS 1992, 52/16; tr. Le Blanc, p. 157;

tls:text.tls:line: there were none that did not offer their tribute and skills.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 289f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 206f; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 158f;

tls:text.tls:line: and the Nine Provinces dislacated.

sense.def: the nine regions of the world 揚州，梁州，青州，冀州，雍州，豫州，徐州，兗州，荊州

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 289f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 206f; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 158f;

tls:text.tls:line: Fire roared with inextinguishable flames,

tls:text.tls:srcline: 於是女媧鍊五色石以補蒼天，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 207; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 159;

tls:text.tls:line: Thereupon, Nǚ Wā fused together stones of the five colours with which she patched up the azure sky.

sense.def: At that point, Whereupon; at that time; at this time (remarkably often after direct speeech: having said this,...; then; at that point, at this juncture; at this stage (in a text); and then; subsequently)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 於是女媧鍊五色石以補蒼天，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 207; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 159;

tls:text.tls:line: Thereupon, Nǚ Wā fused together stones of the five colours with which she patched up the azure sky.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 207; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 159;

tls:text.tls:line: She piled up reed ashes with which to check the flooding waters.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 207; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 159f;

tls:text.tls:line: When the azure sky was patched up,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 207; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 159f;

tls:text.tls:line: and the cunning wild animals exterminated,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 207f; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 160;

tls:text.tls:line: they would go to rest carefree and calm,

sense.def: sleep; find rest; be in bed; also of dogs: lie down to sleep

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 207f; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 160;

tls:text.tls:line: and arise with a serene unblinking gaze.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 207f; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 160;

tls:text.tls:line: One of them might think he was a horse

sense.def: take oneself to be an N; consider (oneself) an N

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 207f; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 160;

tls:text.tls:line: and another might think he was an ox.

sense.def: take oneself to be an N; consider (oneself) an N

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 207f; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 160;

tls:text.tls:line: no one knowing where it came from.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 208; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 160f;

tls:text.tls:line: [just as] the Wǎngliǎng Demon knows not where it goes.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 208; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 160f;

tls:text.tls:line: [just as] the Wǎngliǎng Demon knows not where it goes.

sense.def: OBI: set out for; be on one's way; go along to; go to GUAN: 往之, 所往

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 208; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 160f;

tls:text.tls:line: of the wild birds and animals, insects and reptiles,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 208; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 160f;

tls:text.tls:line: of the wild birds and animals, insects and reptiles,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 208; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 160f;

tls:text.tls:line: there were none that did not sheathe their claws

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 208; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 160f;

tls:text.tls:line: there were none that did not sheathe their claws

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 208; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 160f;

tls:text.tls:line: and store away their venom and poison,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 208; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 160f;

tls:text.tls:line: and none that displayed predatory and voracious dispositions.

sense.def: biting, prone to biting; German: bissig

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 208; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 161f;

tls:text.tls:line: If we examine their (Fú Xì's and Nǚ Wā's) meritorious achievements,

sense.def: to submit to a close examination; to investigate strictly Shiji: 考信

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 208; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 161f;

tls:text.tls:line: they reached to the Nine Heavens above

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 208; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 161f;

tls:text.tls:line: and touched the Yellow Clay below.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 209f; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 162;

tls:text.tls:line: They clasped the magic jade tablets

sense.def: SHU, yaodian 18: auspicious insignia of rank

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 209f; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 162;

tls:text.tls:line: as they (the whole retinue) were preceded by white serpents

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 209f; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 162;

tls:text.tls:line: and followed by speeding snakes.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 209f; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 162;

tls:text.tls:line: where they paid court to the Lord at the Sacred Gate

sense.def: endowed with supernatural efficacy; endowed with supernatural dignity

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.07.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 290; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 210; ed. ICS 1992, 52/24; tr. Le Blanc, p. 162f;

tls:text.tls:line: [Rather,] they concealed within themselves the Dào of the True Man

sense.def: the true man; the man who is true to himself; the man who has realised himself; a person who has truly realised his potential

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 293; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 209; ed. ICS 1992, 53/10; tr. Le Blanc, p. 170f;

tls:text.tls:line: Coming to the time of Jié of Xià,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 293; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 209; ed. ICS 1992, 53/10; tr. Le Blanc, p. 170f;

tls:text.tls:line: rulers were benighted and unenlightened.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 293; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 209; ed. ICS 1992, 53/10; tr. Le Blanc, p. 170f;

tls:text.tls:line: rulers were benighted and unenlightened.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 293; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 209; ed. ICS 1992, 53/10; tr. Le Blanc, p. 170f;

tls:text.tls:line: the Dào of the [Five] Emperors was blotted out and did not flourish.

sense.def: come to develop strongly; get to flourish; rise to power; go strong; be on the rise

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 293; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 209; ed. ICS 1992, 53/10; tr. Le Blanc, p. 171f;

tls:text.tls:line: In undertaking affairs they offended the azure sky,

sense.def: undertake, carry out, do; to stage 舉事

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 293; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 209; ed. ICS 1992, 53/10; tr. Le Blanc, p. 171f;

tls:text.tls:line: In undertaking affairs they offended the azure sky,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 293; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 209; ed. ICS 1992, 53/10; tr. Le Blanc, p. 171f;

tls:text.tls:line: In undertaking affairs they offended the azure sky,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 293; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 209; ed. ICS 1992, 53/10; tr. Le Blanc, p. 171f;

tls:text.tls:line: and in issuing ordinances they were at variance with the four seasons.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 293; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 209; ed. ICS 1992, 53/10; tr. Le Blanc, p. 171f;

tls:text.tls:line: and in issuing ordinances they were at variance with the four seasons.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 293; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 209; ed. ICS 1992, 53/10; tr. Le Blanc, p. 171f;

tls:text.tls:line: They rended bone from flesh (destroyed kinship relations) for their own interest.

sense.def: give (oneself) free space, create room for (oneself) [WHERE SHOULD THIS ITEM END UP???]

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 293; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 209; ed. ICS 1992, 53/10; tr. Le Blanc, p. 172;

tls:text.tls:line: and vied for chariots (wealth and prestige).

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 293; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 209f; ed. ICS 1992, 53/10; tr. Le Blanc, p. 172f;

tls:text.tls:line: In these conditions ruler and minister turned their back to each other,

sense.def: contrary, perverse; be at odds with each other; be at loggerheads

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 293; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 209f; ed. ICS 1992, 53/10; tr. Le Blanc, p. 172f;

tls:text.tls:line: The established (state) altars dried up and cracked.

sense.def: to wither, to dry up (and die)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 293; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 209f; ed. ICS 1992, 53/10; tr. Le Blanc, p. 172f;

tls:text.tls:line: Dogs wailed and entered deep pools.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 293; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 209f; ed. ICS 1992, 53/10; tr. Le Blanc, p. 172f;

tls:text.tls:line: Dogs wailed and entered deep pools.

sense.def: Northern speech: very deep pool; deep pond

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 293; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 209f; ed. ICS 1992, 53/10; tr. Le Blanc, p. 172f;

tls:text.tls:line: Beautiful women disheveled their hair,blackened their faces and applied no make-up.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 293; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 211; ed. ICS 1992, 53/10; tr. Le Blanc, p. 173f;

tls:text.tls:line: and the Yellow God sighed and moaned.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 293; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 211; ed. ICS 1992, 53/10; tr. Le Blanc, p. 173f;

tls:text.tls:line: and the Yellow God sighed and moaned.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 293; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 211; ed. ICS 1992, 53/10; tr. Le Blanc, p. 173f;

tls:text.tls:line: Flying birds suffered damaged wings,

sense.def: birds in general; birds of any kind; a bird

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 293; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 211; ed. ICS 1992, 53/10; tr. Le Blanc, p. 173f;

tls:text.tls:line: and running animals suffered injured feet.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 212f; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 174f;

tls:text.tls:line: In the later generations,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 212f; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 174f;

tls:text.tls:line: the Seven States set up clan differences.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 212f; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 174f;

tls:text.tls:line: The feudal lords codified [their own] laws,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 212f; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 174f;

tls:text.tls:line: and each differed in his practices and customs.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 212f; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 174f;

tls:text.tls:line: overthrowing the nobles and threatening the innocent.

sense.def: cause to collapse and be ruined

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 213; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 175;

tls:text.tls:line: They dug up burial mounds

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 213; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 175;

tls:text.tls:line: and scattered the bones of the dead.

sense.def: human bones in the living body or as part of a skeleton

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 213; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 175;

tls:text.tls:line: clashed with mighty foes

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 213; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 175;

tls:text.tls:line: clashed with mighty foes

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 213; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 175;

tls:text.tls:line: and ravaged without measure.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 213; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 175;

tls:text.tls:line: In these circumstances, the able-bodied and light-footed

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 213; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 175;

tls:text.tls:line: In these circumstances, the able-bodied and light-footed

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 213; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 175;

tls:text.tls:line: In these circumstances, the able-bodied and light-footed

sense.def: be in strong basic shape, be going strong; be stout, be robust, be able-bodied, be in one's prime; be constitutionally strong; be fit and strong enough to work; thrive particularly

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 213; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 175;

tls:text.tls:line: were made armoured soliers

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 213; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 175;

tls:text.tls:line: while family elders and feeble ones remained at home,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 213; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 175;

tls:text.tls:line: while family elders and feeble ones remained at home,

sense.def: be weak, frail; be young and weak

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 213; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 175;

tls:text.tls:line: along endless roads

sense.def: the roads, all kinds of roads

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 213; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 175;

tls:text.tls:line: along endless roads

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 214; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 175;

tls:text.tls:line: and road mud reaching up to their knees,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 214; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 175;

tls:text.tls:line: and road mud reaching up to their knees,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 214; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 175;

tls:text.tls:line: pulled one another by the hand along the highways.

sense.def: pick up and take along[hold(the hand); pull; drag along][CA]

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 214; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 175;

tls:text.tls:line: fell prostrate on the cross-bar of their chariots and died.

sense.def: on the body; with one's body; physically

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 214; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 175f;

tls:text.tls:line: What the expression "annex states and appropriate the land" meant was

sense.def: unite under one's unified control; annex;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 214; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 176;

tls:text.tls:line: The world finally reached the point where people used human skulls as head-rests,

sense.def: read zhe4n: use as a pillow for

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 214; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 176;

tls:text.tls:line: The world finally reached the point where people used human skulls as head-rests,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 295f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 214; ed. ICS 1992, 53/20; tr. Le Blanc, p. 176;

tls:text.tls:line: and relished these more than the flesh of grass- and grain-fed animals.

sense.def: hey and grain-eating domestic animals, particularly goats, cows; pigs and dogs

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 296; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 214; ed. ICS 1992, 54/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 176;

tls:text.tls:line: the [people of the] world were never able to soothe their heart and mind

sense.def: regard as conducive to peace; feel at ease with, feel comfortable with; find one's peace in; be content with; find comfort in (women and feasting)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 296; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 214; ed. ICS 1992, 54/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 176;

tls:text.tls:line: the [people of the] world were never able to soothe their heart and mind

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 296; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 214; ed. ICS 1992, 54/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 176;

tls:text.tls:line: and find joy in their traditions and customs,

sense.def: read yào: like to engage in; take one's pleasure in, take one's pleasure with

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 296; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 214; ed. ICS 1992, 54/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 176;

tls:text.tls:line: and find joy in their traditions and customs,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 296; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 214; ed. ICS 1992, 54/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 176;

tls:text.tls:line: and find joy in their traditions and customs,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.08.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 296; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 214; ed. ICS 1992, 54/1; tr. Le Blanc, p. 176;

tls:text.tls:line: The feudal lords fiercely attacked [one another],

sense.def: using （often: all one's) strength, powerfully, with one's power/strength; with all one's strength 力田 "work hard in agriculture"

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 297; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 215; ed. ICS 1992, 54/4; tr. Le Blanc, p. 180f;

tls:text.tls:line: Coming to the present time,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 297; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 215; ed. ICS 1992, 54/4; tr. Le Blanc, p. 180f;

tls:text.tls:line: the Son of Heaven reigns supreme,

sense.def: the (contextually determinate) Son of Heaven (of the time)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 297; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 215; ed. ICS 1992, 54/4; tr. Le Blanc, p. 180f;

tls:text.tls:line: [Simply] by clasping his hands on his breast and stretching them forward,

sense.def: bow politely (often: instead of making a concrete effort to help with work that is being done or needs to be done)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 297; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 215; ed. ICS 1992, 54/4; tr. Le Blanc, p. 180f;

tls:text.tls:line: [Simply] by clasping his hands on his breast and stretching them forward,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 297; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 215; ed. ICS 1992, 54/4; tr. Le Blanc, p. 180f;

tls:text.tls:line: the Four Seas pay abeisance

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 297; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 215; ed. ICS 1992, 54/8; tr. Le Blanc, p. 1i1;

tls:text.tls:line: Even the sage ruler

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 297; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 215; ed. ICS 1992, 54/8; tr. Le Blanc, p. 1i1;

tls:text.tls:line: and dismisses those who show the slightest penchant for slander and flattery,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 297; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 215; ed. ICS 1992, 54/8; tr. Le Blanc, p. 1i1;

tls:text.tls:line: and dismisses those who show the slightest penchant for slander and flattery,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 297; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 215; ed. ICS 1992, 54/8; tr. Le Blanc, p. 1i1;

tls:text.tls:line: shuts the door to cabals and cliques,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 297; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 215; ed. ICS 1992, 54/8; tr. Le Blanc, p. 1i1f;

tls:text.tls:line: This, then, is how to follow in the footsteps of Fú Xī

sense.def: And then in such a way; Since S2, then/therefore S1; Thus

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 298; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 215; ed. ICS 1992, 54/14; tr. Le Blanc, p. 1i2f;

tls:text.tls:line: Then, inflated with self-satisfaction, they prided themselves on having performed [the tasks of] government.

sense.def: take oneself to be V-ing; consider oneself to be V-ing

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 298; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 216; ed. ICS 1992, 54/14; tr. Le Blanc, p. 1i3;

tls:text.tls:line: Now, stump shoots may grow on the wooden casing of a well, obstructing the bucket from reaching the bottom;

sense.def: kind of tree; Catalpa, Chinese catalpa, Catalpa ovata

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 298; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 216; ed. ICS 1992, 54/14; tr. Le Blanc, p. 1i3;

tls:text.tls:line: and branches may grow on the side beams of a canal, obstructing the passage of boats.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 298; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 216; ed. ICS 1992, 54/14; tr. Le Blanc, p. 1i3;

tls:text.tls:line: their waters dry up and leave a stagnant swamp

sense.def: become dry, dry up, lose water supply

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 298; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 216; ed. ICS 1992, 54/14; tr. Le Blanc, p. 1i3;

tls:text.tls:line: their waters dry up and leave a stagnant swamp

sense.def: wither; become all parched; dry up completely

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 298; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 217; ed. ICS 1992, 54/14; tr. Le Blanc, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: Héng É stole it and fled to the moon.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 298; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 217; ed. ICS 1992, 54/14; tr. Le Blanc, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: [Yì] was dejected and forlorn,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 298; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 217; ed. ICS 1992, 54/14; tr. Le Blanc, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: having no way to perpetuate it (the drug).

sense.def: prolong; make physically longer; continue 夜以續日 HF: 以長續短;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 298; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 217; ed. ICS 1992, 54/14; tr. Le Blanc, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, to beg for fire is not as good as to obtain a fire-maker.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 298; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 217; ed. ICS 1992, 54/14; tr. Le Blanc, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, to beg for fire is not as good as to obtain a fire-maker.

sense.def: ask/beg (a person for food); beg for

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 298; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 217; ed. ICS 1992, 54/14; tr. Le Blanc, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: To depend on [other people's] water is not as good as to dig a well [of one's own].

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 298; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 217; ed. ICS 1992, 54/14; tr. Le Blanc, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: To depend on [other people's] water is not as good as to dig a well [of one's own].

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 298; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 217; ed. ICS 1992, 54/14; tr. Le Blanc, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: To depend on [other people's] water is not as good as to dig a well [of one's own].

sense.def: dig (a hole in the ground, a cave etc)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 06.09.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 298; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 217; ed. ICS 1992, 54/14; tr. Le Blanc, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: To depend on [other people's] water is not as good as to dig a well [of one's own].

tls:text.tls:srcline: 是故心知規而師傅諭道，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.01.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 374; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 269; ed. ICS 1992, 67/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Even though he is aware of how things should be done, he allows himself to be guided by the imperial tutors;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.01.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 374; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 269f; ed. ICS 1992, 67/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore in his deliberations he does not decide on any wrong courses of action

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.01.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 374; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 270; ed. ICS 1992, 67/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Beauty and ugliness do not stir up his likes and dislikes,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.01.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 374; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 270; ed. ICS 1992, 67/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Things proceed from what is naturally so

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.01.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 374; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 270; ed. ICS 1992, 67/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Things proceed from what is naturally so

sense.def: the natural course of things; what is naturally so

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.01.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 374; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 270; ed. ICS 1992, 67/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 168;

tls:text.tls:line: and nothing arises from him personally.

sense.def: 而自得之於己乎？(mostly contrastive:) himself, herself, themselves

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.01.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 374; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 270; ed. ICS 1992, 67/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore a king of antiquity

sense.def: the true kings (of a given time)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.01.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 374; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 270; ed. ICS 1992, 67/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 168;

tls:text.tls:line: The emperor being surrounded by screens

sense.def: an emperor; the emperor generally (with untensed predicate)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.01.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 374; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 270; ed. ICS 1992, 67/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 168;

tls:text.tls:line: was to erect a barrier around himself.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.01.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 374; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 270; ed. ICS 1992, 67/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 168;

tls:text.tls:line: must be carefully guarded.

sense.def: should by all means be V-ed

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.02.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 374; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 270; ed. ICS 1992, 67/13; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 169;

tls:text.tls:line: A person's spiritual souls come from the vapors of heaven;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.02.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 374; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 270; ed. ICS 1992, 67/13; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 169;

tls:text.tls:line: his sentient souls come from the vapors of earth.

sense.def: female soul (which returns to Earth after death)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.02.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 376; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 271; ed. ICS 1992, 67/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 170;

tls:text.tls:line: His intimidating presence was awesome yet not put to the test,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.02.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 376; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 271; ed. ICS 1992, 67/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 170;

tls:text.tls:line: and the prisons were empty.

sense.def: be all empty; be all empty and deserted

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.02.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 376f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 271; ed. ICS 1992, 68/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 170;

tls:text.tls:line: The government in declining age is a different matter:

sense.def: it is the subject that V-s

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.02.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 376f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 271; ed. ICS 1992, 68/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 170;

tls:text.tls:line: bandits and thieves are increasingly evident,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.02.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 376f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 271; ed. ICS 1992, 68/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 170;

tls:text.tls:line: and edicts and orders are not implemented.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.02.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 377; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 271f; ed. ICS 1992, 68/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 170;

tls:text.tls:line: The authorites do not devote their efforts to returning to the right path.

sense.def: officials in charge 有司皆曰 (usually the reference is definite and plural, when the word is not used predicatively)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.02.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 377; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 271f; ed. ICS 1992, 68/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 170;

tls:text.tls:line: they increae their punishments.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.02.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 377; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 271f; ed. ICS 1992, 68/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 170;

sense.def: pile up; assemble; accumulate; increase manyfold

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.02.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 377; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 271f; ed. ICS 1992, 68/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 170;

tls:text.tls:line: or wielding a cane to tame a dog.

sense.def: develop an intimate relationship with; cultivate an intimate friendship with

tls:text.tls:line: put them in pens, [make pens for them]

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.03.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 378; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 272; ed. ICS 1992, 68/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 170;

tls:text.tls:line: provide for their desires,

tls:text.tls:line: and give them room to vent outbursts of temper.

tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.03.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 378; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 272; ed. ICS 1992, 68/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 170;

tls:text.tls:line: and give them room to vent outbursts of temper.

tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.03.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 379; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 272; ed. ICS 1992, 68/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 171;

tls:text.tls:line: Solitarily he preserves what is genuine,

sense.def: inner integrity; what is genuine in one; genuine inner nature; genuine essence; one's true being

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.03.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 379; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 273; ed. ICS 1992, 68/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 171;

tls:text.tls:line: Punishments and penalties are inadequate to change social custom;

sense.def: punishment; kind of punishment GY: 刑五而已 "There are only five kinds of punishments..."

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.03.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 379; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 273; ed. ICS 1992, 68/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 171;

tls:text.tls:line: Punishments and penalties are inadequate to change social custom;

sense.def: punishment through fines; more generally: punitive action

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.03.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 379; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 273; ed. ICS 1992, 68/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 171;

tls:text.tls:line: Punishments and penalties are inadequate to change social custom;

tls:text.tls:line: and yet their achievements are naturally realized.

sense.def: in the natural course of events; naturally; automatically; spontaneously; by itself (without any external initiative)

tls:text.tls:line: In ancient times Sūnshū Aó reposed peacefully

tls:text.tls:line: Yí Liáo of Shì-nán toyed with his pellets

tls:text.tls:line: are of little use in resolving difficulties;

tls:text.tls:line: the method of relying on your eyes to see

tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.03.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 380; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 274; ed. ICS 1992, 68/14; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 172;

tls:text.tls:line: and your words to command

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)

tls:text.tls:line: As a result, the state was raked by turmoil

sense.def: 我國家the nation including its leading clans; our nation, my nation, the nation in question, the polity; their nation

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.03.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 3i2; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 274f; ed. ICS 1992, 68/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 172;

tls:text.tls:line: As a result, the state was raked by turmoil

sense.def: trouble, problem, difficulties (from the part of the other feudal lords); the difficult point; disastrous consequences [often difficult to distinguish from DIFFICULT]

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.03.16; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 3i3; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 275; ed. ICS 1992, 69/4; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 173;

sense.def: find communicative happiness; be communicatively happy (the optative cases have to be moved!)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)

tls:text.tls:line: Hearing Níng Qì's melancholy song which came from beneath the ox cart,

sense.def: yì jí: continue so as to last until/for, continue down to; reach down to

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)

sense.def: contrastive: one's own person; oneself; himself

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.03.20; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 3i3; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 276; ed. ICS 1992, 69/11; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 173;

tls:text.tls:line: Embracing simplicity and offering his sincerity,

sense.def: HF 7.3.8: show up clearly (one's real thoughts); show through action, show in action; deploy in action; make a show of

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.03.21; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 385; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 276; ed. ICS 1992, 69/11; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 173;

tls:text.tls:line: With the sage-kings of antiquity, when the most essential vapors were embodied within,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.03.21; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 385; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 276; ed. ICS 1992, 69/11; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 173;

tls:text.tls:line: and they issued commands to show their purposes.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.03.22; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 385; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 276; ed. ICS 1992, 69/11; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 173;

tls:text.tls:line: and recounting them in song and verse,

sense.def: song; popular song (also that of primitive peoples etc) 人聲曰歌. 歌柯也. 所歌之言是其質也. 以聲吟詠有上下如草木之有柯葉也. 故兗冀言 歌聲如柯也 Songs of humans are called gē. gē “song” is kē “branch.” The words sung, these are the substance. When using the voice one chants, the voice goes up and down, like plants and trees having stems and leaves. Thus in the Yuan and in the Jì areas they pronounce ky “sing” with a sound like kē “branch”.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)

tls:text.tls:line: and on land he could capture a bear.

tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.05.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 388; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 279; ed. ICS 1992, 70/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 175;

tls:text.tls:line: Nevertheless, Tāng leading only three hundred war chariots

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.05.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 389; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 279; ed. ICS 1992, 70/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 176;

tls:text.tls:line: Where concerted strength is applied,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.05.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 389; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 279; ed. ICS 1992, 70/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 176;

tls:text.tls:line: That household wells do not host giant turtles

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.05.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 389; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 279; ed. ICS 1992, 70/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 176;

tls:text.tls:line: That household wells do not host giant turtles

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.05.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 389; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 279; ed. ICS 1992, 70/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 176;

tls:text.tls:line: But when it comes to removing it,

sense.def: when it comes to the topic N

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.05.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 389; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 279f; ed. ICS 1992, 70/13; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 176;

tls:text.tls:line: During the night an owl can snatch a flea or mosquito out of the air

sense.def: ZZ: pick up between two or three fingers [also: catch][CA]

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.05.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 389; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 280; ed. ICS 1992, 70/13; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 176;

tls:text.tls:line: The teng snake springs up into the mists;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.05.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 389; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i1; ed. ICS 1992, 70/13; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 176;

tls:text.tls:line: and the engraver did not wield the adze.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.05.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 389; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i1; ed. ICS 1992, 70/13; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 176f;

tls:text.tls:line: where a person's burden is light he is easy to encourage.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.05.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 389; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i1; ed. ICS 1992, 70/20; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 177;

tls:text.tls:line: One who embodies the Way does not make himself up because he is ugly

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.05.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 389f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i1f; ed. ICS 1992, 70/20; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 177;

tls:text.tls:line: If the ruler exercise the same caution before bestowing favors as he does in being severe,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.05.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 391; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i2; ed. ICS 1992, 70/20; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 177;

tls:text.tls:line: When the innocent are executed

sense.def: die in one way or another

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.05.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 391; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i2; ed. ICS 1992, 70/20; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 177;

tls:text.tls:line: the well-disciplined will not be encouraged toward good conduct

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.05.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 391; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i2; ed. ICS 1992, 70/20; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 177;

tls:text.tls:line: the well-disciplined will not be encouraged toward good conduct

sense.def: often reflexive: one's (own) person; one's (own) person and character; the Self; personality (as something cultivated by the gentleman); the character

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.05.16; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 391; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i2; ed. ICS 1992, 70/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 177;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus it is that under the administration of a perspicacious ruler,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.05.16; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 391; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i2; ed. ICS 1992, 70/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 177;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus it is that under the administration of a perspicacious ruler,

sense.def: the enlightened ruler; an enlightened ruler

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.05.17; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 391; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i2; ed. ICS 1992, 70/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 177f;

tls:text.tls:line: lies in themselves,

sense.def: contrastive: one's own person; oneself; himself

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.05.17; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 391; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i2; ed. ICS 1992, 70/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 177f;

tls:text.tls:line: There are no footprints in the court which is overgrown with wild grass;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 391f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i2; ed. ICS 1992, 70/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 178;

tls:text.tls:line: Now, the upright on the shadoof, being fixed vertifcally, does not move,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 392; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i2f; ed. ICS 1992, 70/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 178;

tls:text.tls:line: It is to the low ground that the myriad things repair

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 393; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i3; ed. ICS 1992, 71/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 178;

tls:text.tls:line: As a result, the various ministers will converge on him side by side like spokes at the hub,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 393; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i3; ed. ICS 1992, 71/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 178;

tls:text.tls:line: As a result, the various ministers will converge on him side by side like spokes at the hub,

sense.def: like the spokes of a wheel

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 393; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i3; ed. ICS 1992, 71/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 178;

tls:text.tls:line: He can then commence to set out his code of social conduct

sense.def: then; and so at that point (followed by verb with understood subject) Note that if there is an explicit subject, it is inserted after yú shì 於是

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 393; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i3; ed. ICS 1992, 71/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 178;

tls:text.tls:line: and establish it as his basis.)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 393; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i3; ed. ICS 1992, 71/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 178f;

tls:text.tls:line: Even on a remote or treacherous stretch of road,

sense.def: dark and shady, dark and secluded (like a shadowy valley); overgrown

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 393; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i3; ed. ICS 1992, 71/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 179;

tls:text.tls:line: within he knows nothing about the towns and villages

sense.def: real facts of a matter, real state of affairs; real facts of a case

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 393; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i3; ed. ICS 1992, 71/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 179;

tls:text.tls:line: Beyond the curtains and hangings,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 393; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i3; ed. ICS 1992, 71/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 179;

tls:text.tls:line: and those who tap him are numerous.

sense.def: ladle from, take the contents from

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 393; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i3; ed. ICS 1992, 71/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 179;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence, without going beyond his doors, he knows about the world;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 393; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i3; ed. ICS 1992, 71/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 179;

tls:text.tls:line: the preservation of even his own person cannot be guaranteed.

sense.def: life-time; personal survival; one's life as an individual (as someting one might lose, or which might be endangered)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 393; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i3; ed. ICS 1992, 71/15; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 179;

tls:text.tls:line: Putting the whole world under his bounty

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 393; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i3; ed. ICS 1992, 71/15; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 179;

tls:text.tls:line: Now, by lifting his heel, he is able to benefit the empire.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 394; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i4; ed. ICS 1992, 71/15; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 180;

tls:text.tls:line: Where the ruler and minister have different Ways, there is proper order,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 394; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i4; ed. ICS 1992, 71/22; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 180;

tls:text.tls:line: For this reason, when the various ministers are like spokes converging side by side at the hub,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 394; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i4; ed. ICS 1992, 71/22; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 180;

tls:text.tls:line: For this reason, when the various ministers are like spokes converging side by side at the hub,

sense.def: like the spokes of a wheel

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 394; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i4; ed. ICS 1992, 71/22; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 180;

tls:text.tls:line: For this reason, when the various ministers are like spokes converging side by side at the hub,

sense.def: converge and cooperate systematically (like the spokes of a wheel)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 394; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i4; ed. ICS 1992, 71/22; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 180;

tls:text.tls:line: Because King Wén though himself intelligent was given to consulting others,

tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 394; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i4; ed. ICS 1992, 71/22; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 180;

tls:text.tls:line: Hence if one relies on the strength of one man,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 396; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i4; ed. ICS 1992, 72/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 180f;

tls:text.tls:line: Jì cleared the land

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.16; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 396; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 2i4f; ed. ICS 1992, 72/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i1;

tls:text.tls:line: Where the cartload is heavy and the horses are emaciated,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.17; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 396; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 285; ed. ICS 1992, 72/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i1;

tls:text.tls:line: It is not as if the sage could possibly

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.17; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 396; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 285; ed. ICS 1992, 72/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i1;

tls:text.tls:line: or run contrary to what is natural

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.17; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 396; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 285; ed. ICS 1992, 72/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i1;

tls:text.tls:line: or run contrary to what is natural

sense.def: the natural course of things; what is naturally so

tls:text.tls:srcline: 未嘗不因其資而用之也。

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.17; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 396; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 285; ed. ICS 1992, 72/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i1;

tls:text.tls:line: He always takes advantage of what a thing can be used for and uses it accordingly.

sense.def: always; would always; never fail to

tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.18; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 396; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 285; ed. ICS 1992, 72/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i1;

tls:text.tls:line: That which has a specific form can occupy a position appropriate to it

tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.06.19; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 396; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 285f; ed. ICS 1992, 72/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i1f;

tls:text.tls:line: When the strength of a person lifting a burden is equal to the task,

tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.07.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 397; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 286; ed. ICS 1992, 72/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i2;

tls:text.tls:line: and preside over affairs with propriety,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.07.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 397; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 286; ed. ICS 1992, 72/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i2;

tls:text.tls:line: sycophants and villains will have no avenue of approach.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.07.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 397; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 286; ed. ICS 1992, 72/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i2;

tls:text.tls:line: sycophants and villains will have no avenue of approach.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 是故聖人得志而在上位，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.07.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 397; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 286; ed. ICS 1992, 72/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i2;

tls:text.tls:line: When a sage gets his way and is on the throne,

tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.07.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 397; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 286; ed. ICS 1992, 72/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i2;

tls:text.tls:line: those sycophants and villains who want to intrude on him

tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.07.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 397; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 286; ed. ICS 1992, 72/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i2;

tls:text.tls:line: those sycophants and villains who want to intrude on him

tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.07.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 397; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 286; ed. ICS 1992, 72/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i2;

tls:text.tls:line: those sycophants and villains who want to intrude on him

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.07.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 397; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 286; ed. ICS 1992, 72/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i2;

tls:text.tls:line: those sycophants and villains who want to intrude on him

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.07.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 397; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 286; ed. ICS 1992, 72/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i2;

tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.07.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 397; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 286; ed. ICS 1992, 72/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i2;

tls:text.tls:line: or a mouse running into a badger

tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.07.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 397; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 286; ed. ICS 1992, 72/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i2;

tls:text.tls:line: or a mouse running into a badger

tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.07.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 397; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 286; ed. ICS 1992, 72/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i2;

tls:text.tls:line: Now in every move, the ruler

tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.07.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 397; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 286; ed. ICS 1992, 72/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i2;

tls:text.tls:line: the state will be well-ordered,

sense.def: 我國家the nation including its leading clans; our nation, my nation, the nation in question, the polity; their nation

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.07.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 397f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 286; ed. ICS 1992, 72/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i2;

tls:text.tls:line: the state will be in peril,

sense.def: 我國家the nation including its leading clans; our nation, my nation, the nation in question, the polity; their nation

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.07.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 397f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 286; ed. ICS 1992, 72/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i2;

sense.def: contrary, perverse; be at odds with each other; be at loggerheads
