tls:text.tls:line: there were people who starved themselves by cutting back on their food.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.07.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 398; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 287; ed. ICS 1992, 72/20; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i3;

tls:text.tls:line: When Yáo was a common man,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 399; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 287; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i3;

tls:text.tls:line: Most of the people in the world are dazzled by name and reputation,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 399; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 287; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i3;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus recluses become exalted because of their fame

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 399f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 287; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i3f;

tls:text.tls:line: A properly ordered state is a different matter.

sense.def: it is the subject that V-s

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 399f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 287; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i3f;

tls:text.tls:line: by adhering to what they said they will do.

sense.def: achieve (public and visible success) in the service of someone or something; realise; put into practice through commendable effort in some service

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 400; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 287f; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: None of the various ministers, being like spokes in a wheel converging at the hub,

sense.def: converge and cooperate systematically (like the spokes of a wheel)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 400; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 287f; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: (Where a certain matter does not fall under the rule of law

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 400; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 287f; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: in order to discern their purposes.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 400; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 288; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: The bureaucracy renders an account of their duties

sense.def: report carefully (what oneself or others have said or done)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 400; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 288; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: For this reason, 气nd the courageous will give their all in military service.

sense.def: put in effort for; excert oneself for

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 400; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 288; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: The ruler is foolish and shortsighted,

sense.def: the ruler (in a hypothetical case); a (hypothetical) ruler

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 400; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 288; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: The ruler is foolish and shortsighted,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 400; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 288; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: The ruler is foolish and shortsighted,

sense.def: be good at seeing things, be visually talented> be intelligent; be perspicacious, be enlightened

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 400; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 288; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: and the various ministers from factions and are disloyal.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 400; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 288; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: The sophists travel about debating,

sense.def: chatter along, talk away; argue away; talk publicly; engage in conversation

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 400; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 288; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: and those who cultivate lofty conduct vie with each other for public office.

sense.def: vie for, compete for; compete in 競於; also: compete with 競於楚

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 400; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 288; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: With their cliques they criticize

sense.def: the ruler (in a hypothetical case); a (hypothetical) ruler

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 400; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 288; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: those who cultivate valor devote themselves to contention and strife.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 400; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 288; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: those who cultivate valor devote themselves to contention and strife.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 400; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 288; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: and together, forming cliques and factions,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 400; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 288; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 1i4;

tls:text.tls:line: and together, forming cliques and factions,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 400; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185;

tls:text.tls:line: Now, there are clues to be had even with

sense.def: relative state of good order or chaos; good order versus chaos

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 400; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185;

tls:text.tls:line: Now, there are clues to be had even with

sense.def: causal mechanism; crucial mechanism; underlying mechanism

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 400; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 72/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185;

tls:text.tls:line: and yet none of the rulers of the age are able to see them.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 402; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185;

tls:text.tls:line: Political authority and purchase

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 402; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185;

tls:text.tls:line: rank and emoluments

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 402; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185;

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, because the ruler dwells at the focal point of political power

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 402; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185;

tls:text.tls:line: all the people exhaust themselves in his service without feeling fatigued.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 402; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185;

tls:text.tls:line: and yet the minister will work untiringly

sense.def: cause to be dry > exhaust the resources of; use up

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 402; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185;

tls:text.tls:line: and yet the minister will work untiringly

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 402; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185;

tls:text.tls:line: and appropriated their lands,

tls:text.tls:srcline: 智伯與趙襄子戰於晉陽之下，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 402; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185;

tls:text.tls:line: When Zhì Bó was defeated by Viscount Xiāng of Zhào in battle at Jìn-yáng,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 402; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185;

tls:text.tls:line: he was killed and disgraced,

sense.def: contrastive: himself; oneself; the person him/herself (also: 身雖無能)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 402; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185;

tls:text.tls:line: and his state was divided into three.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 402; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185;

tls:text.tls:line: painted his body to look like a leper,

sense.def: body as a whole; especially the main trunk as opposed to the head; body as embodying the person

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 402; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185;

tls:text.tls:line: swallowed ashes to change his voice,

sense.def: gulp down (of liquids); swallow (food, or even a pearl); be large enough to be able to swallow

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 402; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185;

tls:text.tls:line: and pulled out his teeth to alter his appearance.

sense.def: (normally human or equine etc) front teeth, tooth

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 402; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185;

tls:text.tls:line: he in the one case abandoned his master

sense.def: on occasion; sometimes; sometimes (...but at other times...); one moment, (and at another moment...)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 402; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185;

tls:text.tls:line: while in the other case he wanted to follow his master into the grave.

sense.def: on occasion; sometimes; sometimes (...but at other times...); one moment, (and at another moment...)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 豈其趨捨厚薄之勢異哉？

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 402; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185;

tls:text.tls:line: Surely this cannot be simply a difference of choice or partiality.

sense.def: opting for and opting against, opting for or opting against; choices, preferences

tls:text.tls:srcline: 豈其趨捨厚薄之勢異哉？

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 402; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185;

tls:text.tls:line: Surely this cannot be simply a difference of choice or partiality.

sense.def: relative closeness or intensity of a relationship

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 403; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185f;

tls:text.tls:line: When the tyrant Zhòu gained complete control over All under Heaven

sense.def: unite under one's unified control; annex;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 403; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185f;

tls:text.tls:line: every corner that human footprints reaches

sense.def: footprint; traces (some examples have to be moved to n(post-N) because that N can be omitted)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 403; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185f;

tls:text.tls:line: and oars plied

tls:text.tls:srcline: 豈周民死節，而殷民背叛哉？

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 403; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185f;

tls:text.tls:line: This was certainly not because the Zhòu people died out of a sense of duty while the Yīn people turned against their master.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 豈周民死節，而殷民背叛哉？

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 403; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185f;

tls:text.tls:line: This was certainly not because the Zhòu people died out of a sense of duty while the Yīn people turned against their master.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 其主之德義厚而號令行也。

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 403; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185f;

tls:text.tls:line: It was because their ruler was bountiful and righteous and his orders were carried out.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 其主之德義厚而號令行也。

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 403; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185f;

tls:text.tls:line: It was because their ruler was bountiful and righteous and his orders were carried out.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 其主之德義厚而號令行也。

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 403; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 185f;

tls:text.tls:line: It was because their ruler was bountiful and righteous and his orders were carried out.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.16; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 403; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 186;

tls:text.tls:line: where there is thick foliage, the birds gather.

sense.def: (both of humans and of things) assemble SHIJI 百鬼集矣"all the ghosts and spirits had already assembled"

tls:text.tls:srcline: 是故臣不得其所欲於君者，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.16; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 403; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 186;

tls:text.tls:line: When the minister does not get what he wants from the ruler,

tls:text.tls:srcline: 是故臣盡力死節以與君，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.16; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 403; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 186;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus the minister barters with his ruler by offering total commitment to the point of laying down his life

tls:text.tls:srcline: 是故君不能賞無功之臣，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.17; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 403; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 186;

tls:text.tls:line: Just as the ruler cannot reward a minister who has rendered no service,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.17; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 403; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 186;

tls:text.tls:line: is like whipping an unruly horse.

sense.def: to whip; to have (someone) whipped; whip a body part

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.08.17; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 403; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 186;

tls:text.tls:line: is like whipping an unruly horse.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 404; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 186;

tls:text.tls:line: is to cultivate his person by dwelling in quietude

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 404; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 186;

tls:text.tls:line: is to cultivate his person by dwelling in quietude

sense.def: often reflexive: one's (own) person; one's (own) person and character; the Self; personality (as something cultivated by the gentleman); the character

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 404; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 186;

tls:text.tls:line: Where there is political disorder, those of superior character will not proffer their counsel,

sense.def: those who are possessed of moral worth and talent (at a certain time or in a certain place)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 404; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 289; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 186;

tls:text.tls:line: and where the ruler's bounty is not generous, those of valor will not die for him.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 404f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 290; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 186;

tls:text.tls:line: If the ruler has a penchant for predatory birds and ferocious animals,

tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 404f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 290; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 186;

tls:text.tls:line: If the ruler has a penchant for predatory birds and ferocious animals,

tls:text.tls:line: rare and exotic things,

tls:text.tls:line: if he is not sparing with the efforts of his people,

sense.def: be chary with; begrudge, be stingy with; be possessive about; be loath to lose

tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 404f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 290; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 186;

tls:text.tls:line: enjoys horses and hunting

sense.def: go on hunting parties (officially organised or not); engage in pleasure hunting, hunt for pleasure; go on some kind of hunt

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 290; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 186;

tls:text.tls:line: and there will be little material wealth in spite of hard work,

sense.def: be deficient, be in short supply 財匱

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 290; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 186f;

tls:text.tls:line: Where the ruler is fond of high pavilions, deep ponds,

sense.def: find attractive, be deeply fond of (persons, things, or courses of action); be disposed to love; be preoccupied by; like; sometimes specifically: LY 4.3 be truly fond of

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 290; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 186f;

tls:text.tls:line: Where the ruler is fond of high pavilions, deep ponds,

sense.def: terrace; square platform built on an earth-mound, raised platform 高臺

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 290; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 186f;

tls:text.tls:line: Where the ruler is fond of high pavilions, deep ponds,

sense.def: artificial lake; winding pond surrounding a platform coming close in form to a moat; meandering lake (on the edges of Heaven)深池，曲池；天池

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 290; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 186f;

tls:text.tls:line: precious stones and jewels,

tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 290; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 186f;

tls:text.tls:line: precious stones and jewels,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 290; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 187;

tls:text.tls:line: Seeing that the common people struggled among themselves,

sense.def: using （often: all one's) strength, powerfully, with one's power/strength; with all one's strength 力田 "work hard in agriculture"

tls:text.tls:srcline: 於是堯乃身服節儉之行，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 290; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 187;

tls:text.tls:line: Yáo then personally comported himself in accordance with moderation and frugality,

sense.def: At that point, Whereupon; at that time; at this time (remarkably often after direct speeech: having said this,...; then; at that point, at this juncture; at this stage (in a text); and then; subsequently)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 於是堯乃身服節儉之行，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 290; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 187;

tls:text.tls:line: Yáo then personally comported himself in accordance with moderation and frugality,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 290; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 187;

tls:text.tls:line: and elucidating the virtue of mutual love,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 290; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 187;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus it was that his roofing thatch was not trimmed,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 290; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 187;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus it was that his roofing thatch was not trimmed,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 290; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 187;

tls:text.tls:line: his rafters were not cut and finished,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 290; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 187;

tls:text.tls:line: his mats were not hemmed,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 290; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 187;

tls:text.tls:line: and his grain was not polished.

sense.def: general word for grains, especially coarse grain; grain used for sacrificing

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 290; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 187;

tls:text.tls:line: and traveled to each of the five sacred peaks.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 291; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 187;

tls:text.tls:line: precious stones, and exotic objects.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 291; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 187;

tls:text.tls:line: precious stones, and exotic objects.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 是故貧民糟糠不接於口，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 291; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 187;

tls:text.tls:line: Consequently, the poor people do not even have husks and chaff to eat

tls:text.tls:srcline: 是故貧民糟糠不接於口，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 291; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 187;

tls:text.tls:line: Consequently, the poor people do not even have husks and chaff to eat

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 291; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 187;

tls:text.tls:line: and yet the tigers, wolves, and bear fill themselves on fine meats;

sense.def: hey and grain-eating domestic animals, particularly goats, cows; pigs and dogs

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.09.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 405; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 291; ed. ICS 1992, 73/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 187;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus it is that he causes the people of the empire to become discontented with their lot in life.

sense.def: regard as conducive to peace; feel at ease with, feel comfortable with; find one's peace in; be content with; find comfort in (women and feasting)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.10.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 407; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 291; ed. ICS 1992, 74/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 187f;

tls:text.tls:line: and crane their necks and stand on tiptoe to gaze upon.

sense.def: stretch ( e.g. in order to reach something, crane (neck etc) 延頸)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.10.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 407; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 291; ed. ICS 1992, 74/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 187f;

tls:text.tls:line: and crane their necks and stand on tiptoe to gaze upon.

sense.def: front of neck, throat; whole of neck

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.10.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 407; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 291; ed. ICS 1992, 74/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 187f;

tls:text.tls:line: and crane their necks and stand on tiptoe to gaze upon.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.10.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 407; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 291; ed. ICS 1992, 74/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 187f;

tls:text.tls:line: Unless he is calm and tranquil, he will have no way of manifesting his virtue. [unless he is insipid!]

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.10.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 407; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 291; ed. ICS 1992, 74/12; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 187f;

tls:text.tls:line: Unless he is calm and tranquil, he will have no way of manifesting his virtue. [unless he is insipid!]

sense.def: be limpid, tranquil and serene; be unperturbed; be placid (like the sea)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.10.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 407; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 291f; ed. ICS 1992, 74/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 188;

tls:text.tls:line: The superior ruler in his use of men

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.10.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 407; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 292; ed. ICS 1992, 74/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 188;

tls:text.tls:line: nothing is as deadly as the herb aconitum.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.10.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 407; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 292; ed. ICS 1992, 74/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 188;

tls:text.tls:line: And yet a good doctor will put it in a pouch and keep it on hand

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.10.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 407; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 292; ed. ICS 1992, 74/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 188;

tls:text.tls:line: And yet a good doctor will put it in a pouch and keep it on hand

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.10.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 407; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 292; ed. ICS 1992, 74/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 188;

tls:text.tls:line: And yet a good doctor will put it in a pouch and keep it on hand

sense.def: put in bag; carry in a bag

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.10.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 407; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 292; ed. ICS 1992, 74/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 188;

tls:text.tls:line: And yet a good doctor will put it in a pouch and keep it on hand

sense.def: store up; take good care of; store up and collect; store up to keep safe

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.10.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 407; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 292; ed. ICS 1992, 74/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 188;

tls:text.tls:line: Even among the resources of nature's thriving forests

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.10.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 407; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 292; ed. ICS 1992, 74/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 188;

tls:text.tls:line: even a shepherd boy can give it chase.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.10.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 407; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 292; ed. ICS 1992, 74/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 188;

tls:text.tls:line: You cannot expect a person of broad abilities

tls:text.tls:srcline: 是故審於毫釐之小計者，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.10.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 407f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 292f; ed. ICS 1992, 74/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 188f;

tls:text.tls:line: For this reason, a person proficient in making minute calculations

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.10.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 408; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 293; ed. ICS 1992, 74/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 189;

tls:text.tls:line: preserve an imperiled state,

sense.def: fraught with grave danger, doomed to disaster (as a state), endangered

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.10.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 408; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 293; ed. ICS 1992, 74/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 189;

tls:text.tls:line: and revive a defunct line.

sense.def: cause to continue, cause to continue to exist

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.10.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 408; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 293; ed. ICS 1992, 74/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 189;

tls:text.tls:line: and revive a defunct line.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.10.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 408; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 293; ed. ICS 1992, 74/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 189;

tls:text.tls:line: yet all you do is demand of them details of court ceremony

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.10.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 408; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 293; ed. ICS 1992, 74/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 189;

tls:text.tls:line: on which the order and disorder of empire depend.

sense.def: relative state of good order or chaos; good order versus chaos

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.10.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 408; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 293; ed. ICS 1992, 74/16; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 189;

tls:text.tls:line: on which the order and disorder of empire depend.

sense.def: causal mechanism; crucial mechanism; underlying mechanism

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.11.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 409f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 293; ed. ICS 1992, 75/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 189;

tls:text.tls:line: The ruler

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.11.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 409f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 293; ed. ICS 1992, 75/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 189;

tls:text.tls:line: His edicts and commands are able to penetrate to the lowest level

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.11.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 409f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 293; ed. ICS 1992, 75/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 189;

tls:text.tls:line: and his various ministers are like spokes converging at the hub.

sense.def: converge and cooperate systematically (like the spokes of a wheel)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.11.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 410; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 293f; ed. ICS 1992, 75/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 189;

tls:text.tls:line: His awesomeness being established will not be put aside,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.11.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 410; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 295; ed. ICS 1992, 75/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 189f;

tls:text.tls:line: In his service the better people use their intelligence to the utmost

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.11.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 410; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 295; ed. ICS 1992, 75/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 189f;

tls:text.tls:line: In his service the better people use their intelligence to the utmost

sense.def: those who are possessed of moral worth and talent (at a certain time or in a certain place)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.11.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 410; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 295; ed. ICS 1992, 75/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 189f;

tls:text.tls:line: Those within the realm are content to follow their livelihood;

sense.def: regard as conducive to peace; feel at ease with, feel comfortable with; find one's peace in; be content with; find comfort in (women and feasting)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.11.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 410; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 295; ed. ICS 1992, 75/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 189f;

tls:text.tls:line: does not rely on his own abilities.

sense.def: emphatic or contrastive form of 其； (often but not always contrastive:) one's his/her/its own N; all of one's own (and special)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.11.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 410; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 295; ed. ICS 1992, 75/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 190;

tls:text.tls:line: can cross rivers and seas without even knowing how to swim.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.11.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 410; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 295; ed. ICS 1992, 75/1; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 190;

tls:text.tls:line: can cross rivers and seas without even knowing how to swim.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.11.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 410; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 295; ed. ICS 1992, 75/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 190;

tls:text.tls:line: Nevertheless, few of the various ministers who make their purposes known and offer their utmost in service

sense.def: HF 7.3.8: show up clearly (one's real thoughts); show through action, show in action; deploy in action; make a show of

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
