tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 415; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 299; ed. ICS 1992, 76/19; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 194;

tls:text.tls:line: passing the burden onto the ruler instead.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 君人者不任能，而好自為之，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 417; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 299; ed. ICS 1992, 76/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 194;

tls:text.tls:line: If a ruler does not entrust things to the able but is instead given to doing things personally,

sense.def: oneself, in person; by oneself (Perhaps this should be npro+V[PRED]. I do not know how one would argue one way or the other.)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 則智日困而自負其責也。

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 417; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 299; ed. ICS 1992, 76/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 194;

tls:text.tls:line: his intelligence will become increasingly taxed and he will take upon himself the burden of responsibility.

sense.def: oneself, in person; by oneself (Perhaps this should be npro+V[PRED]. I do not know how one would argue one way or the other.)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 則智日困而自負其責也。

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 417; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 299; ed. ICS 1992, 76/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 194;

tls:text.tls:line: his intelligence will become increasingly taxed and he will take upon himself the burden of responsibility.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 417; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 299; ed. ICS 1992, 76/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 194;

tls:text.tls:line: then officials charged with specific duties abandon what is proper and pander to the desires of the ruler,

sense.def: flatter, pander to (persons, or 意 "ideas") 阿意

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 417; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 299; ed. ICS 1992, 76/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 194;

tls:text.tls:line: and those in authority bend the laws and follow the inclinations of the ruler.

sense.def: officials in charge 有司皆曰 (usually the reference is definite and plural, when the word is not used predicatively)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 417f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 300; ed. ICS 1992, 76/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 194;

tls:text.tls:line: When those in charge of government commit errors through pandering to the ruler,

sense.def: flatter, pander to (persons, or 意 "ideas") 阿意

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 417f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 300; ed. ICS 1992, 76/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 194;

tls:text.tls:line: and praise and blame will sprout forth

sense.def: begin to arise, come into existence 未萌

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 418; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 300; ed. ICS 1992, 76/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 194f;

tls:text.tls:line: It is like skinning an animal for the chief cook

sense.def: to skin animals; to remove the skin from plants, remove bark from trees; peel

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 418; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 300; ed. ICS 1992, 76/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 194f;

tls:text.tls:line: or cutting wood in place of a master carpenter.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 418; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 300; ed. ICS 1992, 76/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 194f;

tls:text.tls:line: If one attempts to race with a horse,

sense.def: compete with with all one's strength to V, vie with others in Ving

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 418; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 300; ed. ICS 1992, 76/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 195;

tls:text.tls:line: the perspicacious ruler mounts the carriage,

sense.def: the enlightened ruler; an enlightened ruler

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 418; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 300; ed. ICS 1992, 77/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 195;

tls:text.tls:line: The ruler is

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 418; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 300; ed. ICS 1992, 77/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 195;

tls:text.tls:line: were he to demonstrate partiality, he would invite flattery.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 而易牙烹其首子而餌之，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 418; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 300; ed. ICS 1992, 77/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 195;

tls:text.tls:line: so Yì Yá boiled his firstborn son to gain his confidence.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 而易牙烹其首子而餌之，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 418; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 300; ed. ICS 1992, 77/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 195;

tls:text.tls:line: so Yì Yá boiled his firstborn son to gain his confidence.

sense.def: cause somebody to eat something; to feed somebody with something

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 418; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 300; ed. ICS 1992, 77/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 195;

tls:text.tls:line: The ruler of Yú was fond of precious things,

sense.def: precious possession; precious things; treasure of high personal, monetary, social or moral value 三寶

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 418; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 300; ed. ICS 1992, 77/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 195;

tls:text.tls:line: so Duke Xiàn of Jìn baited him with jade and horses.

sense.def: angle with a fishing line; metaphorical: fish up, angle for (fame etc)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 418; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 300; ed. ICS 1992, 77/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 195;

tls:text.tls:line: so Duke Mù of Qín seduced him with female musicians.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 418; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 300; ed. ICS 1992, 77/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 195;

tls:text.tls:line: so Duke Mù of Qín seduced him with female musicians.

sense.def: entice, seduce; cajole; misguide; entrap by cajoling

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 418; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 300; ed. ICS 1992, 77/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 195;

tls:text.tls:line: These men all fell under the control of others because of greed.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 418; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 300; ed. ICS 1992, 77/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 195;

tls:text.tls:line: These men all fell under the control of others because of greed.

sense.def: passivising particle: "by" 殺於人 "literally: was killed (the killing) being from/by someone else> be killed by someone else"

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 418; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 300; ed. ICS 1992, 77/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 195;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus this passage: what is firmly planted cannot be uprooted.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 419; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 300; ed. ICS 1992, 77/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 195;

tls:text.tls:line: though wood is stiff, axes cut it down;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 419; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 300; ed. ICS 1992, 77/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 195;

tls:text.tls:line: The creator and transformer alone is

sense.def: create and transform things; create transformations

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 419; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 300; ed. ICS 1992, 77/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 195;

tls:text.tls:line: The creator and transformer alone is

sense.def: the agent that creates and transforms, fashions things: the creator

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 419; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 300f; ed. ICS 1992, 77/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 195;

tls:text.tls:line: Where the spirit is fatigued, it dissipates;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.14.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 419; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 301; ed. ICS 1992, 77/7; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 196;

tls:text.tls:line: He lets them get on with their duties without telling them how;

sense.def: officials in charge 有司皆曰 (usually the reference is definite and plural, when the word is not used predicatively)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 419f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 301f; ed. ICS 1992, 77/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 196;

tls:text.tls:line: it will be easy for him to transform the people.

sense.def: in relation to, within the field of, etc

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 419f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 301f; ed. ICS 1992, 77/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 196;

tls:text.tls:line: it will be easy for him to transform the people.

sense.def: teach and transform, teach successfully; get to change to the better; educate 化民

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 420; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 302; ed. ICS 1992, 77/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 196;

tls:text.tls:line: Why? Because the important and the large should have the means

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 420; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 302; ed. ICS 1992, 77/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 196;

tls:text.tls:line: This can be likened to the five fingers which being joined to the arm

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 420; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 302; ed. ICS 1992, 77/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 196;

tls:text.tls:line: Holding the advantage in purchase means that

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 420; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 302; ed. ICS 1992, 77/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 196;

tls:text.tls:line: although what is held is extremely small,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 420; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 302; ed. ICS 1992, 77/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 196;

tls:text.tls:line: what is dependent upon it is large indeed;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 420; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 302; ed. ICS 1992, 77/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 196;

tls:text.tls:line: although what one keeps to is compact,

sense.def: be concise, be short; be constrained

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 420; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 302; ed. ICS 1992, 77/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 196;

tls:text.tls:line: what is under its control is extensive indeed.

sense.def: be wide and large, spacious (as a dwelling, or a territory)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 420; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 302; ed. ICS 1992, 77/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 196f;

tls:text.tls:line: That a pillar of ten girths

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 420; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 303; ed. ICS 1992, 77/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: cultivated the political art of the former sages,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 420; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 303; ed. ICS 1992, 77/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: even then, those who cherished

sense.def: often reflexive: one's (own) person; one's (own) person and character; the Self; personality (as something cultivated by the gentleman); the character

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 420; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 303; ed. ICS 1992, 77/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: and followed their teachings

sense.def: be full of admiration for (an ideal, a value, a thing); sometimes also: strive towards as one's main ambition; yearn for

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 420; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 303; ed. ICS 1992, 77/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: If, however, they had occupied the throne of the emperor,

sense.def: an emperor; the emperor generally (with untensed predicate)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 420; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 303; ed. ICS 1992, 77/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: rose to his feet and threw down part of his sleeve.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 420; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 303; ed. ICS 1992, 77/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: they formed an army beneath the walls of Sòng.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 420; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 303; ed. ICS 1992, 77/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: they formed an army beneath the walls of Sòng.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 420; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 303; ed. ICS 1992, 77/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: the whole state of Chǔ followed the fashion.

sense.def: HF 8.1.15: emulate (the sage); imitate; live up to; act according to

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 420; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 304; ed. ICS 1992, 77/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: If, however, a commoner or peasant

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 420; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 304; ed. ICS 1992, 77/17; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: he would not escape ridicule.

sense.def: be laughed at, be sneered at

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 422; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 304; ed. ICS 1992, 77/28; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: he will voluntarily abide by laws and regulations

sense.def: of one's own accord, on one's own initiative, by one's own intention; intentionally

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 422; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 304; ed. ICS 1992, 77/28; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: he will voluntarily abide by laws and regulations

sense.def: obey by keeping in accordance with

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 422; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 304; ed. ICS 1992, 77/28; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: he will voluntarily abide by laws and regulations

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 422; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 304; ed. ICS 1992, 77/28; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: so that those who accrod with them will benefit

sense.def: be profited; derive profit from, reap the profit

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 422; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 304; ed. ICS 1992, 77/28; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: while those who deny them will bring grief on themselves,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 422; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 304; ed. ICS 1992, 77/28; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: everyone will be in line with the ruler of law.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 422; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 304; ed. ICS 1992, 77/28; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: everyone will be in line with the ruler of law.

sense.def: abstract line; the abstract line demarkating what is legal and what is illegal

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 422; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 305; ed. ICS 1992, 77/28; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: were to attempt to lead an ox by the tail from behind,

sense.def: drag along; pull towards one; pull forward

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 422; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 305; ed. ICS 1992, 77/28; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: they would pull the tail off without budging the ox

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 422; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 305; ed. ICS 1992, 77/28; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: But if one were to pierce the ox's nose

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 422; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 305; ed. ICS 1992, 77/28; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: with a sprig of mulberry,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 422; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 305; ed. ICS 1992, 77/28; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 197;

tls:text.tls:line: even a half-grown boy

sense.def: mere (uncapped) adolescent, little brat; boy; (but note that the word can also refer to a girl)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 422; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 305; ed. ICS 1992, 77/28; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 198;

tls:text.tls:line: with a seven-foot oar

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 422; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 305; ed. ICS 1992, 77/28; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 198;

tls:text.tls:line: Because he takes the people as his purchase,

sense.def: an emperor; the emperor generally (with untensed predicate)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 422; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 305; ed. ICS 1992, 78/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 198;

tls:text.tls:line: if one gallops along with the wind at his back,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 422; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 305; ed. ICS 1992, 78/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 198;

tls:text.tls:line: With two deeds he lost the empire.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 422f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 305; ed. ICS 1992, 78/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 198;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus it is not that rightness

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 422f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 305; ed. ICS 1992, 78/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 198;

tls:text.tls:line: is able to benefit all the people in the world,

sense.def: benefit; be profitable for; provide for the good of; work for the profit of, be of benefit to

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 422f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 305; ed. ICS 1992, 78/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 198;

tls:text.tls:line: whereas Zhòu with his two deeds forfeited even the right to live as a commoner.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.15.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 422f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 305; ed. ICS 1992, 78/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 198;

tls:text.tls:line: whereas Zhòu with his two deeds forfeited even the right to live as a commoner.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 305; ed. ICS 1992, 78/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 198;

tls:text.tls:line: must first calculate the year's yield,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 305; ed. ICS 1992, 78/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 198;

tls:text.tls:line: connecting halls and towers,

sense.def: post-Han: small and delicate (normally luxury-purpose) building

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 305; ed. ICS 1992, 78/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 198;

tls:text.tls:line: are not magnificent.

sense.def: be decorative, evenly patterned, beautifully patterned, symmetrically patterned; elegant and beautiful; be magnificent, be imposing (as the sound of a drum)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 305; ed. ICS 1992, 78/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 198;

tls:text.tls:line: But where his people do not even have caves or thatched huts

sense.def: affording little space, narrrow and small

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 305; ed. ICS 1992, 78/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 198;

tls:text.tls:line: But where his people do not even have caves or thatched huts

sense.def: hut; simple hut (often built next to a tomb to house the mourner during the mourning period)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 305; ed. ICS 1992, 78/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 198;

tls:text.tls:line: in which to find shelter,

sense.def: contrastive: one's own person; oneself; himself

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 305; ed. ICS 1992, 78/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 198;

tls:text.tls:line: a perspicacious ruler does not enjoy them.

sense.def: the enlightened ruler; an enlightened ruler

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 306; ed. ICS 1992, 78/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 198f;

tls:text.tls:line: the perspicacious ruler finds no relish in them.

sense.def: the enlightened ruler; an enlightened ruler

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 306; ed. ICS 1992, 78/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199;

tls:text.tls:line: It is not that a peaceful bed and soft matting

sense.def: a bed 於床 and not necessarily 於床上

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 306; ed. ICS 1992, 78/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199;

tls:text.tls:line: and finally perish in the marshes with their bones bleaching in the sun,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 306; ed. ICS 1992, 78/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199;

tls:text.tls:line: and finally perish in the marshes with their bones bleaching in the sun,

sense.def: human bones in the living body or as part of a skeleton

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 306; ed. ICS 1992, 78/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199;

tls:text.tls:line: the perspicacious ruler finds no comfort in them.

sense.def: the enlightened ruler; an enlightened ruler

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 306; ed. ICS 1992, 78/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199;

tls:text.tls:line: he would not attire himself in fur garments.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 306; ed. ICS 1992, 78/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199;

tls:text.tls:line: Only when the harvest was good and the people had plenty

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 306; ed. ICS 1992, 78/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199;

tls:text.tls:line: and display the shields and axes.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 306f; ed. ICS 1992, 78/19; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199;

tls:text.tls:line: The ceremonies of libations and offerings were to represent their gladness.

sense.def: HF 7.3.8: show up clearly (one's real thoughts); show through action, show in action; deploy in action; make a show of

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 306f; ed. ICS 1992, 78/19; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199;

tls:text.tls:line: beating of the breast, and weeping

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 306f; ed. ICS 1992, 78/19; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199;

tls:text.tls:line: beating of the breast, and weeping

sense.def: jumping up and down; stamping the ground jumping up and down

tls:text.tls:srcline: 此皆有充於內，而成像於外者也。

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 306f; ed. ICS 1992, 78/19; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199;

tls:text.tls:line: These are all instances of the general truth that fills one inside will be given formal expression outside.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 307; ed. ICS 1992, 78/19; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199;

tls:text.tls:line: Under the reign of a misguided ruler,

sense.def: when it comes to the topic N

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 307; ed. ICS 1992, 78/19; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199;

tls:text.tls:line: and in making demands on those below he does not assess their accumulated stores.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 307; ed. ICS 1992, 78/19; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199;

tls:text.tls:line: in order to meet the ruler's demands.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 307; ed. ICS 1992, 78/19; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199;

tls:text.tls:line: The people exhaust their strength and their wealth,

sense.def: be deficient, be in short supply 財匱

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 307; ed. ICS 1992, 78/19; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199;

tls:text.tls:line: do not know where their next meal is coming from,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 307; ed. ICS 1992, 78/19; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199;

tls:text.tls:line: he nevertheless orders the striking of the great bell

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 307; ed. ICS 1992, 78/19; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199;

tls:text.tls:line: and the beating of the drums,

sense.def: knock against (mostly drums but also bells) so as to produce a sound; knock (at a gate)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 307; ed. ICS 1992, 78/19; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199;

tls:text.tls:line: and the beating of the drums,

sense.def: singing; prone to singing; prone to giving off sound, resounding

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 307; ed. ICS 1992, 78/19; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199;

tls:text.tls:line: the sounding of the reeds and flutes,

sense.def: blow, blow on, blow at; puff; play (a wind instrument); blow about

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 424f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 307; ed. ICS 1992, 78/19; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199;

tls:text.tls:line: and the strumming of the lutes and zithers.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 426; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 307; ed. ICS 1992, 78/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 199f;

tls:text.tls:line: Women and children, the old and the infirm,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 426; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 307; ed. ICS 1992, 78/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 200;

tls:text.tls:line: from three years of cultivating there is one year's surplus.

sense.def: Note that Lù Démíng reads this meaning as sì in several places of 經典釋文: provisions; food supply; staple food; food for general sustenance while at home; (e.g. beg for) something to eat; food supplies; fodder (e.g. for horses)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 426; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 307; ed. ICS 1992, 78/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 200;

tls:text.tls:line: In proportion, from nine years there should be three years' stores set by;

sense.def: WHAT IS STORED UP> reserves, provisions

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 426; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 307; ed. ICS 1992, 78/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 200;

tls:text.tls:line: from eighteen years there should be six

tls:text.tls:srcline: 二十七年而有九年之儲，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 426; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 307; ed. ICS 1992, 78/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 200;

tls:text.tls:line: and from twenty-seven there should be nine.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 426; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 307; ed. ICS 1992, 78/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 200;

tls:text.tls:line: Even in the face of the calamities of flood, drought, and natural disaster,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 426; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 307f; ed. ICS 1992, 78/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 200;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus when a benevolent and perspicacious ruler

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 426; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 307f; ed. ICS 1992, 78/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 200;

tls:text.tls:line: and his own expenditures,

sense.def: nurture, nourish, bring up, rear, take good care of, provide for; provide for the needs of; maintain, provide a maintenance allowance for, patronise; provide a mainenance allowance (of such-and-such an amount to non-children and children) (LY 2.7)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 426; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 307f; ed. ICS 1992, 78/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 200;

tls:text.tls:line: But if an avaricious and tyrannical ruler

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 426; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 307f; ed. ICS 1992, 78/26; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 200;

tls:text.tls:line: poaches on the preserves of his people

sense.def: fish profit from; exploit by irregular or immoral means (SHANGJUNSHU);

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 426; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 308; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 200;

tls:text.tls:line: people are the foundation of the state,

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 426; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 308; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 200;

tls:text.tls:line: and the state is the foundation of the ruler.

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 426; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 308; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 200;

tls:text.tls:line: The ruler of men should

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 426; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 308; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 200;

tls:text.tls:line: and the five grains will thrive.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 426f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 308; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 200f;

tls:text.tls:line: He should teach people to raise the six domestic animals,

sense.def: look after and cater for properly

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 426f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 308; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 200f;

tls:text.tls:line: to labor diligently in the cultivation of the fields

sense.def: regularly demarkated field, particularly a good and productive field, according to LIJI commentators specifically a field on which hemp is grown; field

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 426f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 308; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 200f;

tls:text.tls:line: so that on hills and slopes which will not produce the five grains

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 426f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 308; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 200f;

tls:text.tls:line: so that on hills and slopes which will not produce the five grains

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.16; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 427; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 308; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 201;

tls:text.tls:line: In the spring he should teach them to prune out what is rotten and dry,

sense.def: what is all shrivelled and dry

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.16; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 427; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 308; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 201;

tls:text.tls:line: In the spring he should teach them to prune out what is rotten and dry,

sense.def: what is whithered; what is rotten

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.16; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 427; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 308; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 201;

tls:text.tls:line: In the spring he should teach them to prune out what is rotten and dry,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.16; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 427; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 308; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 201;

tls:text.tls:line: in summer to gather the fruit and berries,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.16; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 427; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 308; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 201;

tls:text.tls:line: and in winter to cut and gather firewood.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.16; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 427; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 308; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 201;

tls:text.tls:line: and in winter to cut and gather firewood.

sense.def: HUAINAN: small firewood for igniting fire

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.16; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 427; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 308; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 201;

tls:text.tls:line: In life there is no shortage of necessities

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.17; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 427; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 308; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 201;

tls:text.tls:line: They did not allow the draining of ponds to fish,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.17; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 427; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 308; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 201;

tls:text.tls:line: the burning of woods to hunt,

sense.def: burn up, burn down; set fire to; scorch

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.17; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 427; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 308; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 201;

tls:text.tls:line: the burning of woods to hunt,

sense.def: hunt (as a professional hunter); go on a hunt, hunt as a pleasure excursion

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.18; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 427; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 308f; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 201;

tls:text.tls:line: the logging of hill forests

sense.def: (of trees) shed one's leaves; fall down and wither; fall on the ground (fruits)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.18; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 427; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 308f; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 201;

tls:text.tls:line: before the hibernating of the insects.

sense.def: cause to burn, set fire to; (slash and) burn; burn up so as to destroy

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.19; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 427; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 309; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 201;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus grasses and trees billowed forth like rising steam,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.19; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 427; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 309; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 201;

tls:text.tls:line: birds and animals rushed to their domains like a flowing spring,

sense.def: wild animals generally (not necessarily including both birds and beasts) 禽獸之皮

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.19; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 427; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 309; ed. ICS 1992, 79/8; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 201;

tls:text.tls:line: and birds of the air swarmed to them like clouds of smoke

sense.def: birds in general; birds of any kind; a bird

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.20; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 429; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 309; ed. ICS 1992, 79/18; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 201;

tls:text.tls:line: when the clouds gather from the four seas [in spring], they would repair the boundary demarcations.

sense.def: boundaries (of a state, or between fields)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.20; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 429; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 309; ed. ICS 1992, 79/18; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 201;

tls:text.tls:line: When the toads croak and the swallows alight [in the third month],

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.20; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 429; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 309; ed. ICS 1992, 79/18; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 201;

tls:text.tls:line: they would repair the bridges.

sense.def: repair, do up; keep in good shape

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.20; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 429; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 309; ed. ICS 1992, 79/18; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 201;

tls:text.tls:line: they would repair the bridges.

sense.def: colloquial: current from Han times: wooden bridge of considerable width

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.20; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 429; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 309; ed. ICS 1992, 79/18; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 201;

tls:text.tls:line: they would repair the bridges.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.16.22; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 429; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 309; ed. ICS 1992, 79/18; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 202;

tls:text.tls:line: those organs will fulfill their functions of their own accord.

sense.def: in the natural course of events; naturally; automatically; spontaneously; by itself (without any external initiative)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 430; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 309; ed. ICS 1992, 79/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 202;

tls:text.tls:line: while in his abilities he wants to have many, yet in his affairs he wants to have few.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 430; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 310; ed. ICS 1992, 79/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 202;

tls:text.tls:line: unifies all the different customs

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 430; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 310; ed. ICS 1992, 79/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 202;

tls:text.tls:line: and broods over all the people

sense.def: cover in order to protect what is covered, or sometimes to hide discreetly

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 430; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 310; ed. ICS 1992, 79/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 202;

tls:text.tls:line: With right and wrong converging as spokes he acts as the hub.

sense.def: converge and cooperate systematically (like the spokes of a wheel)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 430; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 310; ed. ICS 1992, 79/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 202f;

tls:text.tls:line: and is as inexhaustible as a deep spring.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 430; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 310; ed. ICS 1992, 79/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 202f;

tls:text.tls:line: and he fails to respond to none of them.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 430; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 310; ed. ICS 1992, 79/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 203;

tls:text.tls:line: he is upright and unbending,

sense.def: bow down in order to show submissiveness

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 430; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 310; ed. ICS 1992, 79/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 203;

tls:text.tls:line: he achieves happy results in all his undertakings.

sense.def: all; completely; exhaustively; all one after the other

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 430; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 310; ed. ICS 1992, 79/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 203;

tls:text.tls:line: "In his affairs he wants to have few" means

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 431; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 310; ed. ICS 1992, 79/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 203;

tls:text.tls:line: one whose affairs are few

sense.def: elevated style?: be few and far between; be sparse, be scarce, be few; be a rare case 不鮮 "be not so few"; 天下鮮矣 "there are few under the sun".

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 432; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 310; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 203f;

tls:text.tls:line: Of old, when the emperor would hold court,

sense.def: At the time N 昔者，古者

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 432; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 310; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 203f;

tls:text.tls:line: Of old, when the emperor would hold court,

sense.def: an emperor; the emperor generally (with untensed predicate)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 432; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 310; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 203f;

tls:text.tls:line: the common people would communicate their opinions,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 432; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 310; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 204;

tls:text.tls:line: Shùn established a notice board for criticisms,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 432; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 310; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 204;

tls:text.tls:line: his attitude toward mistakes is that

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 432; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 311; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 204;

tls:text.tls:line: Before traveling, they had no recourse to shamans and prayer masters.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 432; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 311; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 204;

tls:text.tls:line: Before traveling, they had no recourse to shamans and prayer masters.

sense.def: shamaness; (but note GUAN 女巫 ); generally: shaman; exorcist GY: 如是則明神降之〔六〕，在男曰覡，在女曰巫〔七〕。

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 432; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 311; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 204;

tls:text.tls:line: Before traveling, they had no recourse to shamans and prayer masters.

sense.def: invocator, impersonator of the dead ancestor at prayer; person in charge of ancestral prayers; prayer-master

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 432; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 311; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 204;

tls:text.tls:line: Ghosts and spirits would not dare call down evil upon them

sense.def: ghost or spirit of any kind 狀似鬼神； 鬼神無形體

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 432; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 312; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 204;

tls:text.tls:line: he did not ask whether a person is known to him or not,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 432; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 312; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 204;

tls:text.tls:line: he did not ask whether a person is known to him or not,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 432f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 312; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 205;

tls:text.tls:line: what was morally right and morally wrong in history,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 432f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 312; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 205;

tls:text.tls:line: what was morally right and morally wrong in history,

sense.def: gain an intellectual survey of, investigate comprehensively; make a comprehensive investigative survey of

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 432f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 312; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 205;

tls:text.tls:line: On the basis of this, extending his sphere of knowledge and erudition,

sense.def: for this reason, and thus, and so

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.18; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 433; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 313; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 205;

tls:text.tls:line: This would indicate that his affairs were indeed few.

sense.def: elevated style?: be few and far between; be sparse, be scarce, be few; be a rare case 不鮮 "be not so few"; 天下鮮矣 "there are few under the sun".

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.20; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 433; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 313; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 205;

tls:text.tls:line: Even so, when he was surrounded in Kuāng,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.20; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 433; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 313; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 205;

tls:text.tls:line: his countenance did not change

sense.def: facial expression, countenance; sometimes non-expressive: facial complexion 顏色黯黑 "my facial complexion is all dark".

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.20; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 433; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 313; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 205;

tls:text.tls:line: Even when in a death trap

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.20; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 433; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 313; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 205;

tls:text.tls:line: in peril of his life,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.20; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 433; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 313; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 205;

tls:text.tls:line: still upholding his principles of rightness, he was not overcome by fear.

sense.def: liji, ed. yishu 1.38a: be confused because of fear; be beside oneself with fear, be scared out of one's wits, lose one's courage

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.21; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 433; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 313; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 205;

tls:text.tls:line: when hearing cases he always came to a judgment,

sense.def: litigation; criminal law case; trial; criminal procedure 獄決罪定

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.21; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 433; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 313; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 205;

tls:text.tls:line: or presume to offer arbitrary judgments based on personal inclinations.

sense.def: reflexive and contrastive (or sometimes at least emphatic)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.17.22; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 433; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 313; ed. ICS 1992, 80/9; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 205f;

tls:text.tls:line: when he acts he is certain to fail.

sense.def: fail to win through; (of orders) go unheeded

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.18.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 436; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 314; ed. ICS 1992, i1/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 206;

tls:text.tls:line: cannot be called intelligence;

sense.def: wisdom; BUDDH: perfect insight, wisdom skr. prajñā

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.18.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 436; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 314; ed. ICS 1992, i1/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 206;

tls:text.tls:line: cannot be called intelligence;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.18.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 436; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 314; ed. ICS 1992, i1/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 206;

tls:text.tls:line: cannot be called benevolence.

sense.def: to act with accordance to Goodness; have Good behaviour

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.18.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 436; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 314; ed. ICS 1992, i1/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 206;

tls:text.tls:line: Benevolence means loving one's own species;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.18.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 436; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 314; ed. ICS 1992, i1/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 206;

tls:text.tls:line: intelligence means being beyond perplexity.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.18.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 436; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 314; ed. ICS 1992, i1/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 206;

tls:text.tls:line: The compassion of a benevolent ruler is manifest

sense.def: abstractly: "the benevolent person; the human-hearted person" at any time and in any place

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.18.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 436; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 314; ed. ICS 1992, i1/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 206;

tls:text.tls:line: even at the moment he orders a mutilation punishment;

sense.def: to be soft-hearted (towards somebody); to have compassion (for somebody)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.18.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 436; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 314; ed. ICS 1992, i1/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 206;

tls:text.tls:line: evidence of the discernment of an intelligent ruler is manifest

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.18.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 436; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 314; ed. ICS 1992, i1/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 206;

tls:text.tls:line: evidence of the discernment of an intelligent ruler is manifest

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.18.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 436; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 314; ed. ICS 1992, i1/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 206;

tls:text.tls:line: Putting oneself in the place of others and looking inward at one's nature,

sense.def: be mindful of the concerns of others, fair and empathetic

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.18.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 436; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 314; ed. ICS 1992, i1/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 206;

tls:text.tls:line: Putting oneself in the place of others and looking inward at one's nature,

sense.def: take a fair overall perspective; be non-discriminating and considerate; be sensitive

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.18.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 436; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 314; ed. ICS 1992, i1/6; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 206;

tls:text.tls:line: and understanding others from oneself

sense.def: reflexive and contrastive (or sometimes at least emphatic)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.18.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 437; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 314; ed. ICS 1992, i1/13; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 206f;

tls:text.tls:line: but the superior man controls on the basis of what is right.

sense.def: a person of superior character; the person of superior character 得見君子者斯可矣。

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.18.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 437; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 314; ed. ICS 1992, i1/13; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 207;

tls:text.tls:line: they always begin with bitter toil but bring benefit in the end.

sense.def: to work hard, toil; put in an honest effort; make a strenuous effort 甚勞

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.18.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 437; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 315; ed. ICS 1992, i1/20; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 207;

tls:text.tls:line: If you ask a blind man

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.18.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 437; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 315; ed. ICS 1992, i1/20; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 207;

tls:text.tls:line: A blind man has the means for speaking of them,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.18.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 437; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 315; ed. ICS 1992, i1/20; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 207;

tls:text.tls:line: but in distinguishing them he is different.

sense.def: discern; differentiate between; to treat as separate, to hold apart, make the distinction between

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.18.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 437; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 315; ed. ICS 1992, i1/20; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 207;

tls:text.tls:line: being filial to one's parent

sense.def: do one's devoted loyal best for N (also, by way of exception, to the people! ZUO 2.6)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.18.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 437; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 315; ed. ICS 1992, i1/20; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 207;

tls:text.tls:line: are rare indeed.

sense.def: elevated style?: be few and far between; be sparse, be scarce, be few; be a rare case 不鮮 "be not so few"; 天下鮮矣 "there are few under the sun".

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.18.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 440; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 315; ed. ICS 1992, i1/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 208;

tls:text.tls:line: and nothing as urgent as intelligence.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 09.18.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 440; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 316; ed. ICS 1992, i1/27; tr. ROGER T. AMES, p. 208;

tls:text.tls:line: But since a morally uncultivated person

sense.def: often reflexive: one's (own) person; one's (own) person and character; the Self; personality (as something cultivated by the gentleman); the character

父子、
兄弟、

tls:text.tls:line: Propriety is the means to bring about suitable conjunction between lord and minister, father and son, elder brother and younger brother, husband and wife, friend and friend.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.04.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 487; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 344; ed. ICS 1992, 93/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 29;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.04.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 487; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 344; ed. ICS 1992, 93/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 29;

tls:text.tls:line: Their singing was gleeful but lacked warble;

sense.def: song; popular song (also that of primitive peoples etc) 人聲曰歌. 歌柯也. 所歌之言是其質也. 以聲吟詠有上下如草木之有柯葉也. 故兗冀言 歌聲如柯也 Songs of humans are called gē. gē “song” is kē “branch.” The words sung, these are the substance. When using the voice one chants, the voice goes up and down, like plants and trees having stems and leaves. Thus in the Yuan and in the Jì areas they pronounce ky “sing” with a sound like kē “branch”.

tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.04.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 487; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 344; ed. ICS 1992, 93/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 29;

tls:text.tls:line: having ploughed fields, they ate.

sense.def: feed on the contextually determinate kind of substances Nm

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.04.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 487; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 344; ed. ICS 1992, 93/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 29;

tls:text.tls:line: They had no means to put forth their finery [in largesse],

sense.def: give N1 to the contextually determinate N2

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.04.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 487; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 344; ed. ICS 1992, 93/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 29;

tls:text.tls:line: They had no means to put forth their finery [in largesse],

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.04.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 487; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 344; ed. ICS 1992, 93/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 29;

tls:text.tls:line: and they did not seek to obtain [anything].

sense.def: seek to V (often difficult to distinguish from TRY...)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.04.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 487; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 344; ed. ICS 1992, 93/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 29;

tls:text.tls:line: and they did not seek to obtain [anything].

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.04.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 487; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 344; ed. ICS 1992, 93/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 29;

tls:text.tls:line: Kith and kin did not revile or flatter one another;

sense.def: one's relatives, kinsmen; kith and kin; kinfolk

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.04.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 487; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 344; ed. ICS 1992, 93/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 29;

tls:text.tls:line: Kith and kin did not revile or flatter one another;

sense.def: vilify, speak ill of without good reason; also privately: vilify, calumniate

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.04.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 487; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 344; ed. ICS 1992, 93/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 29;

tls:text.tls:line: Kith and kin did not revile or flatter one another;

sense.def: to commend as outstanding; commend for (a good quality); express approval

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.04.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 487; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 344; ed. ICS 1992, 93/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 29;

tls:text.tls:line: friend and friend did not display resentment or Virtue to one another.

sense.def: one's own friend or colleague (of of any kind, singular or plural!)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.04.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 487; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 344; ed. ICS 1992, 93/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 29;

tls:text.tls:line: friend and friend did not display resentment or Virtue to one another.

sense.def: feel a lasting aggressive anger and hatred for (often superiors); feel intensely resentful about the fact that; resent; gear a grudge against

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.04.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 487; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 344; ed. ICS 1992, 93/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 29;

tls:text.tls:line: friend and friend did not display resentment or Virtue to one another.

sense.def: be partial to and thus over-generous towards

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.04.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 487; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 344; ed. ICS 1992, 93/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 29f;

sense.def: when it comes to the topic N

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)

sense.def: when it came to the point that S, by the time that S, at the point when S

tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.04.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 487; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 344; ed. ICS 1992, 93/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 29f;

tls:text.tls:line: Both defamation and flattery flurried;

tls:text.tls:srcline: 於是乃有曾參、孝己之美，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.04.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 487; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 344; ed. ICS 1992, 93/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 29f;

tls:text.tls:line: When it came to this, one then had the excellence of Zēng Cān and Xiào Jǐ,

sense.def: then; and so at that point (followed by verb with understood subject) Note that if there is an explicit subject, it is inserted after yú shì 於是

tls:text.tls:srcline: 於是乃有曾參、孝己之美，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.04.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 487; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 344; ed. ICS 1992, 93/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 29f;

tls:text.tls:line: When it came to this, one then had the excellence of Zēng Cān and Xiào Jǐ,

tls:text.tls:line: but there arose the aberrant [conduct] of Dào Zhí and Zhuāng Ch'iao.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)

tls:text.tls:line: Truly, if one has the great conveyance and dragon flag,

tls:text.tls:line: the feathered canopy and hanging straps,

sense.def: horseman; knight; riding messenger; rider; outriders

tls:text.tls:srcline: 則必有穿窬拊楗、抇墓踰備之姦；

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.04.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 487; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 344; ed. ICS 1992, 93/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 30;

tls:text.tls:line: then assuredly one will also have the wantonness of [thieves gainning entry by] boring holes and picking locks, digging rear-mounds and transgressing rear-walls.

sense.def: the drilling of holes (in walls etc)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 則必有穿窬拊楗、抇墓踰備之姦；

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)

sense.def: pulling-out (of things from where they belong, e.g. by thieves)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 則必有穿窬拊楗、抇墓踰備之姦；

sense.def: burglary by smashing locks of gates

tls:text.tls:line: then assuredly one will also have the wantonness of [thieves gainning entry by] boring holes and picking locks, digging rear-mounds and transgressing rear-walls.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 則必有穿窬拊楗、抇墓踰備之姦；

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.04.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 487; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 344; ed. ICS 1992, 93/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 30;

tls:text.tls:line: then assuredly one will also have the wantonness of [thieves gainning entry by] boring holes and picking locks, digging rear-mounds and transgressing rear-walls.

sense.def: leap across (a wall etc), get across

tls:text.tls:line: then assuredly one will also have the wantonness of [thieves gainning entry by] boring holes and picking locks, digging rear-mounds and transgressing rear-walls.

tls:text.tls:line: Now, the frog becomes the quail,

tls:text.tls:line: Wide mansions and broad houses,

tls:text.tls:line: Wide mansions and broad houses,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.06.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 491; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 347; ed. ICS 1992, 94/19; tr. WALLACKER, p. 31;

tls:text.tls:line: Wide mansions and broad houses,

sense.def: ordinary non-main house for non-leading members of the clan; generally: house (occasionally even refers to many-storeyed 樓)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.06.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 491; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 347; ed. ICS 1992, 94/19; tr. WALLACKER, p. 31;

tls:text.tls:line: and is secure in its residence,

sense.def: settle peacefully in (a place), be at peace in (a place, also abstractly: a social position)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.06.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 491; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 347; ed. ICS 1992, 94/19; tr. WALLACKER, p. 31;

tls:text.tls:line: A pillar may not be used to pick the teeth,

sense.def: (normally human or equine etc) front teeth, tooth

tls:text.tls:line: and an ox may not be used to pursue what is swift.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.07.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 491; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 347f; ed. ICS 1992, 94/19; tr. WALLACKER, p. 31;

tls:text.tls:line: and an ox may not be used to pursue what is swift.

tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.07.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 491; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 348; ed. ICS 1992, 94/19; tr. WALLACKER, p. 31;

tls:text.tls:line: and lack a way to trespass upon one another.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.07.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 491; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 349; ed. ICS 1992, 95/1; tr. WALLACKER, p. 31f;

tls:text.tls:line: Now uncut [pieces] of jade are not sated with thickness,

sense.def: thickness 《禮記·檀弓上》："天子之棺四重，水兕革棺被之，其厚三寸。"《淮南子·俶真訓》："若夫無秋豪之微，蘆苻之厚，四達無境，通於無圻。"

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.07.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 491; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 351; ed. ICS 1992, 95/1; tr. WALLACKER, p. 32;

tls:text.tls:line: nor sink birds into an abyss.

sense.def: [CAUSE TO SINK>] submerge into (sometimes with preposed/topicalised object: 鳥沈於淵 "[nor] sink birds into an abyss")

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.07.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 491; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 351; ed. ICS 1992, 95/1; tr. WALLACKER, p. 32;

tls:text.tls:line: nor sink birds into an abyss.

tls:text.tls:line: those who lived on the water fished;

sense.def: on water 水行travel by river/water

tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.07.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 493; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 351; ed. ICS 1992, 95/6; tr. WALLACKER, p. 32;

tls:text.tls:line: those who lived on the water fished;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.07.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 493; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 351; ed. ICS 1992, 95/6; tr. WALLACKER, p. 32;

tls:text.tls:line: and on hillside and slope the fields were ploughed.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.07.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 493; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 351; ed. ICS 1992, 95/6; tr. WALLACKER, p. 32;

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, those who seceded and rebelled were few,

tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.07.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 493f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 351; ed. ICS 1992, 95/6; tr. WALLACKER, p. 32;

tls:text.tls:line: It may be compared to shaking go balls on the ground.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.07.13; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 494; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 351; ed. ICS 1992, 95/13; tr. WALLACKER, p. 32;

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, neighboring countries gaze upon one another,

tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.07.14; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 494; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 351; ed. ICS 1992, 95/13; tr. WALLACKER, p. 32;

tls:text.tls:line: "Void"

tls:text.tls:line: and "full"

tls:text.tls:line: "Not having a sufficiency"

tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.07.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 494; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 351; ed. ICS 1992, 95/13; tr. WALLACKER, p. 32;

tls:text.tls:line: "having a surplus"

tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.07.15; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 494; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 351; ed. ICS 1992, 95/13; tr. WALLACKER, p. 32;

tls:text.tls:line: it means "the people are impetuous and expenses are many."

sense.def: expenditure; cost; expense; lavish use of resources

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.08.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 494; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 351; ed. ICS 1992, 95/20; tr. WALLACKER, p. 33;

tls:text.tls:line: those who governed desires did not use desires

sense.def: make use of; make proper or meaningful use of

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.08.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 494; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 351; ed. ICS 1992, 95/20; tr. WALLACKER, p. 33;

sense.def: make use of; make proper or meaningful use of

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)

tls:text.tls:line: clothing and raiment, Rites and customs

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.09.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 496; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 352; ed. ICS 1992, 95/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 33;

tls:text.tls:line: but is one dye it with alum, then it blackens.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.09.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 496; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 352; ed. ICS 1992, 95/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 33;

tls:text.tls:line: but is one dye it with alum, then it blackens.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.09.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 496; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 352; ed. ICS 1992, 95/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 33;

tls:text.tls:line: but if one dye it with vermilion, then it reddens.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.09.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 496; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 352; ed. ICS 1992, 95/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 33;

tls:text.tls:line: but if one dye it with vermilion, then it reddens.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.09.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 496; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 352; ed. ICS 1992, 95/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 33;

tls:text.tls:line: The Nature of man is without aberration,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.09.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 496; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 352; ed. ICS 1992, 95/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 33;

tls:text.tls:line: but concupiscent desires harm it.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.09.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 496; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 352; ed. ICS 1992, 95/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 33;

tls:text.tls:line: but concupiscent desires harm it.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.09.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 496; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 352; ed. ICS 1992, 95/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 33;

tls:text.tls:line: Only the sage man is able to leave things behind and revert to the self.

sense.def: reflexive and contrastive (or sometimes at least emphatic)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.10.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 496; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 352; ed. ICS 1992, 95/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 33;

tls:text.tls:line: Now when one is in doubt while sailing in a boat,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.10.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 496; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 352; ed. ICS 1992, 95/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 33;

tls:text.tls:line: Should he see the polestar, he is awakened.

sense.def: come to understand what is going on; awaken to realityBUDDH: become enlightened

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.10.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 496; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 352; ed. ICS 1992, 95/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 33;

tls:text.tls:line: Now [one's] Nature for its part is man's polestar.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.10.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 496; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 352; ed. ICS 1992, 95/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 33;

tls:text.tls:line: If one has the means to see the self,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.10.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 496; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 352; ed. ICS 1992, 95/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 33;

tls:text.tls:line: then one will move about and be in doubt and confusion.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.10.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 496; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 352; ed. ICS 1992, 95/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 33;

tls:text.tls:line: It may be compared to swimming in Lóng-xī.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.10.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 496; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 352; ed. ICS 1992, 95/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 33;

tls:text.tls:line: Although this be so,

sense.def: nonetheless, although this may be so

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.10.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 498; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 352; ed. ICS 1992, 95/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 33f;

tls:text.tls:line: If one govern the person thus, then there will be peril;

sense.def: contrastive: one's own person; oneself; himself

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.11.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 498; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 353; ed. ICS 1992, 95/24~96/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, one who does not hear the Way

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.11.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 498; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 353; ed. ICS 1992, 95/24~96/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: Indeed, the sage kings of old

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.11.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 498; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 353; ed. ICS 1992, 95/24~96/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: were able to obtain it [i.e. the Way] in the self,

sense.def: 而自得之於己乎？(mostly contrastive:) himself, herself, themselves

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.11.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 498; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 353; ed. ICS 1992, 96/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, whenever one is about to undertake an affair,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.11.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 498; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 353; ed. ICS 1992, 96/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, whenever one is about to undertake an affair,

sense.def: whenever (note that the V can be read as an S with an understood subject in many cases: are there any cases of 凡 after an explicit subject???)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.11.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 498; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 353; ed. ICS 1992, 96/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: Should one, on this account, relax [his] methodical calculation and rely on ear and eye

sense.def: advanced practical methods (of any kind); systematic technique; methodology(!)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.11.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 498; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 353; ed. ICS 1992, 96/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: certainly his disorder shall be extreme.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.11.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 498; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 353; ed. ICS 1992, 96/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: Should one wish to obtain a correct [decision] in an affair,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.11.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 498; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 353; ed. ICS 1992, 96/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: Should one wish to obtain a correct [decision] in an affair,

sense.def: public praise; high praise (CHECK PRONUNCIATION FOR THIS READING)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.11.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 498; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 353; ed. ICS 1992, 96/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: it shall be difficult,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.12.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 498; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 353; ed. ICS 1992, 96/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: one who is laden with glee sees someone weeping and laughs.

sense.def: laugh as a sign that one is amused by what one experiences

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.12.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 498; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 353; ed. ICS 1992, 96/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: Grief allows glee,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.12.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 498; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 353; ed. ICS 1992, 96/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, we ennoble voidness.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.13.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 499; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 353f; ed. ICS 1992, 96/14; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus, the sage king having grasped the unity, let him not lose it.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.13.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 499; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 353f; ed. ICS 1992, 96/14; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus, the sage king having grasped the unity, let him not lose it.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.13.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 499; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 353f; ed. ICS 1992, 96/14; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: and the four barbarians and the nine provinces shall submit.

sense.def: barbarians which surround the whole of China in all directions

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.13.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 499; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 353f; ed. ICS 1992, 96/14; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: and the four barbarians and the nine provinces shall submit.

sense.def: the Nine Provinces (of China) [This is pervasively difficult to distinguish from the more universal and almost cosmographic notion of the Nine Continents.)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.13.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 499; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 353f; ed. ICS 1992, 96/14; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: and thus the popular mandate shall attach [to him].

sense.def: be tied to (figuratively, as hearts to a ruler)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.14.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 499; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 354; ed. ICS 1992, 96/18; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: While they do not have the accumulated wealth of the empire,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.15.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 500; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 354; ed. ICS 1992, 96/18; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: and tears emerging from the eyes

tls:text.tls:srcline: 此皆憤於中而形於外者也。
