tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.15.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 500; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 354; ed. ICS 1992, 96/18; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: are both stirred from within and given from without.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 此皆憤於中而形於外者也。

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.15.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 500; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 354; ed. ICS 1992, 96/18; tr. WALLACKER, p. 34;

tls:text.tls:line: are both stirred from within and given from without.

sense.def: feel pent-up dissatisfaction, feel indignation and unreleased anger; feel pent-up frustration; indignation

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.15.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 500; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 354; ed. ICS 1992, 96/18; tr. WALLACKER, p. 35;

tls:text.tls:line: Truly, a man who forces [his] weeping

sense.def: insist on; make every effort to; attempt with all one's force to

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.15.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 500; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 354; ed. ICS 1992, 96/18; tr. WALLACKER, p. 35;

tls:text.tls:line: and a man who forces familiarity

sense.def: insist on; make every effort to; attempt with all one's force to

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.15.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 500; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 354; ed. ICS 1992, 96/18; tr. WALLACKER, p. 35;

tls:text.tls:line: may be laughing, but he is not in harmony.

sense.def: go through the motions of a smile, cut a smiling face

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.15.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 500; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 354; ed. ICS 1992, 96/18; tr. WALLACKER, p. 35;

tls:text.tls:line: Emotions burst from within,

sense.def: real inner state; innermost feelings; real inner feelings; basic feelings; basic loyalties; sentiment

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.15.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 500; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 354; ed. ICS 1992, 96/18; tr. WALLACKER, p. 35;

tls:text.tls:line: Indeed, the jug of food of Li Fù Jī

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.15.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 500; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 354; ed. ICS 1992, 96/18; tr. WALLACKER, p. 35;

tls:text.tls:line: were worthier than the great bell of Zhì Bó.

sense.def: large suspended bell without a clapper; bell without a clapper

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.15.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 500; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 354; ed. ICS 1992, 96/18; tr. WALLACKER, p. 35;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus, no exuberant amount of Rites is sufficient to activate love,

sense.def: HF 7.3.8: show up clearly (one's real thoughts); show through action, show in action; deploy in action; make a show of

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.15.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 500f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 354; ed. ICS 1992, 97/1; tr. WALLACKER, p. 35;

sense.def: associates and friends, colleagues and friends

tls:text.tls:line: he lived with them as he would with friends and mates.

sense.def: one's own friend or colleague (of of any kind, singular or plural!)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)

tls:text.tls:line: the Yuè man cuts into the arm;

tls:text.tls:line: the Yuè man cuts into the arm;

tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.15.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 501; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 355; ed. ICS 1992, 97/1; tr. WALLACKER, p. 35;

tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.15.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 501; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 355; ed. ICS 1992, 97/1; tr. WALLACKER, p. 35;

tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.16.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 501; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 355; ed. ICS 1992, 97/8; tr. WALLACKER, p. 35;

sense.def: scholars; sometimes, especially when used in opposition to 墨者: Confucians

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.16.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 501; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 355; ed. ICS 1992, 97/8; tr. WALLACKER, p. 35;

tls:text.tls:line: [was one who] sheared [his] hair and tattooed [his] body.

sense.def: hair; human hair on the head

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.16.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 501; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 355; ed. ICS 1992, 97/8; tr. WALLACKER, p. 35;

tls:text.tls:line: [was one who] sheared [his] hair and tattooed [his] body.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.16.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 501; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 355; ed. ICS 1992, 97/8; tr. WALLACKER, p. 35;

tls:text.tls:line: [was one who] sheared [his] hair and tattooed [his] body.

sense.def: body as a whole; especially the main trunk as opposed to the head; body as embodying the person

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.16.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 501; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 355; ed. ICS 1992, 97/8; tr. WALLACKER, p. 35;

tls:text.tls:line: He faced south [in the tradition of Chinese rules] and hegemonized over the empire,

sense.def: get to dominate as hegemon, gain the ascendancy over

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.16.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 501; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 355; ed. ICS 1992, 97/8; tr. WALLACKER, p. 35;

tls:text.tls:line: came to court guiding the nine Yí [barbarians].

sense.def: the barbarians [NOT: the nine kinds vis-a-vis other kinds of barbarians!]

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.16.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 501; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 355; ed. ICS 1992, 97/8; tr. WALLACKER, p. 35f;

tls:text.tls:line: King Zhuāng of Chǔ [was one who wore] ample clothes and full robes,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.16.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 501; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 355; ed. ICS 1992, 97/8; tr. WALLACKER, p. 35f;

tls:text.tls:line: and it followed that he hegemonized over the feudal lords.

sense.def: get to dominate as hegemon, gain the ascendancy over

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.17.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 501; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 356; ed. ICS 1992, 97/8; tr. WALLACKER, p. 36;

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, one who enters a country shoule follow its customs,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.17.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 501; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 356; ed. ICS 1992, 97/8; tr. WALLACKER, p. 36;

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, one who enters a country shoule follow its customs,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.17.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 501; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 356; ed. ICS 1992, 97/8; tr. WALLACKER, p. 36;

tls:text.tls:line: and one who enters a house should avoid its tabus.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.17.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 501; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 356; ed. ICS 1992, 97/8; tr. WALLACKER, p. 36;

tls:text.tls:line: and advances [to a place] not opposing any countermands,

sense.def: (abstract, often almost metaphysical) grate against, be opposed to

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.17.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 501; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 356; ed. ICS 1992, 97/8; tr. WALLACKER, p. 36;

tls:text.tls:line: one shall have no cause for trouble,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.18.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 504; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 356; ed. ICS 1992, 97/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 36;

tls:text.tls:line: Rites are the [external] pattern for real substance,

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.18.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 504; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 356; ed. ICS 1992, 97/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 36;

tls:text.tls:line: and Altruism is the activation of grace.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.18.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 504; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 356; ed. ICS 1992, 97/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 36;

tls:text.tls:line: and Altruism is the activation of grace.

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.18.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 504; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 356; ed. ICS 1992, 97/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 36;

tls:text.tls:line: and Altruism is the activation of grace.

sense.def: manifest proof, manifest evidence; a fact that can serve as evidence; symptom, indication; visible sign; proof in practice; proof

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.18.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 504; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 356; ed. ICS 1992, 97/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 36;

tls:text.tls:line: and they provide no ground for defamation and flattery to arise.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.18.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 504; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 356; ed. ICS 1992, 97/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 36;

tls:text.tls:line: and they provide no ground for defamation and flattery to arise.

sense.def: public praise; high praise (CHECK PRONUNCIATION FOR THIS READING)

tls:text.tls:srcline:
古者，
非不能陳鍾鼓，
盛筦簫，
揚干戚，奮羽旄也，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.18.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 504; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 356; ed. ICS 1992, 97/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 36;

tls:text.tls:line: Anciently, it was not that [the rulers] were not able to lay out [many] bells and drums, fully to provide flutes and pipes, to brandish shield and battle-axe, and to wave feather and pennon.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.18.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 504; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 356; ed. ICS 1992, 97/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 36;

tls:text.tls:line: Gladness was not exceeded by sound.

sense.def: poetic and elevated in style: excel??

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.18.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 504; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 356; ed. ICS 1992, 97/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 36f;

tls:text.tls:line: and to follow and accompany the dead.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.18.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 504; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 356; ed. ICS 1992, 97/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 36f;

tls:text.tls:line: and to follow and accompany the dead.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.18.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 504; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 356; ed. ICS 1992, 97/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 36f;

tls:text.tls:line: and to follow and accompany the dead.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 以為窮民絕業而無益於槁骨腐肉也，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.18.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 504; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 356; ed. ICS 1992, 97/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 36f;

tls:text.tls:line: They thought that such [practices] merely exhausted the people and cut short patrimony but were no better than "dried bones" adn rotted flesh.

sense.def: withered, dried (of wood, earth, fish, skull)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 以為窮民絕業而無益於槁骨腐肉也，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.18.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 504; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 356; ed. ICS 1992, 97/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 36f;

tls:text.tls:line: They thought that such [practices] merely exhausted the people and cut short patrimony but were no better than "dried bones" adn rotted flesh.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.18.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 505; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 357; ed. ICS 1992, 97/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 37;

tls:text.tls:line: Words and practice are contrary,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.18.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 505; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 357; ed. ICS 1992, 97/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 37;

tls:text.tls:line: and emotion and visage are inverse.

sense.def: do the contrary, act in a way contrary to

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.18.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 505; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 357; ed. ICS 1992, 97/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 37;

tls:text.tls:line: Because of this, habits and customs are corrupted throughout the generation,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.18.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 505; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 357; ed. ICS 1992, 97/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 37;

tls:text.tls:line: and defamation and flattery sprout in the court.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.18.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 505; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 357; ed. ICS 1992, 97/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 37;

tls:text.tls:line: and defamation and flattery sprout in the court.

sense.def: public praise; high praise (CHECK PRONUNCIATION FOR THIS READING)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.18.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 505; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 357; ed. ICS 1992, 97/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 37;

tls:text.tls:line: and defamation and flattery sprout in the court.

sense.def: begin to arise, come into existence 未萌

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)

tls:text.tls:line: In Propriety we shoult accord with inherent structure and practice fitness.

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:text.tls:srcline:
禮者、
體情而制文者也。

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.18.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 506; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 357; ed. ICS 1992, 98/1; tr. WALLACKER, p. 37;

tls:text.tls:line: In Rites we should embody emotion and design patterns.

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.18.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 506; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 357; ed. ICS 1992, 98/1; tr. WALLACKER, p. 37;

tls:text.tls:line: and "Rites"

sense.def: nominalising suffix after nominal elements, marking subjects that are topics at the same time 仁者 "as for goodness" (Note the occasional presence of demonstrative pronouns as in 彼聖人者)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.19.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 507; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 358; ed. ICS 1992, 98/1; tr. WALLACKER, p. 37;

tls:text.tls:line: In the Rites of the men of [the dynasty of] Zhōu,

sense.def: the (typically elevated) people in Npl [This should probably be subsumed under the general "def.plur" semantic category, and this is easily done. However the examples form a neat set of some interest, so I keep them together. CH]

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.20.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 507; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 358; ed. ICS 1992, 98/11; tr. WALLACKER, p. 38;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus, the enlightened king prepares Rites and Proriety and [of them] makes clothing;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.20.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 507; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 358; ed. ICS 1992, 98/11; tr. WALLACKER, p. 38;

tls:text.tls:line: to follow the "Canon and Mound,"

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.20.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 507; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 358; ed. ICS 1992, 98/11; tr. WALLACKER, p. 38;

tls:text.tls:line: to give advantage to the person and body,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.20.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 507; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 358; ed. ICS 1992, 98/11; tr. WALLACKER, p. 38;

tls:text.tls:line: The belt is sufficient to knot at the tassel and take up the flaps,

sense.def: tie up; bundle together; (bind together > solidify)

tls:text.tls:line: The belt is sufficient to knot at the tassel and take up the flaps,

tls:text.tls:line: He feels no urgency in making shoes with pattern and hook, distended and short.

tls:text.tls:line: they simply see themselves.

tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.21.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 509; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 358; ed. ICS 1992, 98/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 38;

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, the personality is that upon which the Way depends.

tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.21.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 509; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 358; ed. ICS 1992, 98/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 38;

tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.21.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 509; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 358; ed. ICS 1992, 98/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 38;

tls:text.tls:line: Now when the sage man hews and trims a thing,

sense.def: At that point, Whereupon; at that time; at this time (remarkably often after direct speeech: having said this,...; then; at that point, at this juncture; at this stage (in a text); and then; subsequently)

tls:text.tls:line: Then Shùn cultivated [the art of] ruling and laid down weapons,

sense.def: vast; typical only in 洪水 'flood'

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.22.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 359; ed. ICS 1992, 98/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 39;

tls:text.tls:line: and the business of building dams and levees.

sense.def: GY: dam or dike around an artificial basin

tls:text.tls:srcline: 此皆聖人之所以應時耦變，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.22.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 359; ed. ICS 1992, 98/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 39;

tls:text.tls:line: These are all ways in which the sage man responds to the season and matches change,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.22.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 359f; ed. ICS 1992, 98/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 39;

tls:text.tls:line: At persent we know how to esteem shield and battle-axe, but we laugh at hoe and pick;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.22.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 359f; ed. ICS 1992, 98/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 39;

tls:text.tls:line: taking [the musical note] zhǐ and laughing at yǔ.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.22.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 361; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 39;

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, when the generation is different, affairs change;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.22.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 361; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 39;

tls:text.tls:line: [performed] the fēng [sacrifice] at Tài-shān

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.22.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 361; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 39;

tls:text.tls:line: and [performed] the chán [sacrifice] at Liáng-fù.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.23.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 361; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 39;

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, [the sage] were not legally bound to already existing laws,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.23.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 361; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 39;

tls:text.tls:line: is to introduce and repeal along with transformations [in conditions].

sense.def: substantial and typically irreversible transformation into something new; natural transformation

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.23.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 361; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 39;

tls:text.tls:line: is to introduce and repeal along with transformations [in conditions].

tls:text.tls:srcline: 夫能與化推移者，至貴在焉爾。

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.23.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 361; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 39;

tls:text.tls:line: Now perfect nobility lies just in this ability to introduce and repeal along with the transformations.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.23.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 361; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 39f;

tls:text.tls:line: Truly, the singing of Hú Liáng

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.23.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 361; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 39f;

tls:text.tls:line: but his means to sing

sense.def: sing a melody, sing a song, sing along (should this be vt[oN]???) often to accompaniment on the lute

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.23.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 361; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 40;

tls:text.tls:line: puffed and blew, expired and inspired;

sense.def: play an instrument by blowing into it

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.23.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 361; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 40;

tls:text.tls:line: puffed and blew, expired and inspired;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.23.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 361; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 40;

tls:text.tls:line: puffed and blew, expired and inspired;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.23.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 361; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 40;

tls:text.tls:line: puffed and blew, expired and inspired;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.23.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 361; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 40;

tls:text.tls:line: they exhaled the old and took in the new;

sense.def: to throw up food and spit it out; spit out

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.23.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 361; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 40;

tls:text.tls:line: they exhaled the old and took in the new;

sense.def: what is new; the new ones; new stuff

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.23.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 361; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 40;

tls:text.tls:line: they cherished the plainstuff and reverted to the verity

sense.def: inner integrity; what is genuine in one; genuine inner nature; genuine essence; one's true being

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.23.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 361; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 40;

tls:text.tls:line: but we imitate [their practices of] once exhaling, once inspiring,

sense.def: vomit [what one has in one's stomach], throw up [what one has in one's stomach]

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.23.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 361; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 40;

tls:text.tls:line: but we imitate [their practices of] once exhaling, once inspiring,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.23.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 362; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 40;

tls:text.tls:line: and took change and transformation to be the same;

sense.def: the various changes in the world; all kinds of change

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.23.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 362; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 40;

tls:text.tls:line: Above they were mates with the spiritual light;

sense.def: realm of the spirits; the deities, the gods; sometimes explicitly: the gods of Heaven and Earth 天地之神明

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.23.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 362; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 40;

tls:text.tls:line: below they were [fellow-] men with the creative force [of nature].

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.23.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 511; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 362; ed. ICS 1992, 99/7; tr. WALLACKER, p. 40;

tls:text.tls:line: obtaining a hundred running horses

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.24.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 514; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 362; ed. ICS 1992, 99/20; tr. WALLACKER, p. 40;

tls:text.tls:line: The Way lies in their midst, but no one knows its place [of origin].

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.24.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 514; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 362; ed. ICS 1992, 99/20; tr. WALLACKER, p. 40;

tls:text.tls:line: Biǎn Què in order to cure disease;

sense.def: mythical doctor of antiquity, on whom there is a biography in SHIJI

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.24.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 514; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 362; ed. ICS 1992, 99/20; tr. WALLACKER, p. 40;

tls:text.tls:line: Biǎn Què in order to cure disease;

sense.def: to treat a disease; to treat a disease effectively

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.24.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 514; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 362; ed. ICS 1992, 99/20; tr. WALLACKER, p. 40;

tls:text.tls:line: Chuei used it to hew.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.24.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 514f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 362; ed. ICS 1992, 99/20; tr. WALLACKER, p. 40;

tls:text.tls:line: Now [suppose] we butcher an ox and cook its meat.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.24.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 514f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 362; ed. ICS 1992, 99/20; tr. WALLACKER, p. 40;

tls:text.tls:line: Some will take sour,

sense.def: some... others (often hard to distinguish from "either... or"); some..., the others

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.24.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 514f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 362; ed. ICS 1992, 99/20; tr. WALLACKER, p. 40;

tls:text.tls:line: and some will take sweet.

sense.def: some... others (often hard to distinguish from "either... or"); some..., the others

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.24.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 515; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 363; ed. ICS 1992, 99/20; tr. WALLACKER, p. 41;

tls:text.tls:line: Some will make coffins or caskets,

sense.def: some... others (often hard to distinguish from "either... or"); some..., the others

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.24.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 515; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 363; ed. ICS 1992, 99/20; tr. WALLACKER, p. 41;

tls:text.tls:line: Some will make coffins or caskets,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.24.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 515; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 363; ed. ICS 1992, 99/20; tr. WALLACKER, p. 41;

tls:text.tls:line: Some will make coffins or caskets,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.24.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 515; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 363; ed. ICS 1992, 99/20; tr. WALLACKER, p. 41;

tls:text.tls:line: and some will make pillars or fish-weirs.

sense.def: some... others (often hard to distinguish from "either... or"); some..., the others

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.24.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 515; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 363; ed. ICS 1992, 99/20; tr. WALLACKER, p. 41;

tls:text.tls:line: By dividing and cutting we split and hew to that

sense.def: to split open without necessarily dividing the object of splitting into two separate parts.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.25.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 515; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 363f; ed. ICS 1992, 100/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 41;

tls:text.tls:line: Even though furnace and bellows and earthen mould are set out,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.25.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 515; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 363f; ed. ICS 1992, 100/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 41;

tls:text.tls:line: T'an, the butcher of oxen, dissected nine oxen in one morning,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.25.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 515; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 363f; ed. ICS 1992, 100/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 41;

tls:text.tls:line: yet [his] knife still could be used to shave hair;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.25.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 515; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 363f; ed. ICS 1992, 100/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 41;

tls:text.tls:line: yet [his] knife still could be used to shave hair;

sense.def: hair on the head of humanshair (on animals)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.25.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 515; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 363f; ed. ICS 1992, 100/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 41;

tls:text.tls:line: yet the edge was as if it were newly made and whetstoned.

sense.def: as a new measure; as a new instance, as a fresh experience; anew, afresh 新相知

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.25.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 517; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 364; ed. ICS 1992, 100/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 41;

tls:text.tls:line: Now it is like compass and square, hook and cord

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.26.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 517; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 364; ed. ICS 1992, 100/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 41;

tls:text.tls:line: He swims [i.e. roams freely] midst heart and hand,

sense.def: interstice, opening; place between transferred: opportunity;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.26.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 517; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 364; ed. ICS 1992, 100/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 41;

tls:text.tls:line: and there is no impinging on things.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.26.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 517; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 364; ed. ICS 1992, 100/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 41;

tls:text.tls:line: The blind [music] master freed his mind to physiognomize things,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.26.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 517; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 364; ed. ICS 1992, 100/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 41;

tls:text.tls:line: and he copied spirits and excelled in dancing.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.26.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 517; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 364; ed. ICS 1992, 100/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 41;

tls:text.tls:line: and the cord performs straightening.

sense.def: ink-line; [MOVE THE EXAMPLES FOR THIS: sometimes intransferred sense: the legal ink-line, the line where the permissible ends and the unpermissible begins]

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.26.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 517; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 365; ed. ICS 1992, 100/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 41f;

tls:text.tls:line: Truly, upon striking [the note] gōng, the gōng [string on a musical instrument close by] will respond,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.26.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 517; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 365; ed. ICS 1992, 100/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 42;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus, xiāo-tiáo

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.26.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 517; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 365; ed. ICS 1992, 100/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 42;

tls:text.tls:line: and jì-mò

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.26.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 517; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 365; ed. ICS 1992, 100/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 42;

tls:text.tls:line: and jì-mò

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.27.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 517; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 365; ed. ICS 1992, 100/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 42;

tls:text.tls:line: All take themselves as right and take others as wrong.

sense.def: consider (oneself) as right, consider one's own opinions as true

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.27.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 517; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 365; ed. ICS 1992, 100/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 42;

tls:text.tls:line: things which combine with the self

sense.def: 而自得之於己乎？(mostly contrastive:) himself, herself, themselves

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.27.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 517; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 365; ed. ICS 1992, 100/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 42;

tls:text.tls:line: but are seeking a combining with the self.

sense.def: 而自得之於己乎？(mostly contrastive:) himself, herself, themselves

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.27.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 517; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 365; ed. ICS 1992, 100/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 42;

tls:text.tls:line: These are the veritable right and wrong.

sense.def: true; genuine, not fake, not only apparent; veritable

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.27.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 517; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 365; ed. ICS 1992, 100/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 42;

tls:text.tls:line: Now it is like those who are right in this but wrong in that,

sense.def: take a positive attitude towards, consider as true

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.27.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 517; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 365; ed. ICS 1992, 100/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 42;

tls:text.tls:line: Now it is like those who are right in this but wrong in that,

sense.def: take a negative attitude towards, criticise

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.27.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 517; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 365; ed. ICS 1992, 100/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 42;

tls:text.tls:line: wrong in this but right in that.

sense.def: take a negative attitude towards, criticise

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.27.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 517; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 365; ed. ICS 1992, 100/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 42;

tls:text.tls:line: wrong in this but right in that.

sense.def: take a positive attitude towards, consider as true

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 517; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 365; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 42;

tls:text.tls:line: "Governing a great country is like cooking a small fresh fish."

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 517; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 365; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 42;

tls:text.tls:line: Those who are liberal and generous say,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 519f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 365; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 42;

tls:text.tls:line: [The zither] slipped past the [Duke's] lapels onto the palace wall.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 有以也夫，平公之不霸也！」

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 365; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 42;

tls:text.tls:line: And here is the reason why Duke Píng did not hegemonize."

tls:text.tls:srcline: 有以也夫，平公之不霸也！」

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 365; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 42;

tls:text.tls:line: And here is the reason why Duke Píng did not hegemonize."

sense.def: assert oneself as hegemon; become leader, preeminent ruler, or hegemon; come to act as leading person; become the leading state

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 365f; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 42;

tls:text.tls:line: He gazed on me and laughed

sense.def: go through the motions of a smile, cut a smiling face

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 365f; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 42;

tls:text.tls:line: We discussed and conversed, and did not praise [his] teacher

sense.def: chatter along, talk away; argue away; talk publicly; engage in conversation

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 365f; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 42;

tls:text.tls:line: We discussed and conversed, and did not praise [his] teacher

sense.def: engage in a dialogue; talk along, chatter

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 366; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 42f;

tls:text.tls:line: "While gazing on my lord to laugh

sense.def: go through the motions of a smile, cut a smiling face

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 366; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 43;

tls:text.tls:line: yet one [man] took him to be a gentleman,

sense.def: some... others (often hard to distinguish from "either... or"); some..., the others

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 366; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 43;

tls:text.tls:line: yet one [man] took him to be a gentleman,

sense.def: be a person of superior character

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 366; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 43;

tls:text.tls:line: and one took him to be a petty man.

sense.def: some... others (often hard to distinguish from "either... or"); some..., the others

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 366; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 43;

tls:text.tls:line: and one took him to be a petty man.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 366; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 43;

tls:text.tls:line: but when their positions are far apart,

sense.def: body as a whole; especially the main trunk as opposed to the head; body as embodying the person

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 366; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 43;

tls:text.tls:line: then those who pass consider it jealousy.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 366; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 43;

tls:text.tls:line: the difference is in the point of view.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 366f; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 43;

tls:text.tls:line: Now, although I wish to correct my person and anticipate things,

sense.def: often reflexive: one's (own) person; one's (own) person and character; the Self; personality (as something cultivated by the gentleman); the character

tls:text.tls:srcline: 庸遽知世之所自窺我者乎！

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 366f; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 43;

tls:text.tls:line: how can I know from whence the generation observes me?

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 366f; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 43;

tls:text.tls:line: Suppose I should turn about trying to transform myself and strive to run along with the generation.

sense.def: compete with with all one's strength to V, vie with others in Ving

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 366f; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 43;

tls:text.tls:line: It will be as though I were trying to escape the rain

sense.def: escape from; avoid by running away from; run away from, abscond from (difficulties, contracts etc)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 366f; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 43;

tls:text.tls:line: Now suppose one does not [seek] voidness, but is spontaneously voided.

sense.def: in the natural course of events; naturally; automatically; spontaneously; by itself (without any external initiative)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.28.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 366f; ed. ICS 1992, 100/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 43;

tls:text.tls:line: This is [a case of an aim] which cannot be brought about through conscious effort.

sense.def: covet, crave, be keen on owning (a concrete object beyond one's control)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.29.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 367; ed. ICS 1992, 101/11; tr. WALLACKER, p. 43;

tls:text.tls:line: If he is given directions,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.29.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 367; ed. ICS 1992, 101/11; tr. WALLACKER, p. 43;

tls:text.tls:line: Truly, he ends his life being menial to others.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.29.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 367; ed. ICS 1992, 101/11; tr. WALLACKER, p. 43;

tls:text.tls:line: Truly, he ends his life being menial to others.

tls:text.tls:srcline:
辟若綄之見風也，
無須臾之間定矣。

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.29.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 520; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 367; ed. ICS 1992, 101/11; tr. WALLACKER, p. 43;

tls:text.tls:line: He is just like a vane when it sees the wind without the interval of a moment it is fixed.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.30.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 522; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 368; ed. ICS 1992, 101/16; tr. WALLACKER, p. 43;

tls:text.tls:line: are [all of them, each] in his separate village and in his different province.

sense.def: be different from the contextually determinate N

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.30.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 522f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 368; ed. ICS 1992, 101/16; tr. WALLACKER, p. 44;

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, farmer and farmer speak of strength;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.30.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 522f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 368; ed. ICS 1992, 101/16; tr. WALLACKER, p. 44;

tls:text.tls:line: Each takes security in his Nature,

sense.def: regard as conducive to peace; feel at ease with, feel comfortable with; find one's peace in; be content with; find comfort in (women and feasting)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.30.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 523; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 369; ed. ICS 1992, 101/16; tr. WALLACKER, p. 44;

tls:text.tls:line: In differentiating forms and distinguishing kinds,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.31.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 523; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 369; ed. ICS 1992, 101/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 44;

tls:text.tls:line: and the enlightened master does not seek [such abilities] among the inferiors.

sense.def: the enlightened ruler; an enlightened ruler

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.31.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 523; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 369; ed. ICS 1992, 101/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 44;

tls:text.tls:line: are the highflown practices of scholars,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.31.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 523; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 369; ed. ICS 1992, 101/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 44;

tls:text.tls:line: Spiritual triggers and covert closures,

sense.def: contraption, mechanical device; triggering contraption; mechanical device

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.31.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 523; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 369; ed. ICS 1992, 101/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 44;

tls:text.tls:line: Gōng-sūn Lóng twisted debate and countered the words [of his opponents],

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.31.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 523; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 369; ed. ICS 1992, 101/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 44;

tls:text.tls:line: separated the same from the different

sense.def: discern; differentiate between; to treat as separate, to hold apart, make the distinction between

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.31.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 523; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 369; ed. ICS 1992, 101/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 44;

tls:text.tls:line: separated the same from the different

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.31.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 523; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 369; ed. ICS 1992, 101/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 44;

tls:text.tls:line: and placed hardness and whiteness apart.

sense.def: hold apart, distinguish; be separate from; be divorced from; be separable from

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.31.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 523; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 369; ed. ICS 1992, 101/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 44;

tls:text.tls:line: and placed hardness and whiteness apart.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.31.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 523; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 369; ed. ICS 1992, 101/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 44;

tls:text.tls:line: and placed hardness and whiteness apart.

sense.def: the hard and the white> different but compatible features of things

tls:text.tls:srcline: 北人无擇非舜而自投清泠之淵，

tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.31.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 523; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 369; ed. ICS 1992, 101/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 44;

tls:text.tls:line: Beǐ-rén Wú-zé [on being offered the empire] criticized [the Emperor] Shùn and threw himself into the clear, cool pond.

tls:text.tls:line: Beǐ-rén Wú-zé [on being offered the empire] criticized [the Emperor] Shùn and threw himself into the clear, cool pond.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 北人无擇非舜而自投清泠之淵，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.31.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 523; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 369; ed. ICS 1992, 101/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 44;

tls:text.tls:line: Beǐ-rén Wú-zé [on being offered the empire] criticized [the Emperor] Shùn and threw himself into the clear, cool pond.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.31.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 523; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 369; ed. ICS 1992, 101/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 44;

tls:text.tls:line: Truly, heights which cannot be reached

sense.def: be equalled, be caught up with

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.31.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 523; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 369; ed. ICS 1992, 101/23; tr. WALLACKER, p. 44;

tls:text.tls:line: and practices which cannot be attained

sense.def: be lived up to, be reached; be matched

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.32.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 523; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 369f; ed. ICS 1992, 102/5; tr. WALLACKER, p. 44f;

tls:text.tls:line: The sage man will not use him

sense.def: the person of extraordinary and creative talent (with untensed predicate)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.32.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 523; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 369f; ed. ICS 1992, 102/5; tr. WALLACKER, p. 44f;

tls:text.tls:line: The enlightened master will not rely on him

sense.def: the enlightened ruler; an enlightened ruler

tls:text.tls:line: Thus, if a country is well-governed, it may be guarded even with stupidity;

sense.def: be in good order; be well-governed, be well-ordered; of persons: be in good shape

tls:text.tls:srcline: 然不待古之英俊，而人自足者，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.32.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 525f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 370; ed. ICS 1992, 102/5; tr. WALLACKER, p. 45;

tls:text.tls:line: However, a man who says that he will not wait for the briliant heroes of old and who is self-sufficient [as regards] human resources

tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.32.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 525f; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 370; ed. ICS 1992, 102/5; tr. WALLACKER, p. 45;

tls:text.tls:line: a poor horse [may take] ten stages,

sense.def: of horses (and sometimes men): weak, of bad quality, not very useful

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.33.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 526; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 370; ed. ICS 1992, 102/5; tr. WALLACKER, p. 45;

tls:text.tls:line: If the people are troubled by the three burdens,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.33.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 526; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 370; ed. ICS 1992, 102/5; tr. WALLACKER, p. 45;

tls:text.tls:line: Why is this?

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.33.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 526; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 370; ed. ICS 1992, 102/5; tr. WALLACKER, p. 45;

tls:text.tls:line: "If a bird is in extremity, he pecks;

sense.def: feel cornered; be in extreme distress

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.33.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 526; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 370; ed. ICS 1992, 102/5; tr. WALLACKER, p. 45;

tls:text.tls:line: if a beast is in extremity, he butts;

sense.def: feel cornered; be in extreme distress

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.33.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 526; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 370; ed. ICS 1992, 102/5; tr. WALLACKER, p. 45;

tls:text.tls:line: if a man is in extremity, he fabricates."

sense.def: feel cornered; be in extreme distress

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.34.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 526; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 370; ed. ICS 1992, 102/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 45;

tls:text.tls:line: is just like the sun and moon.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.34.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 526; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 370; ed. ICS 1992, 102/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 45;

tls:text.tls:line: is just like the sun and moon.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.34.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 526; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 370; ed. ICS 1992, 102/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 45;

tls:text.tls:line: is just like the sun and moon.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.34.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 526; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 370; ed. ICS 1992, 102/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 45;

tls:text.tls:line: even galloping and dashing a thousand lǐ,

sense.def: gallop for; gallop through; gallop the distance of

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.34.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 526; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 370; ed. ICS 1992, 102/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 45;

tls:text.tls:line: defaming and flattering lie in custom.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.34.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 526; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 370; ed. ICS 1992, 102/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 45;

tls:text.tls:line: defaming and flattering lie in custom.

sense.def: public praise; high praise (CHECK PRONUNCIATION FOR THIS READING)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.34.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 526; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 370; ed. ICS 1992, 102/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 45f;

tls:text.tls:line: The accumulated practices and amassed goodness of [the rulers] Tāng and Wǔ

sense.def: pile up; assemble; accumulate; increase manyfold

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.34.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 526; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 370; ed. ICS 1992, 102/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 45f;

tls:text.tls:line: but should we wish [to equal] their accomplishment as hegemon kings,

sense.def: characterstic of a hegemon; characterised by the features of a hegemon

tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.34.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 528; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 370; ed. ICS 1992, 102/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 46;

tls:text.tls:line: Assuming the status of Son of Heaven

sense.def: an emperor; the emperor generally (with untensed predicate)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.34.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 528; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 370; ed. ICS 1992, 102/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 46;

tls:text.tls:line: it was because he was setting disorder aright.

sense.def: cause to be proper; to correct

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.34.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 528; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 372; ed. ICS 1992, 102/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 46;

tls:text.tls:line: Duke Wén of Jìn brought together the feudal lords from a leather [war] cahriot,

tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.34.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 528; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 372; ed. ICS 1992, 102/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 46;

tls:text.tls:line: Yet [Yán Ho] bored through the rear-wall and evaded him.

tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.34.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 528; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 372; ed. ICS 1992, 102/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 46;

sense.def: close to third-person pronoun: an individual; (with contrasting noun in parallel phrase: 其身the person; a person (physically))

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.34.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 528; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 372; ed. ICS 1992, 102/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 46;

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, men who set up merit are slightful toward practice

tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.34.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 528; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 372; ed. ICS 1992, 102/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 46;

tls:text.tls:line: but are attentive toward season.

sense.def: pay diligent attention to, pay close attention to; be carefully attentive to

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.35.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 528; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 372; ed. ICS 1992, 102/24; tr. WALLACKER, p. 46f;

tls:text.tls:line: consider dying for [one's] duty to be foolishness.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 非不知被髮佯狂以免其身也，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.35.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 528; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 372; ed. ICS 1992, 103/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 47;

tls:text.tls:line: did not know that Qí-zǐ wore [his] hair [down the back] and feigned insanity so that he [Qí-zi] might be exempt [from punishment].

sense.def: life-time; personal survival; one's life as an individual (as someting one might lose, or which might be endangered)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 然而樂直行盡忠以死節，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.35.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 528; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 372; ed. ICS 1992, 103/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 47;

tls:text.tls:line: Though this was so, [Wáng-zǐ Bǐ-gān] took pleasure in upright practice and fulfilled loyalty to die for [his] duty

tls:text.tls:srcline: 然而樂離世伉行以絕眾，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.35.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 528; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 373; ed. ICS 1992, 103/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 47;

tls:text.tls:line: Though this was so, they took pleasure in departing from the generation and [engaging in] lofty practices to cut [themselves] off from the multitude,

sense.def: leave the world> be detached from this world; be above the ordinary standards of the world (Compare 離世紛 in TYM.)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 然而樂離世伉行以絕眾，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.35.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 528; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 373; ed. ICS 1992, 103/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 47;

tls:text.tls:line: Though this was so, they took pleasure in departing from the generation and [engaging in] lofty practices to cut [themselves] off from the multitude,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.35.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 528; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 373; ed. ICS 1992, 103/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 47;

tls:text.tls:line: Though this was so, they were ashamed to disturb their harmonious state with [material] things

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.35.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 529; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 373; ed. ICS 1992, 103/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 47;

tls:text.tls:line: Action and non-action negate each other,

sense.def: opting for and opting against, opting for or opting against; choices, preferences

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.35.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 529; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 373; ed. ICS 1992, 103/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 47;

tls:text.tls:line: Action and non-action negate each other,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.35.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 529; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 373; ed. ICS 1992, 103/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 47;

tls:text.tls:line: Action and non-action negate each other,

sense.def: rejection (of a choice), discarding (of something one does not like)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.35.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 529; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 373; ed. ICS 1992, 103/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 47;

tls:text.tls:line: but each man takes pleasure in his endeavor.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.35.07; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 529; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 373; ed. ICS 1992, 103/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 47;

tls:text.tls:line: the fish, on hearing it, will hide in the deep."

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.35.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 529; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 374; ed. ICS 1992, 103/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 47f;

tls:text.tls:line: Now those who [attach] importance to life do not harm themselves by profiting;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.35.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 529; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 374; ed. ICS 1992, 103/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 47f;

tls:text.tls:line: Now those who [attach] importance to life do not harm themselves by profiting;

sense.def: reflexive and contrastive (or sometimes at least emphatic)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.35.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 529; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 374; ed. ICS 1992, 103/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 47f;

tls:text.tls:line: those who covert emoluments see only profit and do not look back at the person;

sense.def: take notice of (one's own life, oneself)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.35.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 529; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 374; ed. ICS 1992, 103/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 47f;

tls:text.tls:line: those who covert emoluments see only profit and do not look back at the person;

sense.def: life-time; personal survival; one's life as an individual (as someting one might lose, or which might be endangered)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.35.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 529; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 374; ed. ICS 1992, 103/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 48;

tls:text.tls:line: Now the flying birds master nests,

sense.def: birds in general; birds of any kind; a bird

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.35.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 529; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 374; ed. ICS 1992, 103/4; tr. WALLACKER, p. 48;

tls:text.tls:line: and foxes master caves.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.36.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 532; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 374; ed. ICS 1992, 103/19; tr. WALLACKER, p. 48;

tls:text.tls:line: Its affairs are carried through to completion but are not entangled;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.36.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 532; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 374; ed. ICS 1992, 103/19; tr. WALLACKER, p. 48;

tls:text.tls:line: Those who seek goods vie over those which are difficult to acquire帨hey consider them treasures.

sense.def: most important thing, objectively most valuable thing 諸侯之寶三

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.36.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 532; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 374; ed. ICS 1992, 103/19; tr. WALLACKER, p. 48;

tls:text.tls:line: "If a strong goodman is of stout age and does not plough,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.36.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 532; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 374; ed. ICS 1992, 103/19; tr. WALLACKER, p. 48;

tls:text.tls:line: "If a strong goodman is of stout age and does not plough,

sense.def: male adult of working age (not too old and not too young)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.36.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 532; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 374; ed. ICS 1992, 103/19; tr. WALLACKER, p. 48;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus, he took it to be of prior importance in the empire

sense.def: in person, personally and not as represented by anyone else

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.36.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 532; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 374; ed. ICS 1992, 103/19; tr. WALLACKER, p. 48;

tls:text.tls:line: Thus, he took it to be of prior importance in the empire

sense.def: do agricultural work; to plough the fields

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.36.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 532; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 374f; ed. ICS 1992, 103/19; tr. WALLACKER, p. 48f;

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, those not forceful in their ploughing

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.36.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 532; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 374f; ed. ICS 1992, 103/19; tr. WALLACKER, p. 48f;

tls:text.tls:line: lacked the wherewithal to cover the form.

sense.def: cover (e.g. ears, so as to make unable to interact with the outside); hide; retrace (their own traces); block up;

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.36.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 533; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 375; ed. ICS 1992, 103/28; tr. WALLACKER, p. 49;

tls:text.tls:line: they ennoble good of far quarters

sense.def: goods, commodities; luxury goods, luxury items; especially: items made of metal or jade

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.36.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 533; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 375; ed. ICS 1992, 103/28; tr. WALLACKER, p. 49;

tls:text.tls:line: and prize wealth which is difficult to acquire.

sense.def: consider as precious; appreciate as worthy of appreciation

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.36.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 533; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 375; ed. ICS 1992, 103/28; tr. WALLACKER, p. 49;

tls:text.tls:line: and prize wealth which is difficult to acquire.

sense.def: moveable material wealth in the form of the necessities of life, including luxury items like silk; property

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.36.08; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 533; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 375; ed. ICS 1992, 103/28; tr. WALLACKER, p. 49;

tls:text.tls:line: They dilute the thick [substance] of all under heaven;

sense.def: make wet, pour water on; irrigate

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.36.09; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 533; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 375; ed. ICS 1992, 103/28; tr. WALLACKER, p. 49;

tls:text.tls:line: Nature and fate fly and rise up, and all are disordered into confusion.

sense.def: read yíng: loanword for : be confused

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.36.10; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 533; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 375; ed. ICS 1992, 103/28; tr. WALLACKER, p. 49;

tls:text.tls:line: fodder-feeders and grain-feeders, spiked-millet and panicled-millet,

sense.def: hey and grain-eating domestic animals, particularly goats, cows; pigs and dogs

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.36.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 533; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 375; ed. ICS 1992, 103/28; tr. WALLACKER, p. 49;

tls:text.tls:line: Rites and moderation, slander and criticism

sense.def: criticism; public criticism; public blame; points of public criticism

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.36.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 533; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 375; ed. ICS 1992, 103/28; tr. WALLACKER, p. 49;

tls:text.tls:line: Rites and moderation, slander and criticism

sense.def: public argument; argumentative point of view; public dissent

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.36.11; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 533; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 375; ed. ICS 1992, 103/28; tr. WALLACKER, p. 49;

tls:text.tls:line: to confuse their hearts.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.36.12; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 533; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 375; ed. ICS 1992, 103/28; tr. WALLACKER, p. 49;

tls:text.tls:line: Then, the Hundred Surnames boil like gruel and are in wild disorder.

sense.def: At that point, Whereupon; at that time; at this time (remarkably often after direct speeech: having said this,...; then; at that point, at this juncture; at this stage (in a text); and then; subsequently)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.37.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 533; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 375; ed. ICS 1992, 104/6; tr. WALLACKER, p. 49;

tls:text.tls:line: the horse adorments feature yak-tail and ivory.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.37.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 533; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 375; ed. ICS 1992, 104/6; tr. WALLACKER, p. 49;

tls:text.tls:line: the horse adorments feature yak-tail and ivory.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.37.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 533; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 375; ed. ICS 1992, 104/6; tr. WALLACKER, p. 49;

tls:text.tls:line: [There are] curtains and canopies, carpets and mats,

sense.def: ZUO Xuan 17: area sealed off by curtains, tent (without roof) to prevent outsiders from seeing what is going on inside; certain

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.37.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 533; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 375; ed. ICS 1992, 104/6; tr. WALLACKER, p. 49;

tls:text.tls:line: [There are] curtains and canopies, carpets and mats,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.37.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 533; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 375; ed. ICS 1992, 104/6; tr. WALLACKER, p. 49;

tls:text.tls:line: [There are] curtains and canopies, carpets and mats,

sense.def: large mattress to sit or sleep on; (also used in vehicles)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.37.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 533; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 375; ed. ICS 1992, 104/6; tr. WALLACKER, p. 49;

tls:text.tls:line: and snock-frock rough wool do not cover the form,

sense.def: cover (e.g. ears, so as to make unable to interact with the outside); hide; retrace (their own traces); block up;

tls:text.tls:srcline: 故其為編戶齊民無以異，

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.37.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 533; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 376; ed. ICS 1992, 104/6; tr. WALLACKER, p. 49;

tls:text.tls:line: Truly, one cannot differentialt them. They are like a row of doors, people on a par.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.37.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 533; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 376; ed. ICS 1992, 104/6; tr. WALLACKER, p. 49;

tls:text.tls:line: is like that between a lord of men and a captive slave

sense.def: work-slave (who was often a foreigner and/or prisoner)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.37.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 536; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 376; ed. ICS 1992, 104/6; tr. WALLACKER, p. 49f;

tls:text.tls:line: Now those who ride along on their odd skills and perform what is aberrant and awry

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.37.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 536; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 376; ed. ICS 1992, 104/6; tr. WALLACKER, p. 49f;

tls:text.tls:line: are sufficient to themselves within one generation.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.37.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 536; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 376; ed. ICS 1992, 104/6; tr. WALLACKER, p. 50;

tls:text.tls:line: and feminine crafts are wounded,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.38.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 536; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 376; ed. ICS 1992, 104/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 50;

tls:text.tls:line: even the brave and martial will flee and run away,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.38.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 536; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 376; ed. ICS 1992, 104/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 50;

tls:text.tls:line: even the brave and martial will flee and run away,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.38.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 536; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 376; ed. ICS 1992, 104/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 50;

tls:text.tls:line: even the brave and martial will flee and run away,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.38.01; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 536; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 376; ed. ICS 1992, 104/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 50;

tls:text.tls:line: and the leader is not able to stop [them].

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.38.02; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 536; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 376; ed. ICS 1992, 104/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 50;

tls:text.tls:line: They compete to ascend hillside and slope,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.38.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 536; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 376f; ed. ICS 1992, 104/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 50;

tls:text.tls:line: they grieve even for them.

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.38.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 536; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 376f; ed. ICS 1992, 104/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 50;

tls:text.tls:line: they grieve even for them.

sense.def: show one's grief about something as a sign of mourning

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.38.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 536; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 376f; ed. ICS 1992, 104/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 50;

tls:text.tls:line: If [one's] person is in peril, then he forgets his own kith and kin,

sense.def: contrastive: himself; oneself; the person him/herself (also: 身雖無能)

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.38.03; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 536; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 376f; ed. ICS 1992, 104/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 50;

tls:text.tls:line: If [one's] person is in peril, then he forgets his own kith and kin,

sense.def: one's relatives, kinsmen; kith and kin; kinfolk

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.38.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 536; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 377; ed. ICS 1992, 104/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 50;

tls:text.tls:line: One who is swimming is not able to pull up a drowning man,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.38.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 536; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 377; ed. ICS 1992, 104/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 50;

tls:text.tls:line: One who is swimming is not able to pull up a drowning man,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.38.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 536; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 377; ed. ICS 1992, 104/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 50;

tls:text.tls:line: One who is swimming is not able to pull up a drowning man,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.38.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 536; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 377; ed. ICS 1992, 104/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 50;

tls:text.tls:line: for his own hands and feet are urgently needed.

sense.def: need urgently; be preoccupied by the need of

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.38.04; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 536; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 377; ed. ICS 1992, 104/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 50;

tls:text.tls:line: One who is being burned is not able to rescue [others] from the fire,

sense.def: get slightly burnt by a small amount of fire

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.38.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 536; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 377; ed. ICS 1992, 104/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 50;

tls:text.tls:line: If one knocks on a gate seeking water or fire

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.38.05; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 536; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 377; ed. ICS 1992, 104/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 50;

tls:text.tls:line: and on the lakes they do not peddle fish,

sense.def: try to sell, offer for sale; trade in

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.38.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 536; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 377; ed. ICS 1992, 104/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 50f;

tls:text.tls:line: Truly, if the generation is well-governed, then even petty men hold to correctness,

tls:line.title: 淮南子(en)
tls:line.loc: HNZ 11.38.06; ed. Che2n Gua3ngzho4ng 1993, p. 536; ed. Liu2 We2ndia3n 1989, p. 377; ed. ICS 1992, 104/15; tr. WALLACKER, p. 50f;

tls:text.tls:line: If the generation is in disorder, then even gentlemen become wanton,

sense.def: the men of noble character (of a certain time or place) [predicate tensed] 古之君子
